Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Program Head: Sports and Games 

Dates of Employment 

Start Date: June 24th 2022 

End Date: September 3rd 2022 

Location: Belwood, Ontario 

 

The Camp 

Belwood Lodge and Camp is a camp for people with intellectual disabilities. Belwood Lodge and Camp is located just outside of Fergus, Ontario on beautiful Belwood Lake. Belwood Lodge and Camp first opened in 1946 and has had a strong reputation as a place for people with all abilities to feel safe and at home. Belwood Lodge and Camp prides itself on the quality camp experience provided to campers. Campers at Belwood Lodge and Camp include children, teens, and adults.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: Belwood Lodge and Camp is seeking a Program Head: Sports and Games who reports to the Program Director. The Program Head: Sports and Games is in charge of creating and implementing sports based programming at camp. This position facilitates all sports based programming at camp with the assistance of other staff. The Program Head: Sports and Games should have experience facilitating physical activity games for people with a range of abilities. The goal of sports and games based programming at camp is to get all people active in a safe and fun manner.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What we are looking for: 

Positive mindset  

An interest in working with people with disabilities 

Understanding of how to alter games to make them more accessible 

Experience providing programming to people with a range of abilities 

Knowledge of facilitating small and large group programming 

Strong interpersonal skills  

Ability to problem solve in a fast paced environment 

Camp experience an asset 

Experience in a leadership role an asset 

Must be willing to show proof of Covid-19 vaccination status

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
A Career with Bird
  

Bird has been in the construction industry for over 100 years and has facilitated the building of careers each step of the way. We are proud of what we have accomplished together and are looking forward to the next 100 years. 

Our organization will provide you with the right opportunity to gain practical, hands on experience, foster teamwork and collaboration as well as leveraging your existing capabilities and develop new skills to further personal growth and career transformation. 

Your career at Bird can progress in any direction and we encourage you to gather experience in all areas of our business. We want your career with us to be successful, and you can trust that we will work with you to realize your career goals. As a student at Bird, you will have the opportunity to build your professional network, give back to the community, and gain industry insights from leaders.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
What you'll be working on 

 

Our internships and Co-ops are designed to provide you with a business relevant project that will allow you to independently manage your own area of responsibility, while receiving support from an assigned Supervisor and Technical Mentor. We'll help you discover your strengths and development areas in a challenging, fun, and supportive work environment. 

 

Projects are scoped in alignment with your term length, and typically focus on a current construction project.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Who we need on our team 

 

Engineering:

 

  
	 
 You are currently enrolled in Civil, or Architectural Engineering and will complete at least one more semester of education following your internship and possess a GPA of 3.0 or higher
	 
 Ability to lead and operate within an environment where change happens frequently
	 
 Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
	 
 Exemplify the Ideal Team Player - Hungry, Humble, Smart
	 
 Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
	 
 Sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals
	 
 Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude
	 
 Residency, or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Bird Construction or one of our wholly owned subsidiaries
	 
 If you are selected for a role in a safety-sensitive position, you will be required to successfully complete a Medical and/or Alcohol & Drug tests
	 
 All applications must include a current transcript

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Policy  

Bird is committed to providing a healthy and safe work environment by sustaining the strong safety culture that our clients and contractors have come to trust. As such, all full-time and part-time salaried staff employed by Bird, and any of its subsidiary or affiliated corporations (collectively, "Bird"), are required to comply with Bird's COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Policy. Effective December 1, 2021, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or provide proof of a negative COVID-19 test result every three days at their own cost. All documentation submitted in relation to this Policy will only be reviewed by those responsible for the administration of this Policy and will be treated as private and confidential in accordance with the company's policies and guidelines.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures. 

  

On a global scale, we provide a full range of retail and wholesale property and casualty brokerage and alternative risk transfer services, extensive employee benefits consulting, and actuarial services. Gallagher also offers claims and information management, risk control consulting and appraisal services, human resources consulting, and retirement services to clients around the world. 

  

Gallagher was the only insurance brokerage company recognized as one of 2021's World's Most Ethical companies by Ethisphere; which is the tenth consecutive year we have been honoured to receive this distinction. 

  

Your Summer at Gallagher 

  

Our internship program is looking for driven individuals interested in exploring a career in sales that is rewarding personally, professionally, and financially. The Gallagher Sales Internship Program is a robust 12 week program offered between May to August.  The Internship will be connected to one of our Gallagher Canada offices. The focus will be to gain a well-rounded understanding of the insurance brokerage industry and broad understanding of commercial insurance and commercial sales strategies.   We will offer you a comprehensive "learning by doing" experience by including short-term projects and assignments as well as networking and sales challenges. 

  

Nearly all of our entry-level producer hires first experienced Arthur J. Gallagher & Co. as an intern. We are very proud of this fact, and think it speaks volumes about our one-of-a-kind Company and culture.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Program Overview 

  

The Gallagher Sales Internship Program provides an inside look into the full time role of a producer or consultant. Interns work side by side with Gallagher professionals to experience our "learn by doing" culture through: 

 
 

  
	 
 Understanding Consultative Selling: Shadowing Gallagher producers, consultants and underwriting teams as they meet with clients and prospects to gain a better understanding of Gallagher's sales and marketing process
	 
 Professional Development: Attending various weekly training engagements to further develop critical qualities of a successful client service and sales professional (i.e. communications, business etiquette, etc.)
	 
 Building Professional Acumen: Learning about Gallagher's Risk Management, Benefits, Wholesale and Claims businesses to gain a better understanding of clients' needs and opportunities for growth
	 
 Culture: Adopting Gallagher's unique culture, the "Gallagher Way" on how to ethically serve our external and internal clientele
	 
 Being a Team Player: Assisting in various regional and/or branch projects to support Gallagher's sales and service initiatives. Provide assistance with various miscellaneous office projects
	 
 One-on-one coaching and mentoring programs 
	 
 Sales Challenge and Mock proposal meetings
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Qualifications 

 
 

  
	 
 Rising first, second or third year university or college students
	 
 Strong passion and curiosity for a career in insurance sales and risk management
	 
 Competitive spirit and desire to demonstrate high energy and enthusiasm on-the-job
	 
 Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
	 
 Strong interpersonal skills, organizational skills and ability to multitask
	 
 Active participant in a competitive and/or sales-based environment
	 
 Desire to work, learn and grow within an entrepreneurial environment
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information:: For the duration of the Sales Internship, successful candidates will receive a base salary which is paid semi monthly and vacation days.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Job Summary 

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, smart people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? 

 

As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unrivaled and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and encourage millions of Apple's customers every single day. Apple is looking for a talented and motivated Design Verification Intern to be apart of a highly talented team. You will be at the heart of the chip design effort collaborating with all disciplines (vertical product model) with critical impact in getting functional products to millions of customers quickly.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Description 

·      Ensuring the quality of the SOC  

·      Working closely with the team to review specifications, develop attributes, tests & coverage plans, and define methodology & test benches  

·      Teaming up with the design and micro-architecture teams to understand the functional and performance goals of the design  

·      Work independently and manage deliverables to align with the project goals plus support cross- functional engineering efforts
 
Education
Enrolled in BSEE/CS or MSEE/CS program
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Key Qualifications 

·      Enrolled in BSEE/MSEE or MSCEprogram 

·      Knowledge of CPU&SOC architecture/design 

·      Low-level programming of complex computer systems in C/C++/assembly 

·      Coding in a scripting language, Perl,Python,Ruby,etc. 

·      Exposure to object oriented programming concepts 

·      Knowledge of industry standard interfaces, good understanding of Verilog, Verilog simulator and debug 

·      Strong problem solving and analytical skills 

·      Strong communication skills combined with team-oriented approaches to own the verification efforts in a specific area of the design

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: In this highly visible role, you will be at the center of a System-on-a-chip (SoC) design verification effort interfacing with design, with a critical impact on getting high quality functional products to millions of customers quickly.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: As a formal verification architect owning the complete formal verification for single or multiple design blocks and IP's (CPU, Media IP, Security IP, Peripheral IP, Interconnects, Power management subsystems, etc.), you will be responsible for: Working with CPU and other IP design teams to develop formal micro-architecture specifications Determining proof strategies for numerical computation units and obtaining full proof sign-offs Developing a comprehensive formal verification test plan from specification to implementation Proving properties of the design, finding design bugs, and working closely with design teams to help improve the micro-architecture Architecting novel and innovative solutions for verifying complex design micro-architectures Developing and implementing re-usable and optimized formal models and verification code base Architecting correct-by-construction design methodologies for improved formal verification efficiency and productivity
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Advanced knowledge of SoC/CPU/GPU designs, VLSI, digital logic design and verification techniques Developed formal property proofs on industrial strength designs and architectures Deep understanding of pipelined architectures, IEEE 754, out-of-order and speculative instruction execution hardware, bus interconnects, and cache coherence mechanism Solid understanding of formal verification technologies/abstraction techniques Knowledge and experience in interpreting hardware specifications and using temporal logic assertion-based languages such as SVA or PSL Experience in using EDA formal tools and tool development experience is a plus Proficiency in any scripting language with excellent debugging skills Strong team player with excellent communication skills Passionate about developing world-class/innovative formal verification solutions. 

 

Education: Pursuing a Bachelors in EE, CS or Math or Applied Math

Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. The people here at Apple don't just build products - they build the kind of wonder that's revolutionized entire industries. It's the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. 

 

Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. In this highly visible role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on Apple Products, and leave a footprint for years to come. We have an opportunity for an accomplished quality engineer to lead development, and ramp for a next generation Apple product from both dimensional and cosmetic perspective. 

 

Our Operations team ensures that Apple's ground breaking designs become industry-leading products, delivered on time and on spec. This high profile, highly respected organization is positioned at the junction of Apple's product teams, the industries that supply core component technologies, and our manufacturing partners who help ensure that products such as iPad, iPhone and Mac can be restocked just as fast as they fly off the shelves! We're looking for high-energy people to support the procurement, manufacturing, fulfillment and support of all things Apple.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Some of the responsibilities in Manufacturing Engineering may include: 

 

MANUFACTURING DESIGN ENGINEER 

As an MDE, you will handle selection, implementation & optimization of manufacturing processes for mechanical enclosure subassemblies for our legendary products. Utilize Mechanical Engineering experience and work cross functionally with Product Design Engineering and Industrial Design Assess product features for manufacturability, and recommend capable processes and equipment. Developing new manufacturing processes to enable future product design and conducting DOEs to validate process capability. Work with Global Supplier Managers to identify capable suppliers, assess their secondary processes for capacity, quality and cost. Work with suppliers to define and refine mechanical tooling, fixtures and establish capability / readiness. Audit supplier processes and assembly processes and support product phase builds from EVT, DVT PVT and ramp. Assist post production quality / cost improvement activity related to fixtures and processes. 

 

MANUFACTURING QUALITY ENGINEER 

As an MQE, you will utilize Engineering, Factory Management & Supply Chain skills in developing and implementing high efficiency inspection equipment, groundbreaking quality systems and ultimately the best products available. Help lead the creation of state of the art inspection & measurement equipment for Apple product. Apply your understanding of quality control and manufacturing concepts to lead the development of specific Product Quality Plans (PQP) appropriate to program and commodity. Provide technical direction and mentorship to other Quality Engineers supporting the implementation of the PQP. Identify and direct studies to implement improvements in measuring method where appropriate. Coordinate Quality Engineering functions for multiple programs in the product category. Collaborate with internal and external groups to ensure accurate definition of quality expectations and appropriate assurance techniques are used for the product. 

Supplier Quality Management - Assist in supplier selection process for new products and sourcing activities. Assess supplier production control and quality programs, identify shortfalls to expectations, and directly secure agreement to correct. Supervise each supplier's performance through measurement of production line statistics, company inspections, and audits. 

 

SUBJECT MATTER AUTHORITY 

Our SME's investigate and develop solutions to overcome difficult technical challenges that require non-standard manufacturing approaches. Apply your engineering skills to develop an in depth understanding of the process drivers that will drive successful implementation of significant improvements to mechanical enclosures. The following activities fall within the scope of responsibilities: Assess mechanical designs and relate design goals to process, equipment, and material requirements to evaluate a set of options to tackle difficult manufacturing problems. Research manufacturing processes and evaluate them for potential to achieve technical goals. Plan and execute development trials to test feasibility, optimize process inputs, and validate capabilities of process options. Present analysis to key decision makers used to make significant commercial and design commitments
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications: 

Experience in a hands-on manufacturing environment. 

Experience developing quality plans, validating test methods and gauges, and driving corrective actions / failure analysis efforts. 

Knowledge of quality and reliability concepts, supplier management, and general manufacturing operations. 

Project management experience and a deep understanding of problem solving tools including design of experiments, root cause analysis and statistical process control principles preferred. 

Experience with: mechanical enclosures, casings, plastic parts, injection molding, tooling, jigs, fixtures, or automotive high volume quality manufacturing engineering. 

Understanding of GD&T Geometric Design & Tolerance, as well as statistics. 

Understanding of mechanical properties of materials as they relate to manufacturing requirements 

Understanding of DOE principles 

Extraordinary interpersonal skills - verbal, written and executive presentations

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Apple is seeking highly qualified people for the position of AI/ML Engineer and AI/ML Researcher. The team pursues research & development in the areas of machine learning (ML) with particular focus on deep learning (DL), computer vision (CV), Natural Language Processing (NLP), optimization, and reinforcement learning (RL). As a member of the team, you will work on some of the most ambitious technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact future Apple products, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into products. In addition, you will engage with the academic community by publishing your innovative research, and speaking at conferences and events.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Some responsibilities in AI/ML may include: 

You will research and develop innovative ML strategies for challenging problems that will affect future Apple products. You will collaborate with broader teams across Apple to transfer AI/ML solutions. You will have opportunities to provide technical mentorship and guidance and prepare technical reports for publication and conference talks. You are self-motivated, excellent problem solver, a go-getter. You are quick to build relationships and work well with change and ambiguity. You have strong programming skills with tried experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering advanced algorithmic solutions.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications:  

In-depth expertise in deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML) 

Expertise in one or more of CV, NLP, optimization, RL, time series, generative models, signals, pattern recognition fields, and/or computer graphics fields 

Strong publication record demonstrating innovative research 

Good presentation skills 

Passionate about building extraordinary products 

Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, C/C++, CUDA or other GPGPU is a plus 

Knowledge of common ML frameworks 

Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment, to execute on the tasks assigned, to meet the production deadlines and, at the same time, to explore independently new innovative ideas that can improve and transform the product experience of Apple customers 

Be able to deliver ML technologies aligned with the core values of Apple, ensuring the highest standards of quality, scientific rigor, innovation, and respect for user privacy 

Creative, collaborative, & product focused 

 

Education: 

Pursuing PhD, Masters, or Bachelors degree in Machine Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Natural Language Processing, Robotics, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or related areas.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Business Intelligence Programmer - Intern 

Do you have an inexplicable fondness for numbers? Does pulling data make your heart sing? Do you dream about pivot tables? Having a hard time explaining this to friends and family? At Big Blue Bubble, we understand.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Here are a few things you can expect from this internship placement:

 

  
	 
 Developing code bases for internal data display dashboards, API interfaces, and analysis scripts.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
A Career with Bird
  

Bird has been in the construction industry for over 100 years and has facilitated the building of careers each step of the way. We are proud of what we have accomplished together and are looking forward to the next 100 years. 

Our organization will provide you with the right opportunity to gain practical, hands on experience, foster teamwork and collaboration as well as leveraging your existing capabilities and develop new skills to further personal growth and career transformation. 

Your career at Bird can progress in any direction and we encourage you to gather experience in all areas of our business. We want your career with us to be successful, and you can trust that we will work with you to realize your career goals. As a student at Bird, you will have the opportunity to build your professional network, give back to the community, and gain industry insights from leaders. 

 

What you'll be working on 

 

Our internships and Co-ops are designed to provide you with a business relevant project that will allow you to independently manage your own area of responsibility, while receiving support from an assigned Supervisor and Technical Mentor. We'll help you discover your strengths and development areas in a challenging, fun, and supportive work environment. 

 

Projects are scoped in alignment with your term length, and typically focus on a current construction project.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Who we need on our team 

 

Engineering:
 

  
	 
 You are currently enrolled in Civil, or Mechanical or Industrial Engineering and will complete at least one more semester of education following your internship and possess a GPA of 3.0 or higher
	 
 Ability to lead and operate within an environment where change happens frequently
	 
 Ability to forge, grow and maintain positive relationships
	 
 Exemplify the Ideal Team Player - Hungry, Humble, Smart
	 
 Highly developed interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
	 
 Sense of urgency and strong commitment to achieving goals
	 
 Ability to work collaboratively with a positive attitude
	 
 Residency, or a valid work permit which would allow you to work for Bird Construction or one of our wholly owned subsidiaries
	 
 If you are selected for a role in a safety-sensitive position, you will be required to successfully complete a Medical and/or Alcohol & Drug tests
	 
 All applications must include a current transcript
 

 

 

COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Policy  

Bird is committed to providing a healthy and safe work environment by sustaining the strong safety culture that our clients and contractors have come to trust. As such, all full-time and part-time salaried staff employed by Bird, and any of its subsidiary or affiliated corporations (collectively, "Bird"), are required to comply with Bird's COVID-19 Testing and Vaccination Policy. Effective December 1, 2021, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or provide proof of a negative COVID-19 test result every three days at their own cost. All documentation submitted in relation to this Policy will only be reviewed by those responsible for the administration of this Policy and will be treated as private and confidential in accordance with the company's policies and guidelines.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Alimentiv Inc., located in London, Ontario, with offices in San Diego and The Netherlands, is a global specialty Contract Research Organization that provides clinical research services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, government agencies and academic investigators. We have achieved academic excellence and a track record in the performance of multi-center clinical trials since 1986. We are a growing organization with a strong commitment to teamwork and scientific excellence. Alimentiv is recognized as an international leader in outcomes development, randomized trials, and centralized imaging solutions. 

  

The Alimentiv Statistics MRD team is a growing group that works closely with the Medical Research and Development team to provide data collection, analysis, and presentation services for clinical studies. Under the supervision of Manager, Statistics and Statistical Programming, the successful candidate will leverage their knowledge of statistics to support multiple ongoing clinical studies. This position will provide an opportunity to be actively involved clinical research by providing project support, methodological development and reporting, and the development and maintenance of standardized coding.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Activities can include but are not limited to:

 

  
	 
 Carry out statistical analysis using standard software packages to interpret and translate results within a statistical framework into biomedical terms.
	 
 Prepare statistical data and results for inclusion in reports and research papers.
	 
 Working in conjunction with the Biostatistician Director develop, convert, and present new and novel biometrical methodologies and findings into publishable and promotable scientific processes and results.
	 
 Prepare statistical analysis plan and oversee product data collection management and analysis with input from the project teams.
	 
 Develop and program reporting tools to support internal data management teams.
 

Provide analysis support by developing SAS programs for tables, listing and figures (TFLs).
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Qualifications: 

You will work in an environment that is constantly changing and should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, possess effective verbal and written communication skills, and be strongly motivated to meet timelines and project goals.
 

  
	 
 Have completed or are near completion of a bachelor's degree in science with a strong emphasis on statistical analysis
 

A solid foundation in statistical programming.Knowledge of the statistical programming language is a plus.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Through the quality system, the Regulatory Affairs/Quality Assurance Medical Device Associate position puts you in the center of the company's operations.  These multi-faceted areas include device design, engineering, manufacturing, microbiology, process validations, clinical studies, supply chain management and even human resources.  It also develops a wide range of skills as well, from project management to good communication skills. 

  

The Quality Assurance role is all about project management and processes.  You'll receive training on the BioIntegral Surgical Quality Management System, and move onto help keep that system working and improving.  These improvements are typically made with better systems and processes, training programs, new regulations, risk-driven decision-making, data collection and analysis, and presentations to management after which changes can be made.   In addition, the QA Associate will gain exposure and experience to various functional areas of the firm, including Manufacturing, R&D, Engineering and Sales/Clinical Support.  This is an exciting time for the industry, as some regulatory changes are moving a lot of new processes and there are some great one-off and long-term projects for the right COOP. 

  

Regulatory Affairs is the area where everything about a product comes together.  The regulatory role is a mixture of all the skills required in the medical device and pharma industries: basic science, writing, project management, clinical research, risk analysis, data analysis, physiology, biology, product life cycles, manufacturing and quality systems.  

  

In short, you'll be exposed to both, and perhaps over the 4- or 8-months, specialize in a particular area.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Support various operational areas of the firm (e.g., product analysis/reviews, clinical performance, technical documentation, quality audits, etc.)
	 
 Support clinical studies, from initial design to ongoing data collection and analysis
	 
 Collaborate with Quality Assurance to maintain regulatory compliance across the product range
	 
 Act as core team member providing review and analysis of applicable regulatory guidelines and project regulatory assessments as needed
	 
 Responsible for document control/management, quality documentation review and record control/maintenance
	 
 Provide training to others in areas you've mastered
	 
 Draft documents and forms
	 
 Validate processes and equipment
	 
 Participate in internal audits, putting the processes to task and see how we're following them
	 
 Have fun, ask questions, get involved and learn some new things about yourself and the industry
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Be a self learner and a team player
	 
 Be comfortable and creative with MS Word and Excel
	 
 Be well-rounded
	 
 Have good to excellent technical writing skills
	 
 Have good communication skills, especially with data
	 
 Have good judgement and a desire to make effective decisions
	 
 Have fun, ask questions, get involved and learn some new things about yourself and the industry
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing::
Public transport: The N21 Bus coming from Square One Mississauga stops right in front of the building. 

This is an on-site COOP term.
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Company Information 

 

BioIntegral Surgical specializes in manufacturing and selling all-biological implants in the cardiac and vascular fields, with a special focus on pediatric products for children with congenital heart defects.  Our niche products represent the goal to be excellent in a specific area of unmet clinical needs, and eliminate the compromises which affect most medical technologies made from synthetics.  BioIntegral Surgical values both teamwork and individual contributions, with a special culture of initiative, ownership and education.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Bentley Systems, the infrastructure engineering software company is looking for a student in computer engineering, software engineering, computer science, data science, geomatics, computational mathematics, or another development related field to integrate its Applied AI group. The Applied AI group engineers and implements several AI and machine learning based solutions to tackle difficult problems faced by Bentley clients in various fields. The following examples give some overview of the projects we are currently working on:
 

  
	 
 Engineering documents interpretation, where documents of various sources (schematics, civil, architectural, etc.) are automatically analyzed by an AI model to extract key information.
	 
 Analysis of 3D CAD models and design error detection.
	 
 Automated inspection of various structures and assets (for rust, cracks, leaks, etc.), from a corpus of pictures and sensors data
	 
 Intelligent clean-up of large databases containing real-world data, such as the ones describing utility companies' networks
 

  

These solutions are developed by a team of around 20 data scientists, ML engineers, and developers. In many cases, we produced successful proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the value of AI. However, such demonstration is only the first step towards productization: deploying the solution on the cloud or on client's premises, making it robust and auditable, ensuring the security of the data it uses and produces, and incorporating it into existing Bentley software and workflows makes for a lot of interesting challenges on their own.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: The proposed internship takes place in this context. Assisted by data scientists and developers, you will assist the deployment and ensure the correct behavior of AI models at various stages of the projects. In addition, a part of this internship could be devoted to AI models development and data engineering, depending on the candidate interest. You will be integrated directly in the Applied AI group, with regular meetings with key people (project managers, data scientists, etc.) and many possibilities to learn more about certain topics of interest for you.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What we are looking for:
 

  
	 
 Developer profile
	 
 Good knowledge of Python is a plus, as is knowledge of CI/CD processes
	 
 Willing to learn about cloud deployment (especially Microsoft Azure)
	 
 Artificial intelligence / machine learning background is optional, but we are looking for people interested in such fields
	 
 Able to do teamwork despite being remote
	 
 Autonomous and meticulous

Job Posting Information.Job Title:: Hydrogen Project Engineering Co-op Student - Oakville
Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements:: Use of a personal vehicle required as Atura's sites are not accessible via public transit.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Job Title: Hydrogen Project Engineering Co-op Student 

Location:  Head Office, Oakville 

Dates: May 3 - Aug 27, 2022 

  

As a Mechanical/Electrical Engineering Co-op Student, you'll be a valued member of the Atura Power Engineering Team. Located at our head office in Oakville. 

  

Working within the hydrogen development business unit, the successful candidate will be part of a multi-disciplinary team that is responsible for the proposal, initiation, execution, and completion of hydrogen projects for Atura Power. 

 

Atura Power is proud to be playing a leadership role in establishing the supply of low-carbon hydrogen in Ontario. This low-carbon energy source has the potential to reduce or offset emissions in a variety of applications and will be a critical tool in the fight against climate change and supports net-zero goals. 

Our vision is - enabling Ontario's clean energy future with reliable, low-cost power. We believe hydrogen has a role to play in decarbonizing Ontario's electricity and energy markets. 

  

During your 4-month work-term, you will learn a variety of engineering functions and participate in operations support and improvement projects that relate to our role in Atura. You will be exposed to Atura's entire portfolio of power generation assets and the programs utilized to manage these assets throughout Ontario.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Responsibilities:
 

  
	 
 Provide engineering support for the planning and execution of hydrogen project development
	 
 Work closely with the consultants, system engineers, and project managers to support ongoing engineering and project work
	 
 Ensure relevant documentation is retained in accordance with company expectations including drawings, reference manuals, and other related information
	 
 Evaluate new technologies, studies, reports and other industry user groups for applicability to the hydrogen business
	 
 Follow company procedures including Practice of Engineering, Management of Change, and Project Management Procedures
	 
 Gain exposure to the low carbon hydrogen industry and power generation industry
	 
 Perform other related duties as business needs arise and your skills and interests align
	 
 Follow company procedures including Practice of Engineering, Management of Change, and Project Management Procedures
	 
 Gain exposure to the power generation industry
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Job Qualifications, Required:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Founded in 2017, Bolt Technologies ("Bolt") is a leading Canadian technology-enabled logistics and last-mile delivery provider for businesses of all sizes - from small local e-commerce shops to large national retailers. Bolt provides a customer-centric and sustainable approach to fulfilment, including reliable warehousing, pick and pack, shipping, and last-mile delivery with facilities in Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, and Ottawa. By operating as an extension of every customers' team, Bolt delivers best-in-class services every step of the way, ensuring faster, more cost-effective, and complete customer deliveries. Bolt also strives to be carbon negative by 2023 and is building Canada's largest electric vehicle fleet. For more information on why Canada's largest box mattress companies, furniture businesses and e-commerce entrepreneurs trust Bolt as their fulfilment partner, visit gobolt.com. 

 

Bolt's software development teams are building next-generation technologies that are changing the world of logistics. As a key member of a versatile team, you will work on a specific project critical to Bolt's needs where you will design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions as you grow and evolve during your internship. We need our developers to be versatile and enthusiastic in addressing new problems as we continue to push technology forward.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Your responsibilities would include:
 

  
	 
 Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software.
	 
 Manage individual priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Minimum Qualifications:
 

  
	 
 Pursuing or have completed a program in software development or  computer science.
	 
 Experience in JavaScript, Ruby on Rails, React, NodeJS, or Go.
	 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 

 

Preferred Qualifications:
 

  
	 
 Experience in software development, with competencies in data structures and software design.
	 
 Experience in full-stack development and web/mobile applications.
	 
 Ability to learn other coding languages as needed.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Fixed Term Environmental Technician will be responsible for performing compliance inspections, environmental monitoring programs and support reporting requirements.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Conducting field monitoring and sampling programs as required under existing permits, licenses, and the company's Environmental Management System (including surface, lake and ground water, effluent, soil and dustfall sampling)
	 
 Conducting internal due diligence compliance inspections of various site facilities and operational activities
	 
 Participating/ assisting with environmental baseline studies, fish habitat monitoring, erosion and sediment control measures, and active migratory bird nest surveys
	 
 Assisting with spill prevention and spill response and filling out pertinent forms related to environmental spills and incidents and follow-up.
	 
 Maintaining detailed and comprehensive field notes.
	 
 Calibrating, installing and maintaining sampling and monitoring equipment.
	 
 Conducting field and in-house lab analyses of field samples using on-site portable analyzers and meters
	 
 Completing chain of custodies, processing, packing, and shipping collected samples.
	 
 Entering and managing collected field and laboratory data into the environmental database.
	 
 Regularly updating, filing, and managing environmental documentation.
	 
 Assisting process and environmental engineers with specific tasks relating to wastewater treatment activities.
	 
 Promoting environmental awareness and education through assisting in the preparation and implementation of environmental training exercises.
	 
 Other technical field and office tasks to support the environment development and site operations.

College Diploma Environmental Science or related discipline required.
	 
 Bachelor's Degree Environmental Science or related discipline preferred.
	 
 From 1 year to less than 3 years in industry under the environmental discipline.
	 
 Valid Provincial or Territorial driver's license (or willingness to apply for) Required
	 
 Fire Arms Certificate (FAC) or Possession and Acquisition License (PAL) (or willingness to apply for) required.
	 
 Training or experience with water and effluent monitoring, sampling, and field level analytical techniques required.
	 
 Experience with outboard motors, boats (Pleasure Craft Boat License), snowmobiles and GPS required.
	 
 Proficiency with Microsoft suite of software products such as Word, Excel and Powerpoint required.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Join the Winning Team at Life Sciences, ATS Automation, a great place to automate your future!  Take your place among the best in the business, with ATS Automation. Join an environment where a passion for innovation is combined with an uncompromised commitment to quality. 

 

This individual will work with the ATS automation team to create detail drawings and layouts of existing tooling as well as prepare detail drawings.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Specific Responsibilities:

 

  
	 
 Formalize and update drawing documentation using AutoCAD and Solidworks.
	 
 Successful completion of ATS Solidworks course.
	 
 Create detail drawings and layouts of existing tooling through the use of precision measuring devices such as verniers and micrometers.
	 
 Prepare detail drawings and bills of materials from designs, sketches, notes or specifications for equipment, sub-assemblies or product, using AutoCAD and Solidworks.
	 
 Review drawings for accuracy, correct materials, proper machining techniques, finishes, hardness etc. and makes changes, then submit final copies to engineering staff for approval.
	 
 Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
	 
 Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Knowledge of: mechanical drafting, material in mechanical design and machine tools.
	 
  Must be proficient in AutoCAD and Solidworks.
	 
  Knowledge of tolerancing in mechanical design.
	 
  Knowledge of electrical components in mechanical design.
 

Education:

 

  
	 
 Successful completion of 2 semesters from a college or university Mechanical Design program.
 

Experience:

 

  
	 
 Successful completion of previous co-op term in Mechanical Design.
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::

 Be a part of a global organization that is a leader in its industry
	 
 Subsidized breakfast and lunch daily; free gourmet beverages - coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Plus, Treat Day is every other week!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
THE TEAM 

The mission of the eCommerce Department is to provide our clients with an aspirational, relevant, and frictionless online connection to Aritzia - wherever and whenever. 

  

THE OPPORTUNITY 

This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team responsible for using data to generate useful and usable insights that drive strategic decision making and support the continued growth of the eCommerce business. In this role, you will support performing A/B tests with a methodical data-driven approach to improve eCommerce conversion rates translating to increased revenue. Our goal is that you will come out of your internship inspired, with meaningful experience and an enhanced skill set you can carry forward into your bright future. 

  

 

THE PERKS OF BEING AN INTERN AT ARITZIA 

As an intern for Aritzia, you will gain:
 

  
	 
 Valuable work experience in a dynamic, high-performing business
	 
 The opportunity to work on meaningful projects that directly impact business results
	 
 Exposure and mentorship from cross-functional leaders and teams
	 
 Access to industry-leading benefits and programs, including:
	 
  
    
		 
   Aritzia University - An ever-growing suite of training programs to set you up for success today and tomorrow
		 
   Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store
		 
   Extras - A multitude of conveniences like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and more
	 
  
	
 

  

THE LOGISTICS

 

  
	 
 Internship Dates: May 2, 2022 - August 19, 2022 (16 weeks)
	 
 Location: Remote
	 
 Application Deadline: January 31, 2022
	 
 Application Process:
	 
  
    
		 
   Apply online with a resume and a cover letter outlining your skills, goals and why Aritzia is the place for you.
		 
   Please apply to 1 internship position only - if you have multiple positions in mind or aren't sure which opportunity is the best for you apply to our General Internship posting - we'd love to help!
		 
   Applicants moving onto the next stage will be contacted for interviews in February
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
THE ROLE 

As the Intern, Optimization, you will support with:
 

  
	 
 Maintaining website roadmap of A/B/n tests
	 
 Continuously identify areas of opportunity on our eCommerce website to be optimized
	 
 Designing, scheduling, and implementing optimization activities
	 
 Ensuring the right data is easily accessible
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
THE QUALIFICATIONS 

The Intern, Optimization is/has:
 

  
	 
 Currently enrolled in a post-secondary institution, with a preferred graduation date of December 2022 or April 2023
	 
  
    
		 
   Preferably pursuing a degree in Business, Math or Computer Science
	 
  
	
	 
 Passion for Aritzia and the fashion industry
	 
 Skills and experience with data analytics, communicating stories around data insights and web analytics tools are an asset
	 
 A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values, Business and People Leadership principles
	 
 The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
	 
 A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value to the business
	 
 Previous work experience in Aritzia Boutiques, Concierge or Distribution Centres is highly valued

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Reporting to the Senior Grade Control technician, the geology intern is part of the mine geology department and collaborates with other departments of the mine.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Your Contribution: 

Reporting to the Senior Grade Control technician, the geology intern is part of the mine geology department and collaborates with other departments of the mine. She/He will ensure that the goals and objectives are achieved, while promoting and respecting Agnico Eagle's culture, Health & Safety Code of Conduct and the environment.

* QA/QC on the field (regular audits of the quality of the sampling).

* Daily sample collection from the mine, shipment to the lab and monitoring. 

* Any other tasks that the senior grade control and/or production geologist might identify. 

* Position is approximately 90% field work and 10% office work. 

 

Your Work Schedule 

* Schedule: 14 days of work, followed by 14 days for transportation and rest; flights departing from all communities in the Kivalliq region, Mirabel or Val-d'Or, Quebec; 

* Travel, room and board provided by Agnico Eagle

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
BLUE MOUNTAIN RESORT COMPANY OVERVIEW 

  

Blue Mountain, Ontario's largest mountain resort is nestled on the shores of Georgian Bay, located 90 minutes north of Toronto. Blue Mountain has become the four-season destination of the North, visited by more than 1.5 million guests a year. Winter at the resort boasts 43 ski and snowboard trails enhanced by a world-class snowmaking system. Summer months offer Monterra Golf course, Ridge Runner Mountain Coaster, Cascade Putting Course, Timber Challenge Ropes Course, Wind Rider Triple Zips and a private beach property among other seasonal attractions. Year-round the resort attracts visitors to more than 1,000 luxury accommodation units and 45 unique concept restaurants, bars and retail stores in our pedestrian Village. 53,000 square feet of state- of-the-art conference space caters year-round to corporate meeting groups. Blue Mountain is owned by Alterra Mountain Company and offers the Ikon Pass, the new standard in season passes. Visit www.bluemountain.ca for more information. 

  

  

ALTERRA COMPANY OVERVIEW 

  

Alterra Mountain Company is a family of 15 iconic year-round destinations, including the world's largest heli-ski operation, offering the Ikon Pass, the new standard in season passes. The company owns and operates a range of recreation, hospitality, real estate development, food and beverage, retail and service businesses. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, with destinations across the continent, Alterra Mountain Company is rooted in the spirit of the mountains and united by a passion for outdoor adventure. Alterra Mountain Company's family of diverse playgrounds spans six U.S. states and three Canadian provinces: Steamboat and Winter Park Resort in Colorado; Squaw Valley Alpine Meadows, Mammoth Mountain, June Mountain and Big Bear Mountain Resort in California; Stratton and Sugarbush Resort in Vermont; Snowshoe in West Virginia; Tremblant in Quebec, Blue Mountain in Ontario; Crystal Mountain in Washington; Deer Valley Resort and Solitude Mountain Resort in Utah; and CMH Heli-Skiing & Summer Adventures in British Columbia.  Also included in the portfolio is Alpine Aerotech, a worldwide helicopter support and maintenance service center in British Columbia, Canada. Alterra Mountain Company honors each destination's unique character and authenticity and celebrates the legendary adventures and enduring memories they bring to everyone. 

  

For more information, please visit www.alterramtnco.com. 

 

Blue Mountain Resort is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and inclusiveness across the organization. We believe in equal opportunity and it is our priority to ensure a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If you are contacted for a position, please notify Human Resources of any accommodation needs you may have during the selection process. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: The Adventure Ropes Course Guides will contribute to the safe running of the Low Ropes, High Ropes, Zip Lines, Climbing Wall, Bag Jump, Wooden Ball Track, and Family Nets activities. Guides will be well-versed in the proper use and fit of all equipment and will be required to articulate all park related rules and demonstrate proper use of all equipment to guests.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
WHAT WILL I BE DOING? 

Adventure Attractions Monitor

 

  
	 
 Contributes to the safe running of the Canopy Climb, Air Bag, Ball Run, and Climbing Wall attractions
	 
 Conducts participant orientation, prescreen and waiver processes for guests
	 
 Demonstrates the proper use of all attraction related equipment
	 
 Directs the flow of participant traffic, ensures that guests adhere to safety rules
	 
 Observes participant behavior; assesses/ enforces safety regulations and emergency procedures
	 
 Maintains visual contact with participants; provides coaching, encouragement and support
	 
 Assists in rescue efforts including verbal assist and possible evacuation
	 
 Inspects attraction components and attraction gear daily; maintains inspection logs
 

Adventure High Ropes Rescuer  

In addition to the responsibilities of the Monitor, the Rescuer will also:
 

  
	 
 Primarily contribute to the safe running of the High Ropes, Low Ropes, and Zip Line attractions
	 
 Assists in aerial high rope rescue efforts including verbal assist and possible evacuation
	 
 Inspects aerial course components, zip lines, PPE and course gear daily; maintains inspection logs
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?

 

  
	 
 In addition to the below requirements, Rescuers will also have previous experience on High or Low Ropes, Climbing Wall, and/or Zip lines, will be comfortable working at heights up to 50 feet, and have experience working with ropes, knots and rigging.
	 
 Ability to lift/push/pull up to 50 lbs an asset. 
	 
 Previous experience in a high volume fast paced environment is an asset 
	 
 Proven customer service experience and thrive working within a dynamic team environment
	 
 Excellent leadership, coaching and facilitations skills required
	 
 Previous recreational/resort experience and knowledge required
	 
 Must be a professional, energetic, independent worker
	 
 Must be able to reason and react with quick judgment, while remaining calm under pressure
	 
 Able to work full and active days outside in the elements; must be physically able to navigate all attractions
	 
 Flexible work schedule (must be able to work a variety of shifts including weekends and holidays)
 

  

  

  

If you are hired, prior to your start date and as a condition of your employment, you will be required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated against Covid-19 in accordance with Public Health Guidelines or provide proof of a valid medical exemption.

Alterra Mountain Company's family of diverse playgrounds spans six U.S. states and three Canadian provinces: Steamboat and Winter Park Resort in Colorado; Squaw Valley Alpine Meadows, Mammoth Mountain, June Mountain and Big Bear Mountain Resort in California; Stratton and Sugarbush Resort in Vermont; Snowshoe in West Virginia; Tremblant in Quebec, Blue Mountain in Ontario; Crystal Mountain in Washington; Deer Valley Resort and Solitude Mountain Resort in Utah; and CMH Heli-Skiing & Summer Adventures in British Columbia.  Also included in the portfolio is Alpine Aerotech, a worldwide helicopter support and maintenance service center in British Columbia, Canada. Alterra Mountain Company honors each destination's unique character and authenticity and celebrates the legendary adventures and enduring memories they bring to everyone. 

  

For more information, please visit www.alterramtnco.com. 

 

Blue Mountain Resort is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and inclusiveness across the organization. We believe in equal opportunity and it is our priority to ensure a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. If you are contacted for a position, please notify Human Resources of any accommodation needs you may have during the selection process. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 1453 Customer Service, Information and Related Clerks
Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: The Guest Services Representative will display the enthusiasm and energy that Blue Mountain Resorts prides itself on. This position will be responsible for greeting our guests, redeeming, and selling tickets, passes and lessons as well as providing in depth information on the services and products that we offer. These team members will be friendly, proactive and be able to operate ticketing software proficiently. This position is primarily indoors, helping guests with any questions or concerns and aiding in making memorable and personalized moments.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
WHAT WILL I BE DOING?

 

  
	 
 Handle sales transactions for season passes tickets, lessons and attractions; Be confident with managing guest expectations and aware of what solutions are available to ensure satisfactory service recovery.
	 
 Offer products and services best suited to what they're looking for. Have complete knowledge of all snow school and kid's camp lessons and products, and the ability to explain and communicate what product would work best for each guest, book lessons accordingly.
	 
 Promote, encourage and administer season pass sales, processing, printing, mailing, pick-up and all related logistics and policies (waivers, lost and forgot passes, etc.)
	 
 Serve as reception for the location (Activity Central and SBL)
	 
 Lost and Found: Assist guests with lost/found/stolen inquiries, in person, on the phone or via the L&F email, utilize the Property Database for tracking, tag and document found items, file reports, know the L&F manual, sell tickets and lessons and other duties as required.
	 
 Supporting our guests in navigating our virtual communication platforms such as QLess and Alto
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?

 

  
	 
 Excellent customer service, interpersonal and communication skills
	 
 Extensive computer experience and technical skill required. Comfortable working on computers and learning new software programs.
	 
 Experience handling money
	 
 Ability to work independently, multi-task and troubleshoot
	 
 Team oriented with an energetic, friendly, cheerful and animated demeanor
 

If you are hired, prior to your start date and as a condition of your employment, you will be required to provide proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Public Health guidelines.

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
BLUE MOUNTAIN RESORT COMPANY OVERVIEW 

  

Blue Mountain, Ontario's largest mountain resort is nestled on the shores of Georgian Bay, located 90 minutes north of Toronto. Blue Mountain has become the four-season destination of the North, visited by more than 1.5 million guests a year. Winter at the resort boasts 43 ski and snowboard trails enhanced by a world-class snowmaking system. Summer months offer Monterra Golf course, Ridge Runner Mountain Coaster, Cascade Putting Course, Timber Challenge Ropes Course, Wind Rider Triple Zips and a private beach property among other seasonal attractions. Year-round the resort attracts visitors to more than 1,000 luxury accommodation units and 45 unique concept restaurants, bars and retail stores in our pedestrian Village. 53,000 square feet of state- of-the-art conference space caters year-round to corporate meeting groups. Blue Mountain is owned by Alterra Mountain Company and offers the Ikon Pass, the new standard in season passes. Visit www.bluemountain.ca for more information. 

  

  

ALTERRA COMPANY OVERVIEW 

  

Alterra Mountain Company is a family of 15 iconic year-round destinations, including the world's largest heli-ski operation, offering the Ikon Pass, the new standard in season passes. The company owns and operates a range of recreation, hospitality, real estate development, food and beverage, retail and service businesses. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, with destinations across the continent, Alterra Mountain Company is rooted in the spirit of the mountains and united by a passion for outdoor adventure. Alterra Mountain Company's family of diverse playgrounds spans six U.S. states and three Canadian provinces: Steamboat and Winter Park Resort in Colorado; Squaw Valley Alpine Meadows, Mammoth Mountain, June Mountain and Big Bear Mountain Resort in California; Stratton and Sugarbush Resort in Vermont; Snowshoe in West Virginia; Tremblant in Quebec, Blue Mountain in Ontario; Crystal Mountain in Washington; Deer Valley Resort and Solitude Mountain Resort in Utah; and CMH Heli-Skiing & Summer Adventures in British Columbia.  Also included in the portfolio is Alpine Aerotech, a worldwide helicopter support and maintenance service center in British Columbia, Canada. Alterra Mountain Company honors each destination's unique character and authenticity and celebrates the legendary adventures and enduring memories they bring to everyone. 

  

For more information, please visit www.alterramtnco.com.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world's infrastructure ? sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, and industrial facilities. Our offerings include MicroStation-based applications for modeling and simulation, ProjectWise for project delivery, AssetWise for asset and network performance, and the iTwin platform for infrastructure digital twins. Bentley Systems employs more than 4,000 colleagues and generates annual revenues of more than $700 million, in 172 countries. 

 

As a software developer you will be part of a small team that works in a modern, connected environment.  We are highly connected and supportive of each other utilizing MS Teams, git, and Azure DevOps to implement our Agile development processes.  You will be mentored by your team and work on new and existing software projects that our users rely on, such as:
 

  
	 
 Mobile applications for iOS and Android, built using the Xamarin toolset.
	 
 Interoperability software that uses an advanced service bus architecture to connect our applications to outside applications.
	 
 Our web development that is bringing the power of our offerings to the web
	 
 Our extensive C++ server that provides state of the art reliability application functionality that is accessed by all of the above.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Designing and implementing enhancements for mobile, web or desktop applications
	 
 Writing and implementing tests to cover what we develop
	 
 Participating in code reviews
	 
 Participating in daily standups to share progress and discuss obstacles
	 
 Assisting in resolving ongoing issues and those that recently come up
	 
 Potential need to quickly learn new languages for use if necessary
	 
 Providing support to other employees with their own tasks and responsibilities
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Any combination of C#, C++, JavaScript, TypeScript, SQL, Xamarin/.NET MAUI
	 
 Knowledge of the following is beneficial: Entity Framework, OData, ASP.NET Core Web API, Blazor (or experience with Razor)
	 
 We use git, so knowledge of source control fundamentals is an asset
	 
 Knowledge of ReactJS is a benefit.
	 
 Knowledge of Azure, Docker and Kubernetes is a plus

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
If you have a background in communication/marketing with a focus on social media, love all things digital and have a passion for achieving excellence on every project, check out this online/fully remote opportunity with an award-winning agency in Canada, Advantis Communications. 

 

Advantis is a digital communication agency focused on social media content strategy, creation and activation. Advantis delivers measurable value by integrating social media strategies to achieve business results. And we train our clients to do the same in-house. 

 

We're seeking a passionate and business savvy co-op student to assist with research and supporting social media related projects and campaigns. This is a golden opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience by working with seasoned agency partners who are recognized across Canada and beyond. 

 

Advantis has earned awards and praise from industry associations and clients across Canada and the US for their digital communication work. Advantis partners have developed and taught social media curriculum at the university level and have trained clients across North America.   

 

Work term duration: May - August;  Flexible start/end dates.

 Assist with formal social media audits
	 
 Co-manage the community development for social media feeds
	 
 Assist with online promotional activities such as researching and writing blog posts
	 
 Assist with finding opportunities to promote Advantis in social media
	 
 Assist with researching and preparing content for training sessions, speaking presentations etc.
	 
 Ability to have frequent online video meetings and calls with Advantis team
	 
 Other duties as required

Experience using social media platforms especially Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and Twitter
	 
 Understanding of social media best practices and trends
	 
 Working knowledge of social media apps and tools
	 
 Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	 
 A passion for excellence on every project
	 
 Top-tier writing, design and research skills
	 
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel etc.)
	 
 Ability to maintain accurate and complete documentation and electronic records
	 
 Business savvy, enthusiastic and positive personality
	 
 Work well with a close-knit team and diligently by yourself

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
THE TEAM 

The mission of the Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making. 

  

THE OPPORTUNITY 

This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team that bridges the gap between business strategy and data to successfully drive sales and maximize profitability. As the Intern, Data Analytics, you will combine your deep understanding of the Retail fashion business, with your passion for data and analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to deliver world class everyday luxury shopping experiences. Our goal is that you will come out of your internship inspired, with meaningful experience and an enhanced skill set you can carry forward into your bright future. 

  

THE ROLE 

As the Intern, Data Analytics, you will support to:
 

  
	 
 Define measurement strategies to quantify performance of a business area, and compare their current condition against a hindsight benchmark
	 
 Generate actionable insights by analyzing data through diagnostics, correlations, and hypothesis testing
	 
 Visualize and communicate analyses to the business, including building scalable and insightful reports and dashboards, enabling reliable self-service analytics, and synthesizing and presenting findings at all levels of the department
 

  

THE PERKS OF BEING AN INTERN AT ARITZIA 

As an intern for Aritzia, you will gain:
 

  
	 
 Valuable work experience in a dynamic, high-performing business
	 
 The opportunity to work on meaningful projects that directly impact business results
	 
 Exposure and mentorship from cross-functional leaders and teams
	 
 Access to industry-leading benefits and programs, including:
 


 

  
	 
 Aritzia University - An ever-growing suite of training programs to set you up for success today and tomorrow
	 
  
    
		 
   Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store
		 
   A-OK Commissary & Café - Our in-office, world-class bistro and café
		 
   The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
		 
   Amenities - Facilities include bike storage rooms and shower facilities with complimentary conveniences
		 
   Extras - A multitude of conveniences like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and more
	 
  
	
 

THE LOGISTICS

 

  
	 
 Internship Dates: May 2, 2022 - August 19, 2022 (16 weeks)
	 
 Location: Vancouver, BC
	 
 Application Deadline: January 31, 2022
	 
 Application Process:
	 
  
    
		 
   Apply online with a resume and a cover letter outlining your skills, goals and why Aritzia is the place for you.
		 
   Please apply to 1 internship position only - if you have multiple positions in mind or aren't sure which opportunity is the best for you apply to our General Internship posting - we'd love to help!
		 
   Applicants moving onto the next stage will be contacted for interviews in February
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
THE QUALIFICATIONS 

The Intern, Data Analytics is/has:
 

  
	 
 Currently enrolled in a post-secondary institution, with a preferred graduation date of December 2022 or April 2023
	 
  
    
		 
   Preferably pursuing a degree in Business Analytics, Business, Computer Science, Data Science or Engineering
	 
  
	
	 
 Passion for Aritzia and the fashion industry
	 
 Skills and experience with data analysis and statistics are an asset
	 
 A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values, Business and People Leadership principles
	 
 The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
	 
 A commitment to quality and investing in results that add value to the business
	 
 Previous work experience in Aritzia Boutiques, Concierge or Distribution Centres is highly valued
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:: See above
Job Posting Information.Targeted Degrees and Disciplines::
Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
AXIBO (https://www.axibo.com) is a small startup company that's creating smart camera systems. We are creating a shift in the way cinematic production takes place for all forms of media. The interdisciplinary team at AXIBO are working to create a variety of innovations ranging from virtual production to systems used for tracking actors and actresses in big budget films! 

 

Software developers: you have solid professional or genuine project experience (not just the follow along tutorials) in Python, C++, C and / or Golang. You know your way around Git version control principles and have experience working in a Linux environment. You're able to integrate yourself into an existing software stack. Bonus points if you've contributed to open-source projects. 

 

In general, you are able to adapt to changing timelines and priorities, and can thrive in a growing, upcoming startup environment. But more importantly, you are serious about growing with the company. As we grow, we want to make sure you're getting valuable experience as well.

 Ability to adapt to changing timelines and priorities

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Achievers, one of North America's Top Employers, is?seeking?a?Software Developer Intern! 
 
At Achievers, our software delivers a powerful new way for companies to engage, align, and recognize employees enabling remarkable business success. Every day.  
We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to Change the Way the World Works. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and L.O.V.E. our culture. Achievers is and always will be a SaaS company, meaning that the heart of our business is the Engineering team.? The Engineering team builds world-class software that scales. This team codes and hosts the intellectual fuel that propels?Achievers to disrupt the HR technology space. At?Achievers, our software, hardware, network storage, testing and site reliability revolutionize how businesses recognize and engage their employee base, and how businesses create success through their Employees 'Success'.? 
 
Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.   

Why work with us?  

-We're a fun-loving, passionate, and highly collaborative team.  
-You're positive thinking and find opportunities instead of?problems.? 
-We believe in moving quickly, failing fast, and adapting to change.  
-We're committed to achieving technical excellence in everything we do.  
We value teamwork, learning from failure and innovation.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
As a Software Developer Intern, you will:  

 

-Build, Own and Maintain new innovative product features. Work in a team by collaborating with your colleagues by actively participating in design/architecture discussions.   

-Work with other talented engineers and designers in teams of 5-8 to prototype and test your ideas. You're not an "intern", you're part of the team!  

-Live in GitHub creating pull requests, reviewing code, merging branches, and generally be a team player by seeking out and providing feedback. We believe that every developer has lots to learn and lots to give!  

-Use the right tool for the job; we love modern technology and use things like Python, Go, Kubernetes, Docker, Drone, Google PubSub, ReACT/ReDUX, GraphQL, Microservices and MircroFrontend Architecture with GCP. Ship code multiple times a day - yes, daily.  

-Have a buddy that knows their way around the company and the code who will guide you to make your onboarding as smooth as possible

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Amino North America Corp. (ANAC) is a Tier 1 Automotive supplier, specialized in producing sheet metal body panels for various automotive customers using the exclusive sheet hydro forming technology developed in Amino Japan. 

 

The Co-Op Student will be involved in part of internal research project related to advanced sheet metal forming process. Flexible engineering work will be assigned based on the student's interest and skills. Typical work will be die/fixture design, experimental test, laser-cut assistance, specimen preparations and results analysis. 

 

This position requires a demonstration of technical aptitude in the workplace high level of teamwork, problem solving skills. The job entails a desire to learn and grow in a constantly evolving work environment. 

 

This position will require that the student work out of the office in St Thomas Ontario
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Assist in die/fixtures design using 3D CAD software. Ex. Catia or NX
	 
 Prepare and interpret engineering design, drawings and specifications.
	 
 Supervise, monitor and inspect the fabrication of the die/fixtures on the shop floor.
	 
 Assist in programming and setup of the laser cutting.
	 
 Assist in the experimental tests as required.
	 
 Attend and participate in engineering meetings.
	 
 Track and analyze test results and complete various reports as required.
	 
 Other engineering work may be assigned as needed.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
3rd or 4th year student working towards bachelor's degree in mechanical or material engineering or an appropriate related engineering discipline
	 
 Be familiar with engineering materials or sheet metal forming
	 
 Be able to design a part in the CAD platform, such as Catia or NX
	 
 Previous CNC programming or 5-axis laser cutting is an asset
	 
 Previous automotive manufacturing experience an asset
	 
 Be comfortable to work on the floor as needed.
	 
 Ability to attend and conduct presentations
	 
 Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
	 
 Ability to physically implement designs
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: This position will require that the student work out of the office in St Thomas Ontario
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information:: Compensation will between $22-$25 depending on experience
Job Posting Information.Targeted Degrees and Disciplines::
Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Assent Compliance is the global leader in supply chain data management. We combine leading-edge technology with supply chain expertise to help companies collect and manage the data they need to comply with global requirements and make ethical business decisions. As the leader in the industry, we're growing fast, and we're looking for passionate, energetic people to join our team!  

 

We're one of the fastest-growing technology companies - from $5 million to $50 million ARR in under five years!  As the global leader in supply chain data management, we provide transparency into the supply chains of some of the world's largest and most successful companies, including 75 percent of Fortune 500 companies.  In our most recent funding round, we raised $350 Million USD in funding led by Vista Equity Partners. This is among one of the largest raises in Canadian software company history. This funding will allow us to scale with purpose, and add exceptional talent to our already remarkable team.
