Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Assent Compliance is the global leader in supply chain data management. We combine leading-edge technology with supply chain expertise to help companies collect and manage the data they need to comply with global requirements and make ethical business decisions. As the leader in the industry, we're growing fast, and we're looking for passionate, energetic people to join our team!  

 

We're one of the fastest-growing technology companies - from $5 million to $50 million ARR in under five years!  As the global leader in supply chain data management, we provide transparency into the supply chains of some of the world's largest and most successful companies, including 75 percent of Fortune 500 companies.  In our most recent funding round, we raised $350 Million USD in funding led by Vista Equity Partners. This is among one of the largest raises in Canadian software company history. This funding will allow us to scale with purpose, and add exceptional talent to our already remarkable team.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
During your product design opportunity with Assent, you will gain the practical experience necessary to contribute to various design activities, from daily standups and weekly design reviews to evolving our design system and building prototypes. In addition, you will work closely with senior designers and be exposed to strategic level thinking, research and validation exercises, all the way to tactical contributions to new features. Our goal is to nurture your curiosity while navigating the complete design thinking process! You will demonstrate your deep desire to build on your existing design skills, hone your attention to detail and develop your ability to communicate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders across the engineering organization.  

 

What You'll Be Doing
 

  
	 
 Accelerate your UX craft through hands-on design activities
	 
 You will seek out opportunities to learn about our users' needs, and share that understanding with your peers.
	 
 You will collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and your design leaders on a variety of design led activities, and projects.
	 
 You will actively contribute to the continued evolution of our design system and standards, including our design processes.
	 
 You will contribute to design team ceremonies, and communicate your design decisions and rationale to your peers.
	 
 You will participate in and actively engage in design led activities.
	 
 You will participate in design research and discovery initiatives.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Your Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Other Attributes

 

  
	 
 You are currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in a Design program.
	 
 Ability to design across various platforms (web, mobile, desktop)
	 
 You understand the fundamental differences between a website, a mobile application, and a software application.
	 
 You demonstrate design systems thinking, and the ability to make rational design decisions
	 
 You understand what makes makes or breaks a good user experience
	 
 You understand the basic principles of design; including but not limited to typography, colour, composition, balance, symmetry
	 
 While front-end development skills and the ability to animate is not a requirement; understanding the constraints and what these areas have to offer is critical.
	 
 When we talk about customer journeys, evolving our persona's, and running an affinity diagramming exercise; you get excited! 
	 
 You love the unknown. You thrive in ambiguity. This gives you the chance to flex your research, and design thinking skills! 
	 
 Even though we work with Figma, you hold no allegiance to any specific design tool or suite
 

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the aforementioned duties and responsibilities satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About Us 

AMLB is a non-traditional virtual Chief Financial Officer (CFO) firm that enables clients and colleagues to reach their potential. Launched just over a year ago, AMLB is growing quickly, having onboarded a portfolio of clients making a real impact in a range of industries from ecommerce to not-for-profit. We act as strategic financial partners that really get to know our clients' businesses, are relationship-focused rather than transactional, and have built a reputation for delivering proactive advice that unleashes our clients' performance potential. 

 

www.amlb.ca 

  

How we're different 

What does non-traditional mean? We don't work from a physical office; our clients are from across Canada and we're there for them when they need us, virtually. We deploy cloud-based technologies together with automation as game-changers for our clients and our firm. And we're completely paperless. This allows our people to pursue careers in a 100% virtual and results-based practice that focuses on value-added work. You will never spend time manually entering bank and credit card transactions! It also means we do not use hours worked to measure performance. Instead, we've established Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure impact. Examples of our KPIs are: deliverable time and quality, responsiveness to clients and client satisfaction scores. 

 

We view each team member as having the potential to make a real difference not only for our clients but for each other and the success of our firm. That is why, for each employee, we invest in industry leading tools and training programs, provide a high level of autonomy, encourage the pursuit of initiatives to improve the way we work and provide a coach for one-on-one support from day one to foster development. 

 

One of AMLB's core values is inclusive collaboration, which means we believe in seeking out different perspectives than our own to make all of us better colleagues and partners. We are signatories to Canada's 50 - 30 Challenge as well as the BlackNorth Initiative, which together demonstrate our commitment to gender parity and under-represented groups. This is part of our DNA. 

 

The role: 

As a Business Analyst - Process and Applications, you will play a key role in developing and implementing AMLB's firm-wide process development and improvement framework while also leading strategic initiatives to grow and improve the firm. You would work remotely but also closely with AMLB's co-founders (former Fortune 500 executives) who prioritize learning, a collaborative culture and provide mentorship along the way. If you want to work at an entrepreneurial firm where you will have the opportunity to make a real impact and gain experience using tools that are changing the age-old way accounting is done, you may be a great fit for AMLB. 

 

Open to applicants with 8 month work terms requirements as well.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Performance Profile (Duties & Responsibilities):

 

  
	 
 Work closely with team to develop and implement business process solutions for various departments. This includes leading a firm-wide initiative to assess existing workflows and create a prioritized list of processes and applications to be improved within 90 days.
	 
 Coordinate and facilitate meetings to gather and document requirements, business processes and explore simple to moderate system solutions that will enhance the client and team member experience.
	 
 Assist in planning and designing business processes and making recommendations in order to improve and support business activities.
	 
 Analyze and document business requirements and processes; construct data mapping and definitions from source to target systems.
	 
 Rapidly develop, refine and deploy cloud-based tools to reduce friction and enhance client and team member experiences, with traceability to user requirements; lead efforts to obtain stakeholder approval. Examples of tools to be developed include client intake surveys, feedback forms, process checklists and templates
	 
 Evaluate current utilization and propose enhancements related to industry-leading cloud-based workflow management tool, ensuring client communications and recurring activities are created and scheduled accurately
	 
 Enhance sustainability and effectiveness of key processes by recording training videos and creating step-by-step procedures
	 
 Proactively research, identify, test and implement cloud-based tools to digitize and automate low-value, repetitive tasks
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
The ideal fit for our team:

 

  
	 
 Management engineering, math or technology background with at least 6 months of prior work experience
	 
 Self-starter who works well autonomously and thrives in a fast-paced environment
	 
 Systems thinker who can break down end to end customer journeys into logical step-by-step workflows.
	 
 Enjoys facilitating dialogue and collaborating with a team to achieve goals
	 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	 
 Strong attention to detail and organizational ability
	 
 Demonstrated ability to prioritize activities and deliver high-quality outputs in a timely manner
	 
 Strong computer literacy including Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel and Teams in particular) and a passion for technology
	 
 Demonstrated adaptability and agility to test and quickly learn new concepts and tools
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: Virtual (remote)
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Competitive compensation that rewards value added to clients and the firm
	 
 Work where you want and when you want as long as you're meeting client and firm needs. Team members are asked to participate in at least one team meeting each week
	 
 Unlimited days off, as long as you meet client and firm commitments

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: BioVectra is a Canadian custom development and manufacturing organization specializing in API development and biologics. Projects are brought in through our R&D department for development or familiarization, then transferred through the company as they proceed to commercial manufacture. The Bioanalytical Chemistry Student will work as part of the bioanalytical team to support the process science biologics group in achieving its objectives. They will be responsible for employing routine analysis of samples using a variety of traditional and cutting-edge bioanalytical instrumentation and techniques. This position must conduct testing in a timely manner, to ensure that process development and characterization activities are conducted as efficiently as possible.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Carrying out literature searches as appropriate to evaluate currently known analytical methods and preparing analytical research and development plans as required.
	 
 Performing analyses using modern analytical methodologies such as HPLC, UV-VIS, ELISA , SDS-PAGE, and Immunoblot.
	 
 Maintaining accurate, real-time records of all laboratory activities.
	 
 Data entry and trending data using Excel or other computerized systems.
	 
 Maintaining and troubleshooting analytical equipment.
	 
 Following the company's quality standard (quality management system procedures and cGMP regulations).
	 
 Adhering to BioVectra's Health and Safety Policy as outlined in CP0010 Occupational Health and Safety Policy, Statements of Principle, and Responsibilities.
	 
 Additional duties assigned, based on business needs and the department supervisor's needs.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Experience:
 

  
	 
 Knowledge of analytical methodology including: SDS-PAGE, UV-VIS, HPLC       
	 
 Computer software experience including MS Office, and the ability to perform online chemical database searches. 
 

Preferred Skills/Qualifications:

 

  
	 
 Technical proficiency with laboratory instrumentation and techniques such as HPLC, SDS-PAGE, considered an asset.
	 
 Excellent written and oral communication skills; ability to communicate and interact with professionals and technical specialists in related disciplines.
	 
 Excellent organizational skills.
 

 

CORE COMPETENCIES: 
 

  
	 
 Analytical
	 
 Detail-Oriented
	 
 Information Seeker
	 
 Organized
	 
 Problem Solver
	 
 Adaptable
	 
 Team Player
	 
 Ambitious
	 
 Continuous Learner
	 
 Initiative
	 
 Quality Commitment
	 
 Results-Driven
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: Location is Windsor, NS. You will require housing and your own method of transportation.

				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
appficiency Inc. 

Our purpose is to drive business transformations on the cloud. Our shared values help us achieve our purpose and consistently work towards being the best at what we do. We strive to act with principle, learn together, inspire innovation, and deliver value. We are a fast-paced entrepreneurial company with an initiative to emerge as an industry leader on the NetSuite ERP platform. 

 

As an Oracle NetSuite Alliance Partner, our team works together to bring exceptional industry leading professional services on the NetSuite ERP platform to clients all over North-America from our growing international network of offices. 

 

Our Culture 

appficiency understands that our greatest strength is our people. We always put our talented people first and invests heavily in seeking diverse backgrounds. We then challenges them with the best opportunities to learn, innovate and lead, more than they could elsewhere. We combine advice with action to develop experts that are knowledgeable and passionate about what they do. appficiency is committed to developing a culture built on integrity and collaboration and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. In addition, as part of our growing global network, there are opportunities to work with international teams and clients, or even help lead our global expansion. 

 

NetSuite Consulting: What We Do 

We realize that to maximize value for our clients we need to deliver the best advice and technological solutions unique to their business needs. As part of our team you'll be at the forefront of new initiatives and best practices as we continue to help businesses grow and thrive on the cloud. 

 

We work with clients to define their IT needs, and show them how to get there. We provide technological solutions and support that enterprise's need to improve their performance and better compete in the market. Whether our clients are looking for a focused change initiative or a full-scale enterprise transformation, our team delivers IT solutions that help create a sustainable competitive advantage. 

 

What You'll Do 

We have already been recognized for being the best at what we do, but we are working hard to do even better and that all starts with you. We are a rapidly growing company at the intersection of business and technology which requires entrepreneurial tenacity, motivation to learn, and enterprise building initiative. 

 

No matter your role, you'll be an integral member of the team, focusing on engagements of varying sizes and across diverse industries. In our progressive environment, the projects you work on will drive your learning and accelerate your business acumen and technical expertise. 

 

Our operations team is a key part of our business that ensures that everything is set in place to guarantee the successful delivery of all projects by providing the technology tools that all team members use on a day to day basis. 

 

Our Strategic Business Consultants work across the NetSuite service delivery lifecycle to design, build, test, and implement multiple system components. Professionals in this role will be challenged to leverage the knowledge of application development, business and accounting, and streamlined operations to technically build custom solutions for our clients. 

 

Start Your Future With Us 

At appficiency we believe in career paths with no ceiling. We are invested in helping our people to grow professionally with industry leading opportunities to build up your technical expertise and leadership abilities, all while having exposure to enterprise building decision making. You will start by learning a complex ERP software package that will reward you with in demand expertise you can take anywhere in multiple roles and industries. 

 

appficiency will provide you the best environment to learn as we believe in teaching rather than telling, developing you through shadowing, lessons learned, observation and feedback. Regardless of your interests or skills set, there is ample opportunity to be involved in improving our current practice, or leading something new- our goal is to create a career path that matters to you.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The Operations Co-op will organize and coordinate office administration and procedures in order to ensure organizational effectiveness, efficiency and safety 

 

Responsibilities

 

  
	 
 Monthly invoicing support, Accounts Payable including supplier invoice entry, reconciliation and payments, Accounts Receivable.
	 
 Manage relationships with vendors, service providers and building management, ensuring that all items are invoiced and paid on time.
	 
 Troubleshooting video conference and computer equipment, as well as organize/manage collaboration tools such as G-Suite, 1Password and Zoom.
	 
 Provide support to the HR department by posting job descriptions in different online platforms.
	 
 Be comfortable working with senior executives regularly.
	 
 Become an expert on the NetSuite and other on-line collaboration applications.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Who Are We Looking For?

 

  
	 
 We are looking for an energetic candidate who doesn't mind wearing multiple hats, someone who is a self starter, has initiative and is resourceful when delivering solutions to any given challenge.
	 
 Experienced in handling a wide range of administrative and executive support related tasks and able to work independently with little or no supervision.
	 
 Well organized, flexible and enjoy the administrative challenges of supporting an office of diverse people.
 

Skills

 

  
	 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	 
 Analytical, attention to detail and problem solving skills.
	 
 Knowledge of accounting, data and administrative management practices and procedures as well as bookkeeping experience.
	 
 Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and deal with changing priorities.
	 
 Experience in IT, software, or specific business models such as distribution, manufacturing, professional services, retail, media & advertising, or finance.
	 
 Familiarity with cloud computing technologies.
	 
 Experience with ERP, CRM, or e-commerce applications.
	 
 Troubleshooting video conference issues, system errors, fix and update software on video conference systems.
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing::
Travel

 

  
	 
 Must be willing to travel to and from office once regulations allow it.
	 
 Usual travel can be up to 25% of the total time but can be higher on certain projects.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
You will be the subject matter expert for Appficiency's Netsuite software products, utilizing your expert knowledge and best practices to respond to and resolve our customer's toughest support concerns 
	 
 Identify and route support issues to appropriate groups and escalate issues as required 
	 
 You will have the opportunity to work alongside Appficiency leadership to shape the future of the support organization; not limited to infrastructure, process, technology
	 
 You will serve as the voice of the customer to internal stakeholders, providing insight, data and product design suggestions to inform the team's product development
	 
 Constantly iterate on what support means to internal and external stakeholders, evolving the support organization's SOPs, methodologies, and documentation
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Who are we looking for?

 

  
	 
 We are looking for business and technology smarts; driven and hard-working individuals; and savvy communicators. 
	 
 Someone who possesses the ability to work in a fast-paced environment 
	 
 Willingness to be proactive, take initiative and drive solutions.
 

Must have:

 

  
	 
 Experience  in technical support or help desk experience, preferably at a SaaS company
	 
 Creative troubleshooter, with an analytical approach to problem solving
	 
 Ability to understand technology and software design paired to real business functional needs
	 
 Ability to write, read and develop code (primarily Javascript and some HTML knowledge)
	 
 Ability to quickly understand product design through playing, testing and debugging software
	 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills, highly organized and capable of multitasking
	 
 An owner's mindset: you don't shy away from the hard stuff
 

Nice to have:

 

  
	 
 Experience in Netsuite
	 
 Developer experience or product design experience desirable
	 
 Entrepreneurial mindset with prior start-up culture experience
	 
 Experience working with global teams in different time zones
	 
 Experience following and/or developing Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's)

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Transportation Planning Co-Op-Available Spring 2022 (May-Aug 2022) 

  

Want to work for a company that invests in innovation and people who catalyze impact in the built environment? Arup is proud to be recognized by Fast Company in their third annual Best Workplaces for Innovators list, which honors businesses and organizations that demonstrate a deep commitment to encouraging innovation at all levels. 

 

We find solutions for some of the world's most complex problems. From climate action to social value, we consider the broadest impacts of our work. We strive to build a more sustainable, resilient, and equitable future. This purpose shapes our culture and has made us leaders in sustainable development. You'd be joining our multi-disciplinary design teams focusing on technical excellence and innovative solutions that create a better future for people, places, and the planet. 

 

During your career at Arup, you'll have the chance to engage in a fulfilling career and work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. 

 

Notable Projects 

Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects across our industry. We offer a broad range of professional services to clients around the world that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work.
 

  
	 
 Calgary Cancer Center
	 
 University of British Colombia
	 
 National Music Centre of Canada
	 
 Tim Horton's Field 
	 
 New Champlain Bridge
	 
 Queen's Way West Revitalization
	 
 Toronto Pearson International Airport
 

Arup is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We consider all qualified candidates regardless of national origin, veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or other status protected by law. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please contact us at americasbenefits@arup.com. 

 

For the fifth consecutive year, Arup has been named one of Greater Toronto's top employers! Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2022 are recognized for exceptional human resources programs and forward-thinking workplace policies. Find out more about what makes our Toronto office an outstanding place to work here: Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2022 (Arup)
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
As a Transportation Planning Intern, your responsibilities include the following

 

  
	 
 Supporting senior staff who manage different areas of our business with focus particularly on analysis of transit projects (using various tools) and pedestrian spaces using Arup's proprietary software, MassMotion
	 
 Working collaboratively with peers to define and test alternative solutions
	 
 Working autonomously, as context requires and thinking laterally to help solve challenging transport and access problems
	 
 Contributing to team discussions regarding potential new areas of business and innovative ways to provide service to the market
	 
 Attending project and client meetings supporting more senior staff
	 
 Engaging fully in Arup's graduate program
	 
 Networking with other graduates across our Canadian offices
	 
 Building external networks of peers
	 
 Engaging in ongoing professional development in consultation with your team leader
	 
 Committing to Arup's induction processes and over time, learning about our broader business including other groups represented in Canada and elsewhere
	 
 Helping to prepare high quality project deliverables, including print documentation and presentations
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Currently pursuing a degree/course in Regional Planning, Civil Engineering, data sciences or closely-related discipline
	 
 Some work experience in the transportation planning industry either through research applications or internships
	 
 Authorized to work in Canada and not require a visa sponsorship

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Alimentiv Inc., located in London, Ontario, with offices in San Diego and The Netherlands, is a global specialty Contract Research Organization that provides clinical research services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies, government agencies and academic investigators. We have achieved academic excellence and a track record in the performance of multi-center clinical trials since 1986. We are a growing organization with a strong commitment to teamwork and scientific excellence. Alimentiv is recognized as an international leader in outcomes development, randomized trials, and centralized imaging solutions. 

  

The Alimentiv Statistics MRD team is a growing group that works closely with the Medical Research and Development team to provide data collection, analysis, and presentation services for clinical studies. Under the supervision of Manager, Statistics and Statistical Programming, the successful candidate will leverage their knowledge of statistics to support multiple ongoing clinical studies. This position will provide an opportunity to be actively involved clinical research by providing project support, methodological development and reporting, and the development and maintenance of standardized coding.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Activities can include but are not limited to:

 

  
	 
 Carry out statistical analysis using standard software packages to interpret and translate results within a statistical framework into biomedical terms.
	 
 Prepare statistical data and results for inclusion in reports and research papers.
	 
 Working in conjunction with the Biostatistician Director develop, convert, and present new and novel biometrical methodologies and findings into publishable and promotable scientific processes and results.
	 
 Prepare statistical analysis plan and oversee product data collection management and analysis with input from the project teams.
	 
 Develop and program reporting tools to support internal data management teams.
 

Provide analysis support by developing SAS programs for tables, listing and figures (TFLs).
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Qualifications: 

You will work in an environment that is constantly changing and should be able to work both independently and as part of a team, possess effective verbal and written communication skills, and be strongly motivated to meet timelines and project goals.
 

  
	 
 Have completed or are near completion of a bachelor's degree in science with a strong emphasis on statistical analysis
 

A solid foundation in statistical programming.Knowledge of the statistical programming language is a plus.

				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Biological Sciences

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Bluerover is a leader in the Internet of Things. Bluerover is engineering unique and customized business solutions, by combining sensor technology, data intelligence, and automated processes, within a secure, scalable, and open architecture platform. With Bluerover technology, data is collected in an infinite stream from the business environments, and processed, presented and reported to the customer within a scalable, internet based platform. 

 

We are looking for a Co-op Student Product Developer, Web Application to plan, manage, execute, and maintain the Bluerover product suite. The position goal is to create innovative, high quality, and stable software systems. 

 

The Co-op Student Product Developer, Web Application role calls for someone with a passion for product development using those tools and best practices to deliver best in class solutions. The solutions that you develop will be used to configure, control and manage IoT solutions. At Bluerover you will have the opportunity to engage with a wide range of engineering disciplines. 

 

This person should be able to apply accepted software design principles, demonstrate exceptional problem solving skills and possess strong communication skills. 

 

The most important attribute of a candidate is the ability to deliver high quality products to market. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, and will see this as an opportunity to achieve a world-class product deployment.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Execute the development plan with the software engineering team.  This involves coding, code review with team members, and testing. 
	 
 Assess third party and open source software.
	 
 Analyse and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources.
	 
 Integrate and validate new product designs to existing products.
	 
 Support software QA and optimise performance.
	 
 Provide production and post production support.
	 
 Refactor existing code.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Currently enrolled in Computer Science or Engineering.
	 
 Experience in software development and troubleshooting.
	 
  
    
		 
   Programming experience with Web Applications and Linux.
		 
   Programming languages: JavaScript, SQL, HTML, and CSS.
	 
  
	
	 
 Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools, and peer review
	 
 Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems
	 
 Strong verbal and written communication skills
	 
 Qualify for ITAC Talent Work Integrated Learning Program
	 
  
    
		 
   Canadian citizen, permanent resident or have refugee status
		 
   Eligible to work in Canada
		 
   Enrolled in full-time program at post-secondary level
	 
  
	
	 
 This is an on-site position that require in-person attentance, not a remote position.

Want to work for a company that invests in innovation and people who catalyze impact in the built environment? Arup is proud to be recognized by Fast Company in their third annual Best Workplaces for Innovators list, which honors businesses and organizations that demonstrate a deep commitment to encouraging innovation at all levels. 

 

We find solutions for some of the world's most complex problems. From climate action to social value, we consider the broadest impacts of our work. We strive to build a more sustainable, resilient, and equitable future. This purpose shapes our culture and has made us leaders in sustainable development. You'd be joining our multi-disciplinary design teams focusing on technical excellence and innovative solutions that create a better future for people, places, and the planet.

You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment.

(http://www.oasys-software.com/products/engineering/massmotion.html) 

 

Want to work for a company that invests in innovation and people who catalyze impact in the built environment? Arup is proud to be recognized by Fast Company in their third annual Best Workplaces for Innovators list, which honors businesses and organizations that demonstrate a deep commitment to encouraging innovation at all levels. 

 

We find solutions for some of the world's most complex problems. From climate action to social value, we consider the broadest impacts of our work. We strive to build a more sustainable, resilient, and equitable future. This purpose shapes our culture and has made us leaders in sustainable development. You'd be joining our multi-disciplinary design teams focusing on technical excellence and innovative solutions that create a better future for people, places, and the planet. 

 

During your internship at Arup, you'll have the chance to engage in a fulfilling career and work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. 

 

MassMotion is a 3D application used by Arup and sold to commercial customers and academic users to analyze the movement of people through transit stations, theatres, offices, stadiums, and public spaces around the world. MassMotion simulations begin with a 3D model of an environment.  Users then customize the environment and populate it with autonomous agents.  Each agent navigates the environment based on user-defined goals, available routes, signage, and pedestrian congestion. 

 

MassMotion is an Arup product written in C/C++, leveraging a variety of open source libraries including OpenGL, Qt, and SQLite.  The development team is small and works closely with users, to develop and test features. The successful candidate will assist with further development of the MassMotion application, including cloud transition, simulation engine changes, feature development, and more.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: The virology technician will work on molecular biology aspects related to plant viruses in the Niagara region. The successful candidate will analyze RNA sequencing data to identify plant virus sequences, perform phylogenetics analysis, and work towards the identification of novel plant viruses. Work will also involve field and lab work involving sampling from agricultural fields, and performing molecular biology (RNA extraction, RT-PCR) experiments in the lab. This position requires in person attendance in Vineland, ON, but given the uncertainty of COVID19, work from home bioinformatics tasks can be performed in event of lockdown restrictions.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Identification of novel viral sequences from RNAseq data.
	 
 Sequence analysis and identification of regions of low and high diversity.
	 
 Produce phylogenies of viral genome sequences.
	 
 RNA extraction
	 
 RT-PCR
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
RNA sequence analysis
	 
 Experience with "R" programming language
	 
 Phylogenetics experience
	 
 Experience with NCBI and other online bioinformatics resources
	 
 Experience with molecular biology lab work (RNA extraction, RT-PCR).
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: No public transit to Vineland station is available, car required. The closest major towns are St. Catharines and Hamilton. Candidates are responsible for their own transportation and housing. In the event of lockdown restrictions, at home work can be provided.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Founded in 1938, Agropur cooperative is a leader in the North American dairy industry with sales of $ 7.3 billion in 2019. The Cooperative is a source of pride for its 3,024 members and its 8000 employees who work together, every day, for the same vision: "better milk. Betterworld. ". Agropur processes more than 6.2 billion liters of milk per year at its 35 plants in North America and offers an impressive range of brands and products including Natrel, OKA, Agropur Grand Cheddar, Olympic, Farmers, Island Farms and Québon. Agropur's head office is LEED Silver certified.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About Blimp 

 

Blimp Homes is a VC-Backed Real Estate + Blockchain startup founded in 2020. 

You'll be joining a world class engineering team who loves to come up with amazing ideas and build them rapidly. You'll be contributing to multiple products and seeing your commits go live in production many times throughout the term. 

The founders of the company are largely Waterloo Co-op alums and we're eager to give you an awesome experience - you'll have ample opportunity to contribute ideas to the product and the tech stack/architecture. 

  

We're building a platform to greatly improve the home search experience through decentralization. Home buyers can browse 120 million homes across the US and Canada, each with a set of data and statistics that we calculate through leading edge machine learning predictive models. Users get rewarded throughout the process with tokens and NFTs that can be used to unlock additional features. Users can also leverage the Blimp Homes mobile app to coordinate their home purchase by adding professionals and communicating with all parties through an easy to use chat interface. 

 

Blimp's leadership team includes many of the founders of Parallel NFT - currently the 15th most popular NFT project of all time.  

  

Our platform is currently in open beta with major releases coming in Q2 of 2022,  we're looking for team members that have a passion for block chain to make meaningful contributions to a highly anticipated crypto project.

We're building a platform to greatly improve the home search experience through decentralization. Home buyers can browse 120 million homes across the US and Canada, each with a set of data and statistics that we calculate using machine learning models derived from large and varied datasets. Users get rewarded throughout the process with tokens and NFTs that can be used to unlock additional features. Users can also leverage the Blimp Homes mobile app to coordinate their home purchase by adding professionals and communicating with all parties through an easy to use chat interface. 

  

Our platform is currently in open beta with major releases coming in Q2 of 2022,  we're looking for team members that have a passion for block chain to make meaningful contributions to a highly anticipated crypto project.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
What is an Agnico Eagle Internship? 

At Agnico Eagle, we think an internship is not only a way to practice your learning, it also is an incredible opportunity to develop yourself; your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company.  And, we value your commitment to treat every person on our team with respect, helping us to operate safely, protect the environment and make a positive contribution to our local communities. Moreover, your internship will take place within the incomparable wild northern environment which will certainly stimulate new apprenticeship. 

  

What Do You Value In A Career? 

At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility.  Why?  Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years. 

  

About Meliadine and Our Nunavut Operations 

Agnico Eagle is always looking for new talented team members to join our Nunavut mining operations. Meliadine is located just northwest of Rankin Inlet, a small coastal town on the shores of Hudson Bay. Commercial production began at Meliadine in mid-May 2019 and the mine officially opened at the end of June. This mine is our largest gold deposit in terms of mineral resources and we expect to operate it for at least 14 years. The site features a power plant and processing facilities, as well as a complete camp complex.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Company 

 

ArcX Inc. designs and supports industrial products, mostly used in auto manufacturing. With less than 30 employees, ArcX provides many opportunities to learn and contribute to aspects of the company outside of the initial role.  Individuals can maintain independence while still being able to draw on the experience of any one of the skilled staff. 

 

Location 

 

The ArcX office is located in Markham.  ArcX recognizes that on-site collaboration provides the best opportunity for learning, however to maintain a safer work environment and encourage work-life balance, we have implemented a hybrid model for those who want to and can work remotely up to 2 days a week.  Depending on public health recommendation, employees may be encouraged to work remotely more often.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Embedded Developer 

 

In this role you will support senior developers writing firmware for embedded devices designed and produced by ArcX.  The firmware is written mostly in C and 

runs an RTOS (e.g. freeRTOS).  The products are generally network attached and the tasks are typically related to network connectivity or interfacing with external devices.  Experience interfacing with a microcontroller and knowledge of threading/thread-safety is an asset. 

 

You will report to the firmware manager and are expected to work closely with a senior developer to divide up tasks such as defining and implementing new features, reproducing and fixing reported issues, releasing new versions, and automating releases.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Skills a successful candidate has or is eager to learn: 

  

Desired: 

  - C development for resource constrained systems 

  - Debugging techniques for embedded systems 

  - Network protocols 

  - IPC and threading 

 

Nice to have: 

  - Automated builds (e.g. Jenkins) 

  - Source control and code review

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
In this role you will support the applications team writing web applications that are typically based on an ArcX designed platform and are deployed internally to various industrial clients to support manufacturing.  The application has multiple parts including a JavaScript server-side API that communicates with an event-based document database, an administrative front-end, and HTML device interfaces that control ArcX industrial hardware.  Experience with JavaScript (both server and client), HTML, CSS, and client frameworks (like Angular) is an asset. 

 

You will report to the applications managers and are expected to interface with the development team to accomplish tasks such as defining and implementing new features, reproducing and fixing reported issues, remotely supporting clients with deployment/configuration/maintenance, and developer-level testing.

Skills a successful candidate has or is eager to learn: 

  

Desired: 

  - JavaScript development for server-side and client-side 

  - UX design and implementation using web technologies 

  - Document based databases 

  - Docker 

  

Nice to have: 

  - Interfacing with industrial hardware & embedded devices 

  - Automated builds (e.g. Jenkins) 

  - Source control and code review

In this role you will support various product teams by assisting with the definition of test plans, manually executing test plans, and writing automated tests in  scripting languages such as JavaScript and Python.  The products are industrial devices and software systems produced by ArcX.  Manual tests involve physical interactions with screens, connecting to external hardware, interacting with a UI, etc.  Automated tests are typically scripts run over the network to test APIs, but may also involve automating UI interactions. Experience using automated test frameworks in an asset. 

 

You will report to the QA manager and are expected to interface with other teams to understand the product requirement and clearly explain any issues discovered. You will need to be comfortable connecting hardware to set up test beds (which may require wiring in some cases).

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Architecture49 is a growing firm with promising career opportunities for talented people. Our offices, situated from coast to coast across Canada, house a diverse and accomplished group of architects, interior designers, technologists, landscape architects, and support staff, and we are always looking for new people to enrich our team. 

 

At A49, we foster friendly, open working environments where employees can thrive on congenial collaboration. We seek meaningful projects where we can build on our focused expertise and impact the communities in which we work. We strive to build strong relationships with clients and colleagues. We recognize the quality, motivation, and commitment of our employees and celebrate their achievements. 

 

A49 is a national leader in the integrated design and delivery of some of Canada's most important buildings and environments.  With 300 employees and 12 offices from coast to coast across Canada, the firm boasts a history spanning over half a century of profoundly significant contributions to cities and communities.  We are focused in six key areas of expertise: Science & Technology, Hospitality, Healthcare, Security & Defense, Sports & Entertainment and Transportation.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: We are currently seeking a talented and enthusiastic coop student for our Toronto office who will assist in realizing a number of important projects both in the public and private sector.  The intimate size of our Toronto office will allow the coop student an unusual opportunity of exposure to all aspects of working in an architectural firm whilst having creative autonomy.  The student will engage in multiple phases of the architectural process, which includes but are not limited to, design proposals, schematic and design development, construction drawings as well as permitting, and the construction process.  He/She will be a part of a dedicated project team, where the student will be expected to share ideas and communicate as a contributing member.  In the past, this job also included product research on building materials and finishes, assist in maintaining the building materials library, and other operational functions.  At A49 we have a mentorship program that allows students to familiarize themselves with the business, project management, submitting successful proposals, and BIM activities.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
The student should be proficient in: 

- Creating presentation drawings and diagrams 

-Intermediate Revit skills 

- 3D renderings 

- Architectural design drawings as well as technical and construction drawings 

- Basic knowledge of the Ontario Building Code 

- Experience in the required software: Revit, AutoCAD, Rhino, Sketchup, Vray, Adobe Creative Suite. 

- Self motivated and requires little supervision 

- Out going and positive attitude

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 2233 Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists and Technicians
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

At Advanced Test and Automation (ATA), the Engineering Technician co-op position is a technical hands-on resource across all product streams and test service initiatives. The role assists in the hands-on implementation and validation of detailed designs to deliver on test requirements driven by global automotive OEM test standards.  

To thrive in this role, the person will be persistent, reliable, punctual, and systematic in how they engage and execute test phases. In ensuring successful delivery of various fluid power test products and services, the Engineering Technician will be working with Research & Development Engineers, Test Engineers, Millwrights, Electricians, Procurement Specialists and Order Managers. 

 

ATA'S 3 CORE VALUES

 

  
	 
 NOW is the time: We act with anticipation and purpose. We believe there's no time like the present to make an impact and to set a new standard for ourselves and the industry. We like to defy the odds when others think it can't be done. 
	 
 I will communicate, not hide: We value honesty, accountability, and dependability. We do not shy away from difficult subjects. In our commitments to the team, our customers, our suppliers, and our partners we care personally while challenging directly.
	 
 I will create, not accept: We focus on improvement and innovation.  We challenge ourselves to develop the best technology for the task at hand rather than make do with what's currently available.  We constantly look for ways to do better, for leading-edge technology, for the next advances.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
ROLE REQUIREMENTS

 

  
	 
 Conduct hands-on product, prototype and part tests to evaluate performance, durability, and compliance characteristics against design criteria.
	 
 Maintain records of data files from test lab activities, and participate in data analysis and/or data report preparation activities with test engineers.
	 
 Interpret and validate electrical schematics on test equipment, including products, prototypes, test services, and service & support initiatives.
	 
 Interpret and validate custom machined components from external suppliers match internal engineering drawings.
	 
 Interface with electricians and electrical engineers to assist in the build and/or validation of test equipment.
	 
 Interface with mechanics and mechanical engineers to assist in the build and/or validation of test equipment. Execute basic mechanical assembly procedures.
	 
 Interface with software engineers to highlight potential optimizations in test sequences, control algorithms, user interface layouts, etc
	 
 Participate in R&D prototype validation initiatives to de-risk component and/or module functionality, for product and/or test service offerings.
	 
 Provide input and ideas for cost optimization of existing products. Recommend changes to the engineering design of equipment in order to simplify assembly and maintenance.
	 
 Participate in product and process FMEA studies for equipment or test service designs.
	 
 Participate in internal and customer order status meetings.
	 
 Participate in final product build and functional quality control.

 Work safely, following company Health and Safety procedures and promote safety within the company. Adopt a high degree of safety consciousness and follow strict safety procedures.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

At Advanced Test and Automation (ATA), the Engineering Technician co-op position assignment is to launch, from concept, ATA's Flagship second generation AERIFY product. This role will be working closely with the  Research & Development Engineers, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Quality Managers as well as a team of junior professional engineers. The role requires hand-on technical execution skills in product design and engineering in addition to coordination and product management skills.  

 

To thrive in this role, the person will be persistent, reliable, punctual, and systematic in how they engage and execute test phases. A passion for research and innovation will ensure success in this role.  

 

ATA'S 3 CORE VALUES

 

  
	 
 NOW is the time: We act with anticipation and purpose. We believe there's no time like the present to make an impact and to set a new standard for ourselves and the industry. We like to defy the odds when others think it can't be done. 
	 
 I will communicate, not hide: We value honesty, accountability, and dependability. We do not shy away from difficult subjects. In our commitments to the team, our customers, our suppliers, and our partners we care personally while challenging directly.
	 
 I will create, not accept: We focus on improvement and innovation.  We challenge ourselves to develop the best technology for the task at hand rather than make do with what's currently available.  We constantly look for ways to do better, for leading-edge technology, for the next advances.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::

 Research and development of new generation of AERIFY existing product
	 
 Support the CAD design, prototype development, manual testing, and manufacturing release of product.
	 
 Hands-on software, mechanical and electronics build of the second generation AERIFY system. 
	 
 Coordinate with Engineering, Supply Chain, Production and Quality departments to ensure constant progress of the project.
	 
 Coordinate with customers to incorporate feed-back from existing products and experience.  
	 
 Develop the calibration concept for fluid sensors and support implementation of ISO17025 calibration program for Aerify.

 Familiarity with hydraulic and pneumatic systems and machined hardware such as NPT fittings, fasteners and custom machined components

 Automotive, aviation or other highly regulated industry experience
	 
 Excellent understanding of Google Sheets, Docs, Drive, Chat and Gmail
	 
 Ability to overcome challenges with patience, creativity, and attention to detail
	 
 Excellent communication, organizational, analytical and problem solving skills
	 
 Strong time management skills with the ability to effectively manage multiple priorities and activities
	 
 Team player but also strong leadership skills
	 
 Strong time management skills with the ability to effectively manage multiple assignments and shifting priorities in a fast-changing environment.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Company Background: 

  

Aspect Structural Engineers was founded on the premise of becoming a 'next generation' structural engineering firm: mixing the drive to lead and innovate with rock-solid technical expertise, modern project delivery methods, and an amazing workplace. In 5 short years, Aspect has grown rapidly to a team of 40+ bright, innovative, and diverse people, with offices in Vancouver, BC, Toronto, ON, and Bern, Switzerland. 

  

We bring a fresh perspective to traditional structural engineering that is backed by the extensive and varied experience of our talented team. We put this into practice by continually delivering significant projects that demonstrate our "above and beyond" approach, our technical excellence, and our deep focus on collaboration. 

  

About The Role: 

  

Our Toronto office is looking for an engineering student to join our team for a 4-8-month Co-op term! 

  

You will have a chance to work with our passionate and innovative talented team on a range of commercial, residential, and institutional projects as well as many unique and architecturally expressive buildings. Here at Aspect, you'll join a unique informal culture that values diversity, drive, accountability, quality and collaboration - These aren't just buzzwords, they're part of everything we do!
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
You will:

 

  
	 
 Support engineers with design work and gain experience in the office or on project sites
	 
 Collaborate with diverse teams locally and globally
	 
 Have an opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to contribute to the team's success
	 
 Participate in local social staff activities, lunch and learns, and engineering workshops with the Aspect team
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Our ideal candidate: 

 

  
	 
 A 3rd year or higher engineering student, currently enrolled in a Civil Engineering program from an accredited university or college.
	 
 Has completed engineering courses in structural analysis concrete design, steel design, and timber design
	 
 Has a sound understanding of both engineering and design fundamentals
	 
 Enthusiastic and ambitious
	 
 Has excellent communication skills (both written and oral)
	 
 Has strong attention to detail and organizational skills
	 
 Is a quick learner that enjoys a challenge 
	 
 Is a team player who wants to contribute to a fun and collaborative work environment
	 
 Previous work or co-op experience in the architectural, engineering, and construction industry
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
What you can expect from us: 

 

  
	 
 Knowledge transfer and mentorship from our talented engineers and designers
	 
 The opportunity to gain experience in a variety of technical areas
	 
 The opportunity to provide support on innovative, inspiring, and iconic projects that not only make an impact on local communities but worldwide.
	 
 A healthy and fun workplace culture that encourages our team to thrive both inside and outside of the office.
	 
 Virtual and in-person team building events
	 
 The ability to truly see the impact of your project support work
	 
 Fair compensation 
 

For more information about Aspect, please visit our website: http://aspectengineers.com/

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
AirBoss of America Corp. develops, manufactures and markets high-quality, proprietary rubber-based products to various industries, including automotive, heavy industry, construction and infrastructure, oil & gas, and defense. For more information go to www.airbossofamerica.com.  

  

We are looking for energetic, capable students interested in gaining manufacturing experience and contributing to our Continuous Improvement Program.  While performing a vital manufacturing role at our Kitchener facility, you will learn all facets of the process.  This experience, coupled with your education will enable you to provide us with insights into continuous improvement opportunities.  

  

As we continue to grow, we will have ample future opportunities for those students who excel in our environment.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
-       Is a safety advocate; lead by example by complying with all plant and Occupational Health and Safety policies. 

-       Ability to follow a step by step process to support the overall production of high quality rubber compound. 

-       The Mill Operator will be responsible for the milling and blending of the compounds and the sheeting of the compounds to the customer specifications. Will monitor the process as the compound is sheeted off the mill and passes through the conveyor system, dip tank, and cooling rack on its way to the Piler. 

-       The Piler will be responsible to prepare the pallet, crate, gaylord, etc., as per the Finishing/Shipping Specification. Check the Finishing/Shipping Specification on the production schedule for the specific packaging instructions.  e.g. type of skid or pallet, required sampling and packaging, and proper width and thickness. The Piler is responsible for the last Quality Control inspection. 

-       The Scale Operator will be responsible to weigh up the materials as required and keep the conveyor full to feed. Will assist other operators in the verification of the scales. 

-       The Quality Lab Technician will be responsible to perform rheometer, viscosity, and tensile testing of various compounds. 

-       Some positions require lifting up to 50 pounds. 

-       Ability to work with minimal supervision and in a team environment. 

-       Following detailed instructions to meet quality standards. 

-       Ensuring safety requirements are met at all times. 

-       Working as a team to achieve department and company targets. 

-       Learning various tasks and demonstrating flexibility to support various production associates as required. 

-       Working with various hand tools including tightner, air hoist, knifes and tack hammer etc.

-       Excellent attendance 

-       Ability to follow and adhere to Good Manufacturing Practices 

-       Strong ability to listen and follow instructions 

-       Previous manufacturing experience is an asset

-       Good communication skills, both verbal and written 

-       Motivated and positive attitude 

-       Safety Shoes are required

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
OUR COMPANY  

  

A global leader in the transportation sector, in the digital age. We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. 

  

Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 70000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact. 

  

With the integration of Bombardier Transportation on January 29, 2021, the enlarged Group's combined proforma sales reached €14 billion for the 12-month period ended March 31, 2021. Based in France, Alstom is now present in 70 country and its head office for the Americas region is in St-Bruno, Quebec. In Canada, Alstom has more than 4,300 employees, including 1,800 in Quebec. 

 

Based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be responsible to support the local Engineering team in multiple tasks related to change management, equipment modifications and reliability improvement. 

You will support success of our fleet modification projects by being an active member in all stages of the project. You will also have the opportunity to participate in real ''hands-on" engineering issues on a passenger railroad, in a very dynamic environment.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
YOUR INTERNSHIP 

  

During your internship, you will be asked to perform the following tasks: 

 
 

  
	 
 Support technical problem solving related to the vehicles
	 
 Propose equipment modification, based on 1. existing failure analysis, 2. Improving customer experience, 3. Improving Safety
	 
 Support existing mechanical and/ or electrical engineering as per requires
	 
 Participate in design review/ validation, implementation planning, project material procurement and Quality Assurance planning
	 
 Support the change management process to improve its efficiency.
 

As part of your job, you will be asked to:

 

  
	 
 Solve straight forward problems, analyze possible solutions using acquired experience and judgment
	 
 Review Supplier's technical documentation
	 
 Prepare Project Timelines
	 
 Produce the required engineering reports
	 
 Follow-up on action items
	 
 Collaborate with different department of the Maintenance teams to achieve desired outcome
	 
 Actively participate in project development
	 
 Attend and present at meetings with our customer
	 
 Participate or lead vehicle modification activities
	 
 Assist teams in root cause analysis and solution implementation
	 
 Analyze data and make recommendations
	 
 Assist/lead with change management
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
YOUR PROFILE  

 

As our ideal candidate, you:
 

  
	 
 Are pursuing a bachelor's degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering 
	 
 Have an analytical spirit and attention to detail
	 
 Thrive in a team oriented and autonomous work environment
	 
 Have a Continuous Improvement and data driven mindset
	 
 Are Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Power Point and Project)
	 
 Have experience (or interest) in Reliability
	 
 Have CAD software experience (AutoCAD, CATIA V5)
	 
 Have strong communication & interpersonal skills
	 
 Have Project Management experience would be an asset
	 
 Have strong communication & interpersonal skills
	 
 Are Fluent in English, written and spoken.
 

If you're looking for a company with a strong purpose and the ambition to play a role in climate change by leading the way to greener and smarter mobility, if you are ambitious and would like to embark on a challenging, global journey, and if you have a certain sense of entrepreneurship: 

Come and leave your mark on the world, with us!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
BBE Canada is in the process of growing our engineering team and would like to offer a co-op position to a mechanical engineering student with the possibility of permanent employment upon graduation.  

BBE has been cooling and ventilating the hottest and deepest mines in the World for over 30-years and are widely regarded as World leaders.  Simply put, our job is to provide acceptable environmental conditions for people and equipment in underground mines.  BBE has a successful track record of doing this and the successful applicant will work with World renowned experts on real projects.  

Mine cooling systems include both surface and underground refrigeration plants with the aim of cooling large volumes of air, mine service water cooling using refrigeration, and mine air cooling using ice produced by low temperate refrigeration systems.  Primary mine ventilation systems include surface and/or underground fans operating at relatively high pressures and volumes. The work will likely involve both office-based desktop analysis and site visits. 

Mechanical engineers typically lead BBE mine cooling and ventilation system design utilizing their unique skill set with a focus on thermodynamics and fluid mechanics.  This is an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic mechanical engineer to put their knowledge to real-world use in aid of providing safe environmental conditions for underground mine workers. 

This is currently envisioned to be an in-office position based out of Sudbury but it will involve close working with remote staff elsewhere. There is a potential that part of this work term would be delivered out of the Oakville area.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Job responsibilities include:
 

  
	 
 Apply ventilation and cooling theories and techniques to mines.
	 
 Contribution to and development of system design criteria, process flow diagrams (PFDs), and piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs).
	 
 Contribution to and preparation of equipment lists, data sheets, material take-offs (MTOs) and technical memoranda.
	 
 Development of scope of work and technical specifications documents.
	 
 Liaise with and provide input to other engineering and support groups.
	 
 Guide draftsman in 3D CAD generation and review/approve formal engineering drawings.
	 
 Prepare and contribute to technical and commercial adjudications.
	 
 Prepare and contribute to basis of estimates as well as operating and capital cost estimates.
	 
 Participate in mine refrigeration and ventilation audits, performance assessments, and associated environmental surveys.
	 
 Identify and select appropriate ventilation/cooling equipment including fans, ducting, refrigeration equipment, air coolers, pumps, piping, heat rejection cooling towers and associated equipment.
	 
 Partake in mine cooling and ventilation system construction support, commissioning, fault-finding, and optimization.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
In general terms, BBE mine cooling and ventilation systems are initially developed using analytical calculations, these analytical calculations are then used as the basis for software modelling, running multiple scenarios, and once the system is built and operating, experimental methods are used to validate the analytics and modelling.  The skills required for success include a fundamental understanding and ability to apply a first principles approach to fluid and thermal systems which includes the following topics:
 

  
	 
 Thermodynamics
	 
 Fluid mechanics
	 
 Heat transfer
	 
 Heat exchangers
	 
 Piping and pump systems
	 
 Refrigeration
	 
 Heat load analysis
	 
 Psychrometry
	 
 Duct and fan systems
 

  

The successful applicant should be comfortable conducting analytical calculations from first principles.  This includes concise, step-by-step presentation of analyses such as:
 

  
	 
 Defining the problem
	 
 Generating a schematic
	 
 Stating and validating assumptions and approximations
	 
 Presenting the analysis
	 
 Discussing the results
 

  

Verification of system equipment and system performance using experimental techniques may be conducted with a focus on:
 

  
	 
 Capturing data
	 
 Interpreting the data
	 
 Conducting uncertainty analyses
 

  

Required assets:
 

  
	 
 Ability to do physical tasks at work sites.
	 
 Ontario/Canadian valid driver's licence
	 
 Good communication, comprehension skills and fluency in English, with the ability to write technical reports and instructions in English.
	 
 COVID vaccinations including booster
 

  

Optional assets:
 

  
	 
 French/Spanish language skills
 

  

Note:
 

  
	 
 Some of our client's work sites have specific "fit" for work policies to ensure a safety-sensitive work environment,  where persons can perform their duties with no limitations due to the use or after effects of alcohol or drugs.

BBE will cover reasonable travel costs to and from Sudbury 

 

Finding accomodation is the responsibility of the student

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Alta Planning + Design Canada is seeking a Planning Intern to join our team from June-August 2022 in our Ottawa, Ontario office.  This is a unique opportunity for anyone who wants to start their career in active transportation.  If you are looking for an innovative organization that is an industry leader in active transportation, want to work with talented and passionate professionals, apply with us today! 

 

Alta Planning + Design Canada is an active transportation company dedicated to creating active, healthy communities through planning, landscape architecture, engineering, and education/encouragement programs. Alta was founded in 1996 when cities and communities were calling for safer streets for people walking and bicycling as the non-motorized transportation movement developed into a profession in the United States. We pioneered the field of active transportation, evolving our planning and design work into a visionary global practice that empowers people to live active, healthy lives and getting them to where they need to go.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
This is a temporary, full-time (30+ hours a week), entry-level, opportunity to jumpstart your career and gain hands-on experience in the Active Transportation world.  With an internship at Alta, you'll be exposed to a variety of projects, learn about consulting, and collaborate across disciplines and geographies with passionate engineers, landscape architects, urban planners, graphic designers, and civic data analysts.  You'll be able to have an impact on communities and how people get around. 

 

A general understanding of the field of urban planning, landscape architecture, or transportation engineering, a passion for active transportation, and the ability to collaborate across discipline boundaries are required in order to successfully meet the requirements of this position. 

The essential priorities of this position are to: 

Gain functional knowledge and skills in urban planning, landscape architecture and design, or civil engineering that pertain to active transportation 

Learn about the world of consulting 

Contribute to the production of project deliverables. 

Participate in ongoing research and development efforts
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
A general understanding of the field of urban planning, landscape architecture, or transportation engineering, a passion for active transportation, and the ability to collaborate across disciplines are required in order to successfully meet the requirements of this position.  Additionally, you must be: 

Students currently enrolled in a bachelor's (junior year or above) or master's program in the field of study related to Alta's practices, OR recent graduates who have no career experience in the field 

Strong initiative, attention to detail, and a can-do mindset 

Ability to work in an environment of competing priorities and multiple simultaneous projects 

Good interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills 

Exhibits accuracy, attention to detail and strong organizational skills 

Ability to learn new technical skills and problem solve 

General understanding of MS Excel, Word, Adobe Creative Suite, G-Suite
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: Out of area candidates will be eligible for $1000 to put toward relocation costs
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
The pay for this internship is Can$ 22/hour for those in bachelor's programs, Can$ 24/hour for those in master's programs. 

Temporary employees are not eligible for other benefits unless mandated by state or local law.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
The Bioprocess Research Co-op will support the research team in the development and optimization of the food waste fermentation and purification technology. The role will report to the Research Lead and will work closely with the research team to conduct literary and lab-based R&D. This role is designed for rapid growth in the company and can lead to a permanent position. 

 

About ALT TEX: 

ALT TEX is a seed stage biomaterials startup, on a mission to create the world's most sustainable fabrics through our ALTernative TEXtile innovation. Through our proprietary biotechnology, we're taking one of the world's largest landfill contributors - food waste - and re-engineering it into biodegradable and carbon neutral fabrics with polyester-like performance.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Support the design and execution of bench-scale research experiments involving feedstock evaluation and fermentation optimization
	 
 Optimize bioreactor conditions, reagents and microorganisms to increase efficiency and yield of fermentation experiments - complete product performance and yield evaluations and implement continuous improvement practices
	 
 Rapidly assess a variety of feedstocks through substrate compositional analyses (i.e. sugar composition) and improve feedstock pre-treatment methods
	 
 Develop and execute analytical procedures for product and byproduct identification via assays and chromatography
	 
 Support day-to-day research operations including material tracking/ordering and organizing lab activity and workplans
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You're an impact and sustainability focused innovator who wants to use their talent for massively scalable change. You're a risk taker, ready to immerse yourself in an incredibly fast-paced and dynamic team, in a position that offers rapid job growth opportunity. You're an innovative thinker and want to bring bold ideas to the table where you can supercharge them to fruition. 

 
 

  
	 
 
   
		 
  
    
			 
   Your background
			& experience:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Bachelor's degree (WIP) or higher in related science field
				 
     1+ years in scientific research setting with experience in microoganism cultivation and fermentation (preferred)
				 
     Experience with operation and maintenance of bioreactors (preferred)
				 
     Experience with purification techniques (i.e. distillation, vacuum filtration, etc.)
				 
     Experience with analytical methods (e.g. NMR, optical purity assays, chromatography such as HPLC, GC, etc.)
			 
    
			
		 
  
		 
  
    
			 
   Your
			skills & attributes:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Entrepreneurial: you're highly independent with the ability to self-drive fast-paced projects with extreme resourcefulness and speed
				 
     Innovative and analytical: you're a big picture, out of the box thinker who is always questioning the norm and approaches problem solving with disruptive thinking
				 
     Impact oriented: you're out to change the world and your work means more to you than a 9-5
				 
     Action oriented: you're a leader and self-starter who makes things happen without the need for significant structure or delegation

This position will develop expertise in using our software. This position will work closely with the System Administrator Team Leader and Backpacker College®'s Marketing Team. We seek system administrators from across Canada who have knowledge of their community. 

 

Backpacker College® is the new marketplace for trusted affordable accommodation in college and university communities. We make it easy for students, guests and travelers to find and book furnished rooms on every major platform available monthly (and daily, weekly). 

 

Dedicated to College and University communities, we're generating opportunities for Students, Guests and Travelers to find Trusted Affordable Accommodation, Colleges and Universities to save money and time and to tap into new revenue streams! We market furnished and curated rooms. 

 

During a global pandemic, our accommodation services are deemed essential. We are helping higher educational communities prepare for the new normal. Backpacker College has their back. 

 

As System Administrator, you will conduct online research, including on social media, to ensure room offerings are consistent with market demand. You will use our software to maintain our accommodation database and ensure customer and room booking transactions are effective and efficient. In collaboration with the System Administrator Team Leader and your regional marketing team, you will identify the best destinations and provide detailed information about room types to build accommodation offerings. Your regional team goal will be to maximize revenues. 

 

System Administrators will work up to 37.5 hours per week. 

 

After a successful 90-day period, you will have the opportunity to own stock options in the company you're helping grow.
