Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
ALT TEX is a seed stage biomaterials startup, on a mission to create the world's most sustainable fabrics through our ALTernative TEXtile innovation. Through our proprietary biotechnology, we're taking one of the world's largest landfill contributors - food waste - and re-engineering it into biodegradable and carbon neutral fabrics with polyester-like performance. 

 

The Polymer Chemist Co-op will play a central role in the ALT TEX fibre development as the research team continues to optimize the biopolymer technology for textile manufacturing. The role will report to the Research Lead and will work closely with the research team to conduct literary and lab-based R&D.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Conduct literary research on biobased polymer technology and polymerization to support ongoing lab studies
	 
 Observe and conduct lab research to iterate polymerization process and develop/interpret associated technical reports and standard operating procedures based on findingsSupport Lead Polymer Chemist in polymerization of ALT TEX's biodegradable polymer, with a specific focus on the selection of catalysts and process controls, synthesis of intermediates, and the final biopolymer
	 
 Support optimization of polyester synthesis to generate a high molecular weight polymer within the targeted MW range, with attention to apparatus set-up, environmental parameters, isomeric
	 
 Develop efficient and sustainable materials processing and manufacturing that considers life cycle analysis
	 
 Conduct compositional and purity analysis using HPLC, NMR, Gas Chromatography, Gel Permeation Chromatography, FTIR, and/or LC-MS
	 
 Complete product quality, and production yield evaluations and implement continuous improvement practices
	 
 Support day-to-day research operations including material tracking/ordering and organizing lab activity and workplans
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You're an impact and sustainability focused innovator who wants to use their talent for massively scalable change. You're a risk taker ready to immerse yourself in an incredibly fast-paced and dynamic team, in a position that offers rapid job growth opportunity. You're an innovative thinker and want to bring bold ideas to the table where you can supercharge them to fruition. 

 
 

  
	 
 
   
		 
  
    
			 
   Your background
			& experience:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Bachelor's degree (WIP) or higher in areas of Chemical Engineering, Polymer Chemistry, or related field
				 
     1+ years in lab research setting with technical acumen in organic chemistry, polymer synthesis (preferred biopolymer focus), and distillation experiments with various parameter controls at lab-bench or large scale
				 
     Technical experience in the use and method development of HPLC, NMR, Gas Chromatography, Gel Permeation Chromatography, FTIR, and/or LC-MS (preferred)
			 
    
			
		 
  
		 
  
    
			 
   Your
			skills & attributes:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Entrepreneurial: you're highly independent with the ability to self-drive fast-paced projects with extreme resourcefulness and speed
				 
     Innovative and analytical: you're a big picture, out of the box thinker who is always questioning the norm and approaches problem solving with disruptive thinking
				 
     Impact oriented: you're out to change the world and your work means more to you than a 9-5
				 
     Action oriented: you're a leader and self-starter who makes things happen without the need for significant structure or delegation
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Compensation: $17 per hour (or commensurate with experience)
	 
 Flexible work hours and location
	 
 Casual work environment 
	 
 Lots of team socials!
Job Posting Information.Targeted Degrees and Disciplines::
Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Sustainability
				
			
				- Theme - Waste, Water and Materials Management
				
			
				ENG - Chemical Engineering
				
			
				ENV - Environment, Resources and Sustainability
				
			
				SCI - Chemical Sciences

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
ALT TEX is a seed stage biomaterials startup, on a mission to create the world's most sustainable fabrics through our ALTernative TEXtile innovation. Through our proprietary biotechnology, we're taking one of the world's largest landfill contributors - food waste - and re-engineering it into biodegradable and carbon neutral fabrics with polyester-like performance. 

 

If you're interested in joining our mission, you may already know that by 2050, the fashion industry is expected to account for a quarter of the world's greenhouse gas emissions. Leading this environmental footprint with over 7 million tons of annual landfill waste is polyester - a fabric that makes up 60% of the clothes we wear. As ALT TEX continues to build its circular technology, the digital development intern will provide support to develop and execute the company's digital strategy.

 Documenting all solutions so they can be efficiently supported and maintained

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Job Description: 

3M is seeking a Tape Testing Technician Intern for its Corporate Research & Development team located in London, ON. The successful candidate will work for 4 months (May 1 - Aug 31) under the direction of one of principal investigators where you will gain experience in a challenging environment while contributing your own distinct skills and talents to the 3M Canada team.  

 

  

3M Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. 

  

We work to reflect the diversity of our global customers, suppliers and channel partners, and build on each individual employee's abilities. 

  

At 3M, we know that inclusion is the key to unlocking the power of our diversity. An inclusive culture is one that supports and appreciates differences, and provides fair and equal opportunities for everyone. It's a place where people realize they are respected for their whole and unique selves, and that they belong. Inclusion leads to engagement, which in turn fosters the collaboration, creativity and innovation that drive long-term growth - for 3M as well as for our people and our teams

·       perform physical testing of pressure sensitive adhesive (PSA) tape and backings for the wide variety of 3M tape manufactured in Canada, as well as new tape in development

·       additional formulating and sample preparation

·       Strong time and territory management skills

·       Competitive but team player in all aspects

Preferred Qualifications:

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
416 Automation Inc. is a manufacturer of automated machinery, testing equipment and custom electrical panels. We provide technical solutions to a variety of manufacturing companies in the automotive, packaging and electronic industries. We have a fully equip machine shop, certified mechanical/electrical engineers and a broad variety of skilled trades men. Our electronics department specialize in PCB design and Computer Based Automation. We manufacture portable testing stations for electronic products meeting all of our customers test requirements. 416 Automation also provides round the clock support and service for all our products and systems in the advanced manufacturing industry. For more information about 416 Automation Inc., please visit us at www.416automation.com. 

 

POSITION SUMMARY 

416 Automation Inc. is seeking an enthusiastic individual to join our engineering team. As a member of 416 Automation Inc., the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on exciting and innovative projects, helping to ensure that the products we release are of the highest quality. The self- motivated candidate must be reliable and willing to learn.

 Develop and execute test plans for system

 Research to solve hardware/software related problems

 Experience in software development (C#,C++, Visual Basic, Java)
	 
 Understanding of basic accounting concepts
	 
 Computer skills (MS Office, networking)
	 
 Basic electrical concepts
	 
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to dissect a problem and form solutions that meet real-time constraints

This job is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP) or Canada Summer Jobs. These programs require that candidates be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident or a protected person defined by the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About the role 

The Software Development Co-op will work closely with our team to improve the design and functionality of our mobile app, our process tracking system, and our website. All projects will be guided by the lean start-up model, where we test and analyze rapid product iterations. You will have a significant impact on our product and processes during a really exciting time for our company. We are looking for someone with a focus on UI/UX development, design experience is an asset. 

 

This position is for students who are looking to have an involved and meaningful co-op term. We are looking for someone who will stand by our mission and work with us towards our vision. 

 

About Friendlier 

Friendlier is building a tech-driven, reverse logistics system to eliminate single-use food packaging waste. Our mission is to make reusable packaging simple and accessible for businesses and consumers.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
We are a start-up, so you will be involved in a number of different projects and get exposed to a lot of different areas. Job responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
 

  
	 
 Assist in the development of the product roadmap
	 
 Plan and execute A/B testing for product improvements
	 
 Identify opportunities to improve UI/UX of the mobile app and web app
	 
 Modify/improve mobile app code and website
	 
 Updating KPI dashboard with tech-related metrics
	 
 Analyze app and website data and analytics to find opportunities for improvement
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Self-motivated and resourceful  

Mobile app and website development experience 

Able to learn quickly  

Data analytics including statistical analysis  

Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Excel 

Communication skills including data reporting and visualization 

Comfortable working in fast pace, minimally structured environments 

Highly intuitive and curious 

Knowledge of general business
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing:: This is a remote position, however there will be opportunities to join team events in Guelph.
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
This is a challenging opportunity that will allow you to learn a lot and have significant impact on a fast-growing start-up. You will have the chance to get involved in many areas of the business and work with a tight-knit team. 

 

We receive government funding for co-op wages, so you must be a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or refugee.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
ACCIPITER RADAR, located in the Niagara Region, is one of the area's most progressive and innovative companies.  Our innovation and expertise come from inspired people who work in an environment of creativity, integrity, and responsibility. For over 20 years, Accipiter Radar has been a leading provider of high performance radar surveillance solutions, built upon its patented Radar Intelligence Network™ (RIN) Platform Technology. For more information on our company, products and technology, check out our website: www.accipiterradar.com 

  

This is an excellent opportunity to work with our software development team, in a technically challenging and rewarding role.  You will assist the team in the various aspects of software development, data analysis and testing by collaborating with other developers, designers, and engineers as you leverage and help build new cutting-edge technologies. Our development team works on a variety of front-end and backend technologies that enable radar and other IoT-based data to be streamed, analyzed and visualized via our Surveillance-to-Intelligence™ (S2I) product suite.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including the designing, programming, testing, and documenting of various software products and supporting systems, such as:
	 
  
    
		 
   Visualization and analysis of radar and other sensor and geospatial data
		 
   Radar-driven/manual camera control for target observation and tracking
		 
   Data warehousing, processing, analysis and reporting
	 
  
	
	 
 Testing, simulating, and evaluating performance of subsystems, and the creation of software to support these activities
	 
 Assist in the support and enhancements of automated continuous integration system and other development tools
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Software development experience working in a team environment, preferably using agile software development principles, processes and tools
	 
 Eagerness to learn new technologies
	 
 Previous programming experience with one or more of the following languages, frameworks, tools:
	 
  
    
		 
   Go, Python, C#, Angular, HTML5, Typescript, Javascript, SQL, Power BI, Graph databases

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
In this role, you will work with the company's Marketing Director, Videographer/Photographer, Sales Directors and Managers to accelerate market awareness and engagement of the Anytime Fitness Coaching brand with existing and potential clients. We are in the business of Making Healthy Happen and as a Marketing Coordinator, you will work to grow the impact that Coaching can have on the lives of our region.  

  

The Marketing Coordinator generates, aggregates and edits content for Anytime Fitness Coaching, including but not limited to websites, social media accounts, and electronic newsletters. This role will focus on developing digital marketing and managing digital ads. They will also work to grow the brand by working with management on event coordination and Facebook Business campaign delivery.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Develop, coordinate and manage content AF Coaching digital platforms and websites in alignment with marketing and fundraising strategies (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn) and websites
	 
 Using these platforms, you will set up ads in Facebook Business Manager weekly, manage and report on their insights. This will include researching target markets
	 
 Posting on Google My Business, set up the Google Ad Words weekly, manage and report on their insights.  
	 
 Oversee strategic paid social campaigns to brand recognition
	 
 Create relevant and engaging social posts, ensuring all content is integrated with the overall marketing plan. This may include developing digital ad content for Instagram Stories, Facebook Business Ads, 
	 
 Pull analytics and prepare reports on a regular basis
	 
 Develop a monthly content calendar. Work with other members of the team to populate and ensure content is posted
	 
 Develop ideas for campaigns and emails to meet the objectives for revenue generation, gaining referrals etc.
	 
 Promote the consistent use of brand guidelines to management and monitor all social media regularly
	 
 Assist the Manager of Marketing Director with the maintenance of information catalogue and key messages
	 
 Assist with photography and videography shoots
	 
 Attend philanthropy events and other activities as required to assist with social media, and photography as needed

Honest, ethical, hardworking, goal-oriented person with a passion for marketing

 Self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision

 High attention to detail
	 
 Strong teamwork, communication and interpersonal skills
	 
 Excellent time management and organizational skills

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Artifact (YC S20) helps people record the important stories in their lives, told in the voices of friends and family members. Think of us as an on-demand podcast studio you can focus on anything you want. We set you up with an interviewer, and we make the process easy, from scheduling to hosting interviews over the phone and then delivering a polished edit that wouldn't sound out of place on the radio. 

 

Engineering-wise, we are building a platform that enables the recording, editing and production of hundreds of personal podcasts a month. We are dealing with a production scale way higher than any other company or podcast studio. 

 

You can read more about us on TechCrunch: 

https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/03/yc-backed-artifact-looks-to-make-podcasts-more-personal/ 

Listen to an Artifact featuring Twitch co-founders Michael Seibel and Justin Kan: https://www.heyartifact.com/creations/michael-seibel-and-justin-kan-on-the-power-of-habits/ 

 

Why you should join us:
 

  
	 
 It is a unique opportunity to experience a high-growth tech startup backed by YCombinator.
	 
 In times like these, where friends and families are split apart, you'll get to work on building a meaningful product that brings joy and a sense of connection to thousands of people.
	 
 Because we are early, your work will have a tremendous impact. For example, your efforts will help us streamline internal operations through engineering-a fascinating challenge that is key to our ability to scale.
	 
 You will effectively be our first engineering hire, working hand in hand with Artifact CTOs:
	Moncef Biaz: UC Berkeley, Lead engineer at Cruncher Technologies, Charlie Finance
	Martin Gouy: UC Berkeley, Lead data scientist at Euclid (acquired), Wework
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
During this internship, you'll be given the responsibilities of a full-time engineer. Each project will involve refining the specs with the product team, scoping, architecture design, and implementation. Our sprint cadence is one week, so expect a fast iteration pace and a lot of variety. 

Sample projects:
 

  
	 
 Designing a permissioning system architecture allowing customers to securely share their Artifact's with loved ones.
	 
 Streamlining internal operations: implement an internal file management system allowing interviewers to receive their interview recordings and deliver edited Artifacts.
	 
 Augmenting the Artifacts surface by making it not only an audio recording but allowing customers to leave comments and upload photos.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Tech Stack 

Our stack is Django & React. We expect you to come in with a working knowledge of these frameworks. Your code will be deployed to production and put in front of our customers within a week! 

 

We are looking for someone who:

 

  
	 
 Values simplicity and fast iteration. Our philosophy is to prototype a minimum viable product and get early feedback from our customers to improve it.
	 
 Is rigorous. Your code should be easily readable and maintainable, to minimize chances of shipping bugs (particularly hurtful with a consumer product).
	 
 Has a product and consumer mindset. We're not building the product for us. If users don't find it sleek and intuitive, it doesn't pass the bar.
	 
 Thrives for continuous learning and collaboration. We believe the key to building a world-class team is open and honest communication while always seeking to learn from our peers.

				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Opportunities Co-ordinator (Team Go-To-Market)
8 month Full-Time Opportunity
 The successful Opportunities Coordinator, Go-To-Market (GTM) Enablement applicant, will report to the Sr. Manager, Go-to-Market Operations, in a full-time capacity for an 8-month term. 

 

You will be gaining a unique and dynamic perspective on how our GTM team helps act as the organizational glue between our various regions and departments on a daily basis through 4 key service offerings:
 

  
	 
 Bid & Account Growth Support (formerly called Pre-Sales)
	 
 Asset Curation & Stewardship
	 
 Education & Go To Market Insight
 

Our customers are both internal and external. Internal customers are our fellow Appnovators from Sales to Corporate to Services and in between, across multiple time zones. Though we do not interact with external customers, they will often see the efforts of our work through branded assets and research we produce that is eventually presented and pitched by our internal customers.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
YOU WILL HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO
 Learn and Immerse

 

  
	 
 Gain a unique, all-encompassing perspective on how a digital consultancy works and understands the service offerings and partner ecosystem we have.
	 
 Be part of a critical, key team responsible for supporting and facilitating a range of activities, including bid support, brand and company content creation, and curation, and promoting our services to internal customers.
 

  

Respond, Set Up, and Support

 

  
	 
 Assist in the processing and setup of bid pursuit opportunities.
	 
 Work with fellow GTM team members, Sales, and opportunity bid teams to search for and retrieve existing GTM assets (images, slides from prior slide decks, case studies, etc.) and write-ups to strengthen pitch or proposal response deliverables. In some cases, there may be a need to improve or create assets from scratch to support the effort.
	 
 Collaborate with Sales and other teams (Marketing, Managed Services, Corporate) to work and improve on proposal and presentation responses
 

  

Research, Interview and Generate Insights

 

  
	 
 Research, write up and summarize short documents or presentations. Topics range from emerging technology trends to performing competitive analyses, etc. We act in the capacity of a shared service to bid teams and key stakeholders within the company, such as Strategy, Experience, and company executives.
	 
 Research and interview project team members across regions to gather valuable information to build detailed case studies for use in proposals and pitches.
	 
 At quarter-end, generate insights on sales numbers and metrics to identify trends, and areas of improvement for the Sales teams across all regions in the company.
	 
 Measure engagement in how our GTM assets are being consumed quantitatively to help us make qualitative decisions for areas of improvement.
 

   

Standardize, Operationalize and Organize

 

  
	 
 Ensure bid responses and GTM assets conform to Appnovation's corporate branding standards, formats, and messaging.
	 
 Always be thinking of ways to streamline processes to do things more efficiently, quickly.
	 
 

Most importantly, become a trusted, reliable, in-demand team member focused on making our customers' lives easier through the services and work we do.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
WHO YOU ARE

 

  
	 
 First and foremost, you have a keen interest or affinity for technology. You have an analytical, insights, data-informed nature, yet have a creative side as well.
	 
 You're goal-oriented, a "do-er" and derive a sense of pride & accomplishment tackling and completing your to-dos that need to get done through the week.
	 
 You have a customer service-oriented mindset, and ensure requests are completed to the satisfaction of the requester.
	 
 A strong interest in analyzing information, making sense of the picture from a macro and micro level. You don't just collect facts and stats as the research; you ask, "Why is that? What's missing?" to formulate insights and suggestions.
	 
 Self-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced environment.
	 
 Staying abreast of current trends in business and technology and being driven to learn more, our business focus and offerings can and will change, so our team members must keep up as well.
	 
 Have great instincts on knowing what looks good layout-wise when helping with organizing text and visual assets in a response
	 
 You are interested in the area of sales opportunity pursuit and the effort and activities behind winning business.
 

  

Background and Experience 

Currently looking to complete a co-op term as part of your undergraduate program requirements
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
What Does Appnovation Have To Offer?

 

  
	 
  Work that is challenging and rewarding
	 
 You'll be onboarded by "senior" co-ops, who were once new to this role as well and help guide you through the ins and outs of the job and company.
	 
 Rocketing growth - yours and ours. Lots of opportunities for personal and professional development.
	 
 Exciting and innovative projects to learn about. Examples of some of our latest clients include Alpro, Visit California, Pfizer, September 11 Memorial & Museum, Blue Cross Blue Shield, Hong Kong Jockey Club, AXA, and many more.
 

 Negotiable based on experience. Offer monthly salary between $3,000- $3,400 CAD

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 3414 Other Assisting Occupations in Support of Health Services (including Clinical Kinesiologist, Occupational Therapist)
Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements::
This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).  The program provides funding to hire students for the purposes of experiential learning and is administered by Employment and Social Development Canada through a partner organization, BioTalent. 

 

General eligibility requirements: Students from all co-op programs (undergraduate and graduate) are eligible. Students must be Canadian citizens, permanent residents or a person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of employment to qualify for funding from SWPP.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Foot and lower limb health & wellness is crucial to overall health and longevity.
			 
			At BioPed, we hire and train Kinesiology students to become Canadian Certified Pedorthists. BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists (C.Ped (C)'s)  are biomechanical experts, specializing in orthotics, footwear and other supportive devices to address lower limb conditions. They work in concert with family physicians and other health care providers to improve the quality of life of their patients.  As a C. Ped. (C), you would perform in-depth evaluations through observation of surface anatomy, palpation of the lower limb, gait analysis, orthopaedic testing and footwear analysis, and devise a treatment plan for your patients, which may include a device, a specialty shoe, exercise/stretching, or otherwise.
			 
			Those who become Pedorthists have the opportunity to work as a Clinician, Clinic Manager and/or own their own BioPed clinic.
			 
			To learn more about BioPed, please visit www.bioped.com
			 
			To learn more about what a Pedorthist is, please visit http://www.pedorthic.ca/
			
			Work location: Ontario, British Columbia, Nova Scotia (refer to the job posting for the specific city)
			
			Accommodations and Travel: Please be advised that you are required to arrange for your own travel to and from the clinic during your co-op semester, as well as for living accommodations.
			Recent Student Testimonials:
			"My experiences at BioPed enriched my exposure and curiosity within the field of footcare and orthotics. My peers at BioPed established a welcoming and supportive environment. From shadowing the Pedorthic team, I observed clinical procedures and made connections that enhanced the concepts taught from my undergraduate studies. My involvement within the orthotics assembly process, as well as patient assessments, facilitated my growth as a Co-op student. BioPed provided an excellent opportunity to develop the fundamental experiences of a health care provider."
			 
			-Shawn Budiatmanto, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Fall 2020
			 
			"My experience at BioPed was absolutely amazing. I was given the opportunity to learn about Pedorthics and Chiropody, two career paths I was unaware of prior to working there. I was a little nervous when starting as it was my first work term, however the staff at BioPed were very friendly and welcomed me in with open arms. I learned so much about lower limb injuries and treatments, bracing options, and even how to work with vendors and insurance companies throughout the work term. I would highly recommend working at BioPed if given the chance!"
			 
			- Makayla Fraser, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Winter 2021
			 
			"Prior to this work term, I had never been exposed to the field of Pedorthics and Chiropody and was quite unfamiliar with what these professions have to offer. Working at Bioped has now opened an entirely new perspective of healthcare which I did not consider before. Throughout my time here, I have been able to see and experience first-hand all the hard work that is put in to provide patients with nothing but the most effective solutions to address their problems and concerns. Whether it was through fabrication of orthotics, sitting in on assessments or dealing with customer retail, each day brought a new experience to learn from, which piqued my interest and kept me engaged. Overall, this work term has been a memorable experience working with such a dynamic and innovative team, who all have positively influenced my growth as a kinesiology student."
			 
			-Imaan Ahmed, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Spring 2021
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The work term may include: 

·        Learning the operations of the front retail area 

·       Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients 

·       Understanding how to clinically fit footwear 

·       Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products 

·       Booking appointments 

·       Taking payments 

·       Communicating with insurance providers 

·       Working with a Pedorthist/Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients 

·       Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment 

·       Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient 

·       Sitting in on patient biomechanical assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist 

·       Performing gait assessments 

·       Learning how to cast/measure for orthoses/braces 

·       Learning how to design a foot orthoses
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
·       Kinesiology Students (preferable) or Sciences Students 

Assets: 

Having a car is an asset, but not necessary depending on how closely you're situated to a clinic. Location details can be found on our website www.bioped.com/locations

This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).  The program provides funding to hire students for the purposes of experiential learning and is administered by Employment and Social Development Canada through a partner organization, BioTalent.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Are you looking for a great alternative to the traditional career paths of becoming a Physical Education Teacher, Physiotherapist or Athletic Therapist? Do you want to become a Health Care Provider without spending a fortune on education?  Are you looking for a career that has a virtually guaranteed job placement upon graduation? 

  

At BioPed, we hire and train Kinesiology students to become Canadian Certified Pedorthists. BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists work in concert with family physicians and other health care providers to improve the quality of life of their patients.  They perform in depth evaluations through observation of surface anatomy, palpation of the lower limb, gait analysis, orthopaedic testing and footwear analysis; as well as a review of potentially complicated health factors. 

  

Upon completion of an assessment, BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists then design, manufacture, fit and modify foot orthoses and footwear for the purposes of alleviating painful or debilitative conditions of the lower limb. 

  

Those who become Pedorthists have the opportunity to work as a Clinician, Clinic Manager and/or own their own BioPed clinic. 

  

To learn more about BioPed, please visit www.bioped.com 

  

To learn more about what a Pedorthist is, please visit http://www.pedorthic.ca/ 

 

Work location: primarily in Ontario, many in the GTA
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Depending on the work term length, the work term may include:
 

  
	 
  Learning the operations of the front retail area
	 
 Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients
	 
 Understanding how to clinically fit footwear
	 
 Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products
	 
 Booking appointments
	 
 Taking payments
	 
 Communicating with insurance providers
	 
 Working with a Pedorthic Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients
	 
 Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment
	 
 Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient
	 
 Sitting in on patient assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist
	 
 Performing gait assessments
	 
 Learning how to cast for foot orthoses
	 
 Learning how to design foot orthoses
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Kinesiology Students or Health Sciences Students

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Our Commercial team is looking for an enthusiastic student to join our team for a 4 month term! The Commercial student will be mentored and supported working alongside the Procurement and Commercial Management teams to support active procurement(s) and the ongoing management of a portfolio of commercial agreements, which are often complex and of significant monetary value. 

 

The Commercial team has developed and implemented award-winning competitive procurement processes for large-scale procurements. The procurements included the Fort McMurray West (FMW) 500 kV Transmission Project, three rounds of the Renewable Electricity Program (REP), and the procurement of ancillary services for the reliable operation of the Alberta Interconnected Electric System (AIES). 

 

Within the Commercial department, the Procurement team leads the competitive procurement process from design through to contract execution, and the Commercial Management team is responsible for managing commercial agreements from execution through the contract lifecycle.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Potential Projects: 

Here is a sneak peek into the diverse learning objectives we hope to offer the student based on their skills, interests and strengths:
 

  
	 
 With the support of the Commercial Management team, develop and implement new processes and tools to support effective compliance monitoring for ancillary service products in alignment with the contractual requirements.
	 
 Support the preparation of monthly and quarterly reporting for the Fast Frequency Response Pilot, preparing analysis, identifying key insights, and presenting findings to the Commercial Management and Procurement teams.
	 
 Support the Procurement team in the Transmission Must-Run (TMR) procurement through evaluation of completeness, preparation of a contract term sheet, and other activities as required.
	 
 Work collaboratively with the Commercial Management team to develop and implement new process documentation and governance structures to support the ongoing management of commercial agreements (REP, Ancillary Services, and FMW). Develop process documentation guidelines and best practices to support consistency and clarity in future process documentation.
	 
 Work collaboratively with the Commercial Management team to develop a folder hierarchy and document management system to support the effective ongoing management of commercial contracts.
	 
 Complete a review of contracted ancillary services and procurement approaches in other jurisdictions to support the Commercial team in the design and development of future procurements and reliability products.
 

Signs you will enjoy working in this team:

 

  
	 
 You have a desire and ability to take initiative, multi-task and work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
	 
 You enjoy working in a team of bright professionals and participating in lively discussions.
	 
 You embrace change and pivot and adapt with ease.
	 
 You like working in a diverse atmosphere - our team and colleagues have varied backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.
 

Signs you will enjoy this role:

 

  
	 
 You get satisfaction out of completing thorough research, and you have a knack for identifying relevant information and sources.
	 
 You have high personal leadership skills and find it intuitive to place attention on priorities and value-add items
	 
 You are passionate about learning new things
	 
 You enjoy balancing multiple files and projects in flight.
	 
 You thrive in a team setting.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You have:

 

  
	 
 Completed a minimum third level course work in the Bachelor of Business, Supply Chain Management or a closely related field.
	 
 Great curiosity and interest in commercial procurement and contract management.
	 
 Experience in preparing a wide variety of documents, charts, and presentations using Microsoft Office software.
	 
 Excellent research skills, including the ability to identify relevant information sources and best-practices in other jurisdictions and markets.
	 
 Interest in taking ownership of project-based work with support from the Commercial team
	 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	 
 A positive attitude and take initiative to offer creative solutions.

This opportunity is a substantial learning experience to develop an application from start to launch.

You will be working on backend cloud and database architecture as well as the application front end.
 

  
	 
 Writing and creating the code for the functional specifications for the application.
	 
 Working with other team members to understand the application functionality and user stories.
	 
 Writing unit tests for the code created if applicable.
	 
 Submitting code to a source repository for review and release to a testing environment.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Ideally, you will have experience in some of the following:
 

  
	 
 Setting up and maintaining a software development environment.
	 
 Experience working on and with a team including designers and product managers.
	 
 Database design and architecture experience.
	 
 Experience developing web services e.g., Restful APIs
	 
 Experience working with cloud services such as Amazon Web Services or Google cloud
	 
 Experience with software development frameworks and libraries such as React, Node, Vue, GO or comparable libraries. .
	 
 Experience deploying code commits

Digital Marketing and Marketing Communication 

  

JOB DESCRIPTION: 

Provide support to Corporate Marketing in the areas of research, development and maintenance of the website, social media channels and marketing automation tools. Contribute to continuous improvement through research of trends and best practices and development of new tools, training and templates for use across the business units.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Community Events Intern - National Campaigns Position Description 

This position reports into the National Managers, Community Events.  In this capacity you will be responsible for supporting logistical and administrative elements of our in-person Autism Speaks Canada Walk and Walk on Wheels Clubs across Canada.  Logistical responsibilities will include sourcing and implementing event day requirements and activities for volunteers and contractors to execute at the event ie. "Walk logistics in a box".   You may be called upon to support other community campaigns as required.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Create a fun celebratory experience for our in-person Walks and Walk on Wheels Car Parades.  Event day activities should be fun, safe (following all covid protocols for the community) and be sensory friendly.
	 
 Research and secure venues for all Walks and Walk on Wheels events taking into consider event size and cost.
	 
 Responsible for arranging event day rentals, deliveries, pick-ups with volunteers/contractors
	 
 Develop safe walking and driving routes; 3kms
	 
 Identify new and/or work with existing vendors/performers etc to minimize event day expenditures.
	 
 Understands the importance of the volunteer-staff partnership and integrates the value of philanthropy and volunteerism in dealings with staff and volunteers.
	 
 Recruit and resource event day volunteers for the Walk events and support of Walk on Wheels.
	 
 Manage timelines for each event to ensure deadlines are met.
	 
 Executes in partnership with volunteer community leaders the event day logistics component
	 
 Work closely with Community Managers to monitor campaign expense budgets
	 
 Responsible for administrative duties related to event insurance, ordering and deliveries and preparation of event day boxes and detailed event day schedules.
	 
 Flexibility as required to attend community meetings to provide logistics updates
	 
 Attend Walk events (as applicable and pending location) to support day of execution.
	 
 Other duties as assigned supporting the growth and commitment to our mission.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Position Requirements

 

  
	 
 Education: currently a university or college student
	 
 May require a valid driver's license, and access to a working vehicle
	 
 Ability to converse and write in French is an asset
	 
 Strong oral and written communications
	 
 Strong attention to detail
	 
 Proficiency with MS office; Excel, Word
	 
 Flexible to travel and work evenings and weekends on occasion
 

Core Competencies

 

  
	 
 Results driven
	 
 Stakeholder focus
	 
 Decision making
	 
 Problem solving
	 
 Taking initiative
	 
 Managing performance
	 
 Team focus
	 
 Building collaborative relationships
	 
 Flexibility
	 
 Building Trust

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
The HACCP assistant will work in a plant environment.
	 
 Part of the tasks require sitting at a desk, on a computer (50%)
	 
 Part of the tasks require being in the plant, communicating with employees, observing processes, communicating with supervisors, participating in meetings, etc. to ensure understanding and compliance to Food Safety System requirements (50%)
	 
 The HACCP assistant will need to support troubleshooting quality problems, and work with supervisors to improve areas that do not meet requirements through developing and maintaining tools, procedures, records, etc.
 

The quality program must be maintained to ensure compliance to CFIA, SQF and customer requirements. It raises the level of food quality and safety, has a positive impact on cost and reduces recall incidences.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
To ensure that the HACCP and SQF system requirements are adhered to and maintain quality program - this is accomplished through:
	 
  
    
		 
   Participate in reassessments of:  HACCP plan, SQF program, Prerequisite Programs, Manuals of Operations and onsite verifications
		 
   Assist QC Manager and SQF Practitioner with document control system related tasks
		 
   Collaborate with department leaders and operators create, Update or modify documents
		 
   To update the electronic system with the necessary information related to: Quality monitoring, Critical Sanitary maintenance, Work Orders and related KPI's
		 
    CFIA and 3rd party audits: Preparation and participation in CFIA and 3rd party audits, Follow-up on corrective actions to address deviations from CFIA and 3rd party audits, Participate and assist in the implementation of action plans to address deviations from CFIA and 3rd party audits
		 
   Document sharing platform:  Support plant users of the SharePoint platform, Work on improvements for the usage of the SharePoint platform for the plant's quality systems, Update documents to the corporate format
	 
  
	
	 
 Participate in failure investigations/ root cause analysis and compose documents regarding those failure investigations.
	 
  Support production and warehouse departments with process improvement projects and act as a resource when needed
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Currently enrolled in a post-secondary Program in Food Science, Microbiology, Biotechnology, Engineering, in a food related discipline.
	 
 Must be eligible for an internship;
	 
 Trained in HACCP principles or basic knowledge of HACCP Program ideal
	 
 Strong interpersonal, communication, leadership skills
	 
 Must be a motivated self-starter committed to excellence in product quality, high attention to details, effective communicator, ability to work within a fast-paced production environment and possess the ability to detect trends and proactively act to make immediate corrections.
	 
 Detail oriented, result driven and able to maintain records and work alone as well as part of a team.

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 3414 Other Assisting Occupations in Support of Health Services (including Clinical Kinesiologist, Occupational Therapist)
Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements::
This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).  The program provides funding to hire students for the purposes of experiential learning and is administered by Employment and Social Development Canada through a partner organization, BioTalent. 

 

General eligibility requirements: Students from all co-op programs (undergraduate and graduate) are eligible. Students must be Canadian citizens, permanent residents or a person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of employment to qualify for funding from SWPP.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Foot and lower limb health & wellness is crucial to overall health and longevity.
			 
			At BioPed, we hire and train Kinesiology students to become Canadian Certified Pedorthists. BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists (C.Ped (C)'s)  are biomechanical experts, specializing in orthotics, footwear and other supportive devices to address lower limb conditions. They work in concert with family physicians and other health care providers to improve the quality of life of their patients.  As a C. Ped. (C), you would perform in-depth evaluations through observation of surface anatomy, palpation of the lower limb, gait analysis, orthopaedic testing and footwear analysis, and devise a treatment plan for your patients, which may include a device, a specialty shoe, exercise/stretching, or otherwise.
			 
			Those who become Pedorthists have the opportunity to work as a Clinician, Clinic Manager and/or own their own BioPed clinic.
			 
			To learn more about BioPed, please visit www.bioped.com
			 
			To learn more about what a Pedorthist is, please visit http://www.pedorthic.ca/
			
			Work location: Ontario, British Columbia, Nova Scotia (refer to the job posting for the specific city)
			
			Accommodations and Travel: Please be advised that you are required to arrange for your own travel to and from the clinic during your co-op semester, as well as for living accommodations.
			Recent Student Testimonials:
			"My experiences at BioPed enriched my exposure and curiosity within the field of footcare and orthotics. My peers at BioPed established a welcoming and supportive environment. From shadowing the Pedorthic team, I observed clinical procedures and made connections that enhanced the concepts taught from my undergraduate studies. My involvement within the orthotics assembly process, as well as patient assessments, facilitated my growth as a Co-op student. BioPed provided an excellent opportunity to develop the fundamental experiences of a health care provider."
			 
			-Shawn Budiatmanto, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Fall 2020
			 
			"My experience at BioPed was absolutely amazing. I was given the opportunity to learn about Pedorthics and Chiropody, two career paths I was unaware of prior to working there. I was a little nervous when starting as it was my first work term, however the staff at BioPed were very friendly and welcomed me in with open arms. I learned so much about lower limb injuries and treatments, bracing options, and even how to work with vendors and insurance companies throughout the work term. I would highly recommend working at BioPed if given the chance!"
			 
			- Makayla Fraser, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Winter 2021
			 
			"Prior to this work term, I had never been exposed to the field of Pedorthics and Chiropody and was quite unfamiliar with what these professions have to offer. Working at Bioped has now opened an entirely new perspective of healthcare which I did not consider before. Throughout my time here, I have been able to see and experience first-hand all the hard work that is put in to provide patients with nothing but the most effective solutions to address their problems and concerns. Whether it was through fabrication of orthotics, sitting in on assessments or dealing with customer retail, each day brought a new experience to learn from, which piqued my interest and kept me engaged. Overall, this work term has been a memorable experience working with such a dynamic and innovative team, who all have positively influenced my growth as a kinesiology student."
			 
			-Imaan Ahmed, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Spring 2021
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The work term may include: 

·        Learning the operations of the front retail area 

·       Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients 

·       Understanding how to clinically fit footwear 

·       Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products 

·       Booking appointments 

·       Taking payments 

·       Communicating with insurance providers 

·       Working with a Pedorthist/Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients 

·       Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment 

·       Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient 

·       Sitting in on patient biomechanical assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist 

·       Performing gait assessments 

·       Learning how to cast/measure for orthoses/braces 

·       Learning how to design a foot orthoses
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
·       Kinesiology Students (preferable) or Sciences Students 

Assets: 

Having a car is an asset, but not necessary depending on how closely you're situated to a clinic. Location details can be found on our website www.bioped.com/locations

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Ready to make an impact? Arctic Wolf is looking for a Software Developer, Risk Platform join our pack. 

  

Arctic Wolf, the leader in security operations, is a fast-growing company in an exciting and fast-growing industry - Cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf ranks #25 on the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in 2019!  We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running.  

  

We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds and ideas to make our teams even stronger. In fact, we are considered among the 2020 Best Places to Work by bizjournals.com.   

  

At Arctic Wolf, we believe in corporate responsibility. Our offices across North America participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities, and we earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation.  

 

The Risk team is looking for a talented developer to help us revolutionize the way that network security is delivered to small and medium businesses. Our hardworking team is passionate about building a cloud-based solution that will solve the real world security problems that IT professionals face.  

 

You'll use various languages/technologies such as Golang, RabbitMQ, JavaScript, PostgresSQL, AWS Cloud Services, GitHub, and Jenkins to implement features in one of more of the following areas:
 

  
	 
 Back end, large-scale, highly available distributed software architected as microservices running in cloud environments.
	 
 Vulnerability Scanning Linux embedded devices and virtual machines.
	 
 Windows/Mac/Linux endpoint software
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  
	 
 End to end ownership of the design, development and deployment of new features in innovative cyber security products.
	 
 Follow software engineering best practices such as unit/component testing, code reviews, continuous integration using tools such as Git and Jenkins.
	 
 Build and maintain high-level knowledge of cyber security threats.
	 
 Identify new and innovative ways to handle cyber security incidents more effectively and efficiently.
	 
 Debug and troubleshoot problems in test and production environments.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
ABOUT YOU:

 

  
	 
 Ability to excel in fast-paced, small team environment
	 
 Experience with various programming languages, with a passion for writing quality code
	 
 Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
	 
 Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines
	 
 Believe in testing as a fundamental development practice
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information:: Arctic Wolf Networks values its co-ops just like full-time employees.  Salary is based on the work term number and is roughly 20% above the Canadian work term average.  There are plenty of other perks we're close to UW when our offices reopen!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
OUR COMPANY  

  

A global leader in the transportation sector, in the digital age. We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. 

  

Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 70000 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact. 

  

With the integration of Bombardier Transportation on January 29, 2021, the enlarged Group's combined proforma sales reached €14 billion for the 12-month period ended March 31, 2021. Based in France, Alstom is now present in 70 country and its head office for the Americas region is in St-Bruno, Quebec. In Canada, Alstom has more than 4,300 employees, including 1,800 in Quebec. 

  

Based in Toronto, Ontario, you will be responsible to support the Continuous Improvement & QA team of Alstom. You will support success of our Maintenance Optimization project by being an active member in all stages of the project.  This is an opportunity to learn about using data and a proven process to enhance the reliability of the transit trains while optimizing the maintenance regime.  You will also have the opportunity to participate in other continuous improvement activities and problem-solving.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
YOUR INTERNSHIP 

  

As part of your job, you will be asked to:
 

  
	 
 Solve straight forward problems, analyze possible solutions using acquired experience and judgment
	 
 Review Supplier's technical documentation
	 
 Produce the required reports
	 
 Follow-up on action items
	 
 Collaborate with the Maintenance teams to obtain samples for analysis
	 
 Prepare required Reliability, Availability, Maintainability and Safety (RAMS) analysis for and use it to complete risk assessments
	 
 Actively participate in the project
	 
 Attend and present at meetings with our customer
	 
 Participate or lead continuous improvement activities
	 
 Assist teams in root cause analysis and solution implementation
	 
 Analyze data and make recommendations
	 
 Assist/lead with change management
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
YOUR PROFILE  

  

As our ideal candidate you: 

 
 

  
	 
 Are pursuing an education in Quality, Engineering, Business Administration, Operations Management, Project Management
	 
 Thrive in a team oriented and autonomous work environment
	 
 Have a Continuous Improvement and data driven mindset
	 
 Have experience (or interest) in Reliability
	 
 Have strong communication & interpersonal skills
	 
 Project Management experience would be an asset
	 
 Have strong analytical skills with an ability to learn in a fast-paced environment.
	 
 Have strong communication & interpersonal skills
	 
 Maximo knowledge is an asset.
 

  

If you're looking for a company with a strong purpose and the ambition to play a role in climate change by leading the way to greener and smarter mobility, if you are ambitious and would like to embark on a challenging, global journey, and if you have a certain sense of entrepreneurship: 

Come and leave your mark on the world, with us!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Blackwell strives to create a lasting and positive impact on our communities, our built environment, and our industry. A career at Blackwell provides you with an opportunity to make a difference and be a part of shaping a better future. Blackwell delivers a broad range of structural engineering services regardless of project size or complexity, helping realize our clients' vision and solving problems with appropriate design solutions. Since 1987, Blackwell has worked collaboratively with architects, developers, and building owners across North America. 

 

With a total of 60 engineers, designers, and staff located in 4 offices (Toronto, Waterloo, Victoria, and Halifax), Blackwell provides an inspiring environment where our talented team is enabled to think creatively and do great work. 

 

Working in our dynamic office, you will contribute to new and ongoing projects along with your colleagues. You will gain a thorough understanding of the path a project makes through our office, from the pre-design phase through to post-construction. You will also gain experience in the field, visiting sites and collaborating with project partners. This is a hands-on position that requires attention to detail and a positive, team-oriented attitude.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Review shop drawings from contractors
	 
 Participate in field/site reviews
	 
 Perform drafting in CAD (and possibly Revit)
	 
 Analyze structural designs
	 
 Maintain files and archiving projects
	 
 Contribute to office administration
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Qualifications

 

  
	 
 Excellent practical knowledge of AutoCAD and Microsoft Office applications
	 
 Revit experience an asset
 

Required Courses          

Statics / Mechanics of Solids 1&2 / Structure and Properties of Materials / Structural Analysis 1 / 

Structural Concrete Design 1 / Structural Steel Design 1
Job Posting Information.Targeted Degrees and Disciplines::
Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Construction and Infrastructure Development 
				
			
				ENG - Architectural Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Civil, Environmental and Geological Engineering

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Startup Culture, Creative Freedom, and Lots of Learning.  If that sounds appealing, then it's the perfect opportunity for you to combine your engineering theories, creativity, and design ability to become the Engineer you are striving to be! 

 

AOMS is a fast growing, scaling start-up and we are looking for a creative and entrepreneurial Product Developer Engineer to join our Toronto office. You will work directly within the Engineering R&D team as well as collaborate with Marketing and Production team on a daily basis to help execute our product vision. 

 

AOMS is a truly welcoming space. We encourage you to come up with new ideas and take ownership of your projects that will create a real impact on growing the business. 

 

Your opportunity at a glance:

 

  
	 
 Be a part of IoT revolution using cutting edge sensor technologies
	 
 A fun, collaborative, and creative environment
	 
 An opportunity to learn and grow with the team
	 
 A startup backed by major industry players
 

About AOMS Technologies: 

Our vision is to revolutionize the Industrial IoT world with advanced sensing technologies. 

 

We believe in a world of highly connected network of devices providing insightful analytics for stakeholders, customers, and users alike. We are backed by leading industrial investors and are looking for talented individuals like you to be part of our exciting growth phase. 

 

Salary expectation:  

Average value corresponding to coop term based on published UW coop earnings.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
About you: 

You are a hands-on person with a can-do attitude who is creative and is not afraid of getting your ideas challenged. You have a solid understanding of engineering concepts and like to bridge theory and practice, from materials science to electromagnetism. You want to explore how to synergize your skills and experience in a high-tech startup environment to produce amazing results. You are always working to improve and grow, and you have a proven track record of execution. 

 

Responsibilities: 

 

  
	 
 Analyze challenges in the deployment of products and evaluate working conditions, and develop resolution plans.
	 
 Troubleshoot and resolve customer issues, triage customer issues to internal teams, and document and manage support tickets.
	 
 Collect customer feedback, document feature requests, and participate in internal product reviews.
	 
 Develop test plans and conduct test procedures.
	 
 Create sensor test and calibration report.
	 
 Draft technical instructions, engineering plans, and other systems integration related documents.
	 
 Research, evaluate, and recommend systems/equipment/technologies.
	 
 Other tasks as required.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Our ideal candidate:

 

  
	 
 Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree in Mechatronics, Systems, or Electrical Engineering.
	 
 You enjoy learning new concepts and how to best make use of what you just learned.
	 
 You are resourceful and able to proceed without much supervision.
	 
 Hands-on: able to solder electrical components, assemble components into an enclosure, hacking hardware systems using hand tools.
	 
 You have experience working with wireless sensors in the industrial IoT space.
	 
 You have working experience with customers in the industrial space.
	 
 You have a strong multidisciplinary technical background and solid communication skills. You can break down complex tasks into simple ones and explain the steps to your grandmother with ease.
	 
 Experienced with Python and Linux operating system
	 
 Knowledge in version control software - Git.
	 
 Familiar with wireless technology such as Bluetooth, Zigbee, LoRa, Sigfox, etc.
	 
 Can-do attitude, self-driven and proactive, with an entrepreneurial spirit.
	 
 Ability to prioritize workload and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
	 
 Strong verbal/written communications skills with demonstrated ability to clearly document experimental procedures and results.
	 
 Strong analytical skills, attention to detail.
	 
 Strong aptitude in mechanical and electrical systems.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
What is an Agnico Eagle Internship? 

At Agnico Eagle, we think an internship is not only a way to practice your learning, it also is an incredible opportunity to develop yourself; your unique set of skills and experience. We value your willingness to build those skills and make a meaningful contribution to our company.  We value your commitment to treat every person on our team with respect, helping us to operate safely, protect the environment and make a positive contribution to our local communities. Moreover, your internship will take place within the incomparable wild northern environment, which will certainly stimulate new apprenticeship. 

  

What Do You Value In A Career? 

At Agnico Eagle, our values never waver. We believe in trust, respect, equality, family and responsibility.  Why?  Because they express who we are and they have helped us succeed in business for over 60 years. 

  

About Meliadine and Our Nunavut Operations 

Agnico Eagle is always looking for new talented team members to join our Nunavut mining operations. Meliadine is located just northwest of Rankin Inlet, a small coastal town on the shores of Hudson Bay. Commercial production began at Meliadine in mid-May 2019 and the mine officially opened at the end of June. This mine is our largest gold deposit in terms of mineral resources and we expect to operate it for at least 14 years. The site features a power plant and processing facilities, as well as a complete camp complex.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Your Contribution:  

Reporting to the Training Coordinator, the Training Intern is part of the People Development department and collaborates with other departments of the mine. She/He will ensure that the goals and objectives are achieved, while promoting and respecting Agnico Eagle's culture, Health & Safety Code of Conduct and the environment.
 

  
	 
 Coordinate and manage project(s) related to training in a Northern mining environment.
	 
 Develop and modify training content, assist in the planning and tracking of training activities, develop and maintain effective training materials, and assist in the management of the e-learning training platform.
	 
 Participate in the creation of training practices and procedures.
Job Posting Information.Transportation and Housing::
Your Work Schedule 

 

  
	 
 Schedule: 14 days of work, followed by 14 days for transportation and rest; flights departing from all communities in the Kivalliq region, Mirabel or Val-d'Or, Quebec.
	 
 Travel, room and board provided by Agnico Eagle

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Associated Engineering (AE) is one of Canada's most comprehensive, multi-disciplined consulting engineering companies.  AE has been providing services in the water, infrastructure, structural, transportation, environmental, energy, buildings and asset management sectors since 1945. Our staff complement offers a multi-discipline team of engineers, planners, environmental scientists, landscape architects, and technologists, providing clients with the benefits of a full-service team. We provide a full range of engineering services, from planning assessments and design to construction management, start-up and commissioning. We also offer overall project management as well as asset management services. 

  

Since 2008, AE has been consistently recognized as one of Canada's Best Managed Companies by Deloitte, CIBC, and the Queen's School of Business.  In 2016, we were recognized as a Platinum Club Member for the ninth consecutive year of achieving this award.  This award recognizes Canadian companies for business performance, financial strength, growth, innovation, technical excellence, and dedication to staff. 

  

We are a Canadian company which is fully employee-owned. With over 1000 staff across Canada and our One Company One Office philosophy, we provide our clients with local focus, complemented by specialist expertise and resources across the country. Our Ontario operation, with offices located in Niagara-on-the-Lake, Kitchener and Markham, has over 120 staff from which to draw, including approximately 70 engineers and 50 technologists and technicians.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: The Kitchener office is currently searching for a student that is interested in the position of Infrastructure Engineering Assistant for a co-op work term. The candidate would assist in design and delivery of infrastructure projects, including roads, drainage and stormwater management, watermain, storm and sanitary sewers.  Duties include assisting with proposals, assessment, analysis, computer-aided design and drafting, report writing, cost estimating, preparing tenders, reviewing shop drawings, inspection and construction administration.

Candidates should have the following qualifications as a minimum:
 

  
	 
 Third year student working towards an undergraduate degree specializing in either Civil or Environmental engineering
	 
 Strong computer skills including working knowledge of Civil 3D or AutoCAD, spreadsheet design and word processing software
	 
 Familiarity with various engineering modelling software is an asset (including HEC-RAS, HEC-HMS, EPA-SWMM, PC-SWMM or InfoWater)
	 
 Experience in inspection, assessment, analysis, design, and construction of infrastructure projects
	 
 Excellent command of English language, both written and spoken
	 
 Strong organization and time-management skills
	 
 Willingness and availability to travel and access to vehicle appropriate for company business is an asset
	 
 Team player and ability to work independently

BlueMind is on a mission to help financial institutions and advisors around the globe manage and grow their businesses. Using artificial intelligence (AI), BlueMind has developed a smart digital office that features all-in-one built-in tools for compliance, transparency and client relationships. 

 

Our team is revolutionizing the way business operations work in the insurance industry with the help of AI. Knowledgeable, high-energy team members will challenge you to learn and develop new skills. We value self-starters and growth mindsets. We're looking for talented individuals who love a flexible and dynamic environment and want to make an impact through their work.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
WHO WE ARE  

 

Basis Technologies delivers software and services to automate digital media operations for more than 1,000 leading agencies and brands.  

 

Our comprehensive ad tech platform, Basis, supports the planning, reporting, and financial reconciliation of direct, programmatic, search, and social media, all in one place.  

 

We are deeply committed to building software that will change the ad tech industry for the better and are equally dedicated to building an inclusive culture of highly motivated individuals who create a positive and supportive environment together. We invest in our culture and support our employees so they can do their best work.  

 

Basis Technologies is headquartered in Chicago, with beautiful offices also in Toronto, Dallas, Denver, and New York to name a few. Our employees have the flexibility to work in one of our office locations, completely remote, or a hybrid of the two. Please note, we are hiring on a remote working basis only in the U.S. and Canada. 

 

ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM  

 

Please Note: 

We have a strong preference for candidates whohave the ability to accept a full-time position at the end of the internship. 

 

. This is a paid, full-time internship with an expectation of 40hrs./week 

. The hourly rate is $37.00/hour 

. The program will run for 12 weeks starting on 6/6 - 8/26 

 

Basis Technologies' Summer Internship Program will teach you more about our industry, company, and the departments that make it all possible. This project-based role will require you to bring your unique perspective to the team. Learning from some of the smartest people in the business, we expect you to take full advantage of the resources we have to make Basis better. In this role, you will work with a manager and mentor to guide you through the exciting summer ahead of you, digging deep into the day-to-day work of our full-time employees.     

 

GET TO KNOW THE ENGINEERING TEAM  

  

Technology is at the core of what we do. Basis Technologies' innovative Engineering team designs and develops new features and integrations for Basis, our industry-leading, comprehensive software solution. Our platform processes over 300 billion events per day and uses AI and machine learning to automate and simplify the entire digital campaign process.  

 

This team is all about data-and in order to create value from the massive amount of data we collect, engineering leverages their dynamic Data Engineering, Data Science, and Business Intelligence teams to create insights that benefit the industry as a whole. 

 

TEAMS OFFERING INTERNSHIPS:  

  

1. Software Engineering - Applications   

The Applications team designs and develops new features and integrations for Basis Platform, our industry-leading, comprehensive software solution. As an Applications intern you will work with a manager and a mentor to build out projects in our full stack web application using React, Ruby on Rails, and Java. You will participate in a collaborative software development process and work with the Product Team and business stakeholders to turn requirements into shippable deliverables. You'll also have the chance to expand your skills with lightning talks, lunch and learns, book clubs, and the occasional fun programming exercise. Previous interns have built internal diagnostic tooling that is now being used by our team consistently.  

  

2. Software Engineering-Platform  

The DSP Backend Engineering team is all about high volume and low latency. This team writes code to support the processing of almost 300 billion auctions per day. As a member of this team, you'll write code to support new application features, brainstorm ways to solve interesting business and technical problems, and help us build up better coding and testing practices. And you'll get to do it under the close mentorship of experienced engineers. Our team's tech stack includes: Java, Scala, Python, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Cassandra, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, Docker, and more.  

  

3. Software Engineering - Automation and Test  

Our standard is high quality. The Basis QA Automation team is in charge of designing frontend and backend testing frameworks, expanding continuous integration tools, and developing internal QA microservices in order to reduce manual testing efforts. The team has created over 8,000 UI, API, and Job tests, but there is still more work to be done! Our team's tech stack includes Java, Selenium, Cypress.io, Cucumber, RESTful API, Linux, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, Docker, and more.  

  

4. Data Engineering   

Data Engineering team is responsible for processing Basis data and storing it in structures suitable for various offline reporting. We define data models that scale well and serve business needs. Data team implements ETL pipelines (extract-transform-load) utilizing technologies such as Spark, Python, SQL, MySQL, Snowflake, HDFS, Hive, Kafka and many more. We deal with large volumes of data and high complexity of business rules in Basis data. You will have an opportunity to learn and improve your skills in the areas of distributed data processing and will work together with seasoned data engineers who will guide you in your tasks.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
WAYS YOU'LL CONTRIBUTE

 

  
	 
 Working directly with the Product Team and business stakeholders to turn requirements into shippable deliverables 
	 
 Collaborating with developers, designers, product managers, and testers to build great solutions to complex digital advertising problems
	 
 Participating in a collaborative software development process consisting of two-week agile sprints
	 
 Building and extending Basis culture of growth and self-improvement. We expand our skills with lightning talks, lunch and learns, book clubs, and the occasional fun programming exercise
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE

 

  
	 
 Currently working towards a degree in Computer Science or a similar field and graduating in 2022 or 2023 
	 
 Passionate about design, architecture, coding standards and testing 
	 
 Experience with an Object-Oriented language, bonus points for Ruby, Java 
	 
 Familiarity with relational databases, bonus points for PostgreSQL 
	 
 Desire to learn and grow as a software engineer 
	 
 Involvement in the development community and personal projects outside of class is a plus 
	 
 Passionate about design, architecture, coding standards and testing 
	 
 Hands on experience in teams collaborating using Git (or similar source control

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: BMROSS is a long established multi-disciplinary consulting firm providing engineering and planning services to municipalities and the private sector across south-western Ontario. We have been successful in our approach as a trusted advisor to our clients and continue to grow and expand our practice. We are looking for a planning co-op student to join our team, at our Sarnia office.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
What You Will Be Doing 

As a member of our Sarnia Group, you will be involved in assisting our public and private sector clients with planning reports that include policy review, due diligence, and development feasibility. We develop and lead projects, helping our clients to solutions that are sustainable, user friendly and appropriate to the situation. You will: 

Assist in preparing planning reports and applications in support of development proposals by private sector clients 

Assist in preparing public consultation material 

Assist in research and due diligence for land use restrictions for private sector clients 

Assist in planning and planning-related projects for public sector clients 

Assist with the preparation of proposals and grant applications and 

Other duties as assigned
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What We Want 

Student enrolled in a planning degree 

Knowledge of Microsoft Office 

Competent technical skills in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word and Excel 

Experience in the use of ArcGIS and AutoCAD is an asset 

Knowledge of planning principles, concepts, practices, and related legislation 

Strong interpersonal skills - a good communicator, consultative and respectful 

A valid driver's license and own transportation is required.

Citizenship:  Preference will be given to Canadian citizens (see definitions below) 

Definitions: 

A Canadian citizen is a person who is Canadian by birth or who has applied for Canadian citizenship through Citizenship and Immigration Canada and has received a citizenship certificate. 

 A permanent resident is someone who has been given permanent resident status by immigrating to Canada, but is not a Canadian citizen. 

 A Canadian work permit is a temporary resident visa issued by Citizenship and Immigration Canada to grant permission to foreign workers seeking to engage in employment in Canada. 

 A study permit is a document that gives you permission to study and remain in Canada on a temporary basis. 

 

Conditions of Employment:

 

  
	 
 Reliability Security Clearance 
	 
 Fully vaccinated against Covid-19 (Attestation will be required)
