Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
We are an early-stage startup looking for passionate co-ops to join us in building and scaling Ampersand. At Ampersand, we're creating tools that give customer success teams research superpowers. Details about us, the role, and interview process below. 

 

Salary: $27 - $37/hour (Depends on experience and co-op term) 

Location: Fully remote, anywhere in Canada (slight preference for EST) 

 

Why you might be excited about working with us

 

  
	 
 We're working on elevating and amplifying folks whose work is extremely important to the success of SaaS companies. If you're into enabling people to develop skills that unlock their ability to scale themselves, you'll love helping build our product.
	 
 We're small, so you'll be able to contribute efficiently and without bureaucracy. You'll quickly have responsibility over important areas of our product.
	 
 Our team has a range of high-growth startup experience (like Element AI, and Bonfire Interactive), and are excited to learn from you, too.
	 
 Our values:
	 
  
    
		 
   Love: We commit to each other's personal and professional growth by being kind, not nice
		 
   Center the impact: We think holistically, considering the entire system, including our customers and the surrounding impact
		 
   And, not or: We believe AI at its best is a team sport, so we design for human-AI augmentation rather than mindless automation
	 
  
	
	 
 We work fully remotely, and you'll set your own schedule. We don't micro-manage, and will support however you need in order to do great work.
	 
 We'll mold your role to shape a learning experience you're excited about. We care a ton about your satisfaction and job happiness, and will help prep you for whatever you're looking for in the future.
	 
 We work hard, and also highly value a meaningfully balanced life. We care about family and your own personal development, and don't expect for you to be always on.
 

Why you might not be excited about working with us 

We are small team focused on rapidly delivering customer value. This means:
 

  
	 
 We are actively establishing processes as needed,
	 
 Priorities will shift, projects will change, and
	 
 Majority of things we do will not be well-defined initially.
	 
 You will have to take on a lot of responsibility and creative control over projects. You'll be expected to bring your own experience and perspective to help us do the right things, and raise flags if you think we should do things differently.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
What we do 

Ampersand is a mighty, but friendly, text/audio/video analysis platform that lets non-technical Customer Success teams get meaningful qualitative insights from their customer conversations (starting with Zoom calls), so they can uncover mutual value (and the revenue that follows). 

We call this "research superpowers", because our approach uses Machine Teaching and Active Learning to unlock people's ability to scale themselves, and the autonomy to choose when or whether to. 

Join us on our quest to product-market fit, as we ship the very first versions of Ampersand! 

 

The role 

Joining this early means you'll have the opportunity to have a massive impact on our product, culture, and direction. This is a chance to be part of an innovative team experiencing high growth while building a product from scratch. You'll mainly be working with Anwar, our CTO, but because we are a small and co-creative team you'll collaborate with everyone. 

 

What awesome looks like
 

  
	 
 Ship code to production.
	 
 Demonstrate initiative in bringing problems to light and suggesting improvements (code, process, documentation).
	 
 You can quickly build and test (with real people!) the efficacy of new ideas for the current and future direction of the product.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Who we are looking for 

Candidates for this role should meet following criteria:
 

  
	 
 You have completed at least 3 co-op terms.
	 
 You are passionate about technology; you are always learning and keeping up with current trends.
	 
 You are proud of what you create; you strive for improvement and are self-disciplined.
	 
 Are excited for a front-row seat into a fast growing, early-stage company. The only constant is change!
 

None of the following are requirements, but do describe the kinds of co-ops we think would thrive at Ampersand right now:

 

  
	 
 You participated in various Hackathons or have relevant experience; challenges are not foreign to you!
	 
 You're not afraid to ask the right questions to have a thorough understanding of your tasks; knowing you don't know everything is highly important to succeed.
	 
 You're willing to take the initiative and work independently - grab the freedom you're offered and run with it!
	 
 You have great organizational and time management skills which you use towards finding meaningful solutions
 

Ideally, you have experience with

 

  
	 
 Python (Flask/Django) or NodeJS API frameworks
	 
 Modern front-end frameworks such as React or Vue
	 
 Designing and building scalable databases (MongoDB, Postgres and MySQL) and data pipelines
	 
 (Bonus) Architecting and implementing cloud infrastructure using AWS, GCP, Terraform, Docker, etc.
	 
 (Bonus) ML tooling/libraries such as Torch, SciKit and Pandas
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Salary: $27 - $37/hour (Depends on experience and co-op term) 

Location: Fully remote, anywhere in Canada (slight preference for EST)

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About the company 

Accedo is a leading video solutions provider going beyond apps to deliver premium experiences.  We have earned the trust of over 400+ satisfied clients by helping them to solve their biggest video challenges as video consumption evolves . For us to remain at the forefront of building video experiences, Accedo has developed Accedo One, the first cloud platform providing operators, broadcasters and brands with  the freedom to build, launch and manage, manage and launch their content business faster and smarter. With over 500+ employees, our clients can tap into our strong global presence, broad range of core services and our strategic partnerships to build and evolve their video experiences for today and tomorrow. 

 

Strong Global Presence 

Accedo offers a truly global work environment with 16 offices worldwide, including Stockholm, Toronto, London, New York, Sydney, and Hong Kong, amongst others. With 500+ employees you will join a diverse, multi-faceted team across Engineering, Experience Design, Q/A, Delivery and core support functions. 

 

This position is in the Toronto Office. 

 

Position Overview: 

As an iOS Developer, you will be working in a small team to develop native iOS applications that conform to the high quality that Accedo's clients expect. At Accedo, we value technical skill; you may also switch platforms and projects during your term.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
- Develop native applications on iOS and tvOS. 

- Work closely with Product Managers, Developers, etc. to understanding business requirements. 

- Work closely with the Creative team to ensure product quality. 

- Implement applications based on requirements, functional and technical specifications.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::

- Ability to write code in Objective-C and Swift. 

- Ability to switch platforms if necessary. 

- Strong knowledge of memory management and efficiency. 

- Ability to develop against a variety of web architectures and services (HTTP, JSON, REST, etc.). 

- Experience with version control systems. Git experience preferred. 

- Ability to learn new technologies quickly. 

- Must have excellent problem solving skills and love technical challenges. 

- Must be self-motivated and able to multi-task. 

- Must be productive and efficient. 

- Experience with Agile Development. 

 

NOTE: Applicants MUST have previous iOS working experience or personal iOS project experience.

- Flexible working hours 

- Fun, relaxed work environment 

- Games room with Foosball, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, Wii U, etc. 

- Monthly social events such as Games Nights, Pi Day, Movie Trips, etc. 

- Fully stocked fridge with free beverages and beer 

- Monthly lunch and learns 

- Close to Union Station and St Andrews Subway Station in Toronto's Entertainment District

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
The Company 

We are a crypto algorithmic fund looking for software developers to work remotely with the team; think hedge fund specialized in cryptocurrencies. The team is still very small at under 10 people. Our founding team consists of senior team members with backgrounds from Goldman Sachs, Google, Microsoft, venture capital and with experience in the crypto space since 2013. 

 

Note: We are not affiliated with Cathie Wood's Ark, which goes by a similar name. 

 

The Position 

This is an excellent learning opportunity, especially for anyone interested in working in Silicon Valley in the future. You would be getting direct mentorship from someone that has worked in the big tech companies for over a decade and working with a technology stack that closely resembles what you would find at Google. Even though the listing shows Hong Kong, you would be working with people primarily in the US.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Students will be working with other developers and be involved in building/maintaining our trading and data analysis systems. It is a fast moving space, so exact projects are hard to predict ahead of time. If this is important to you, discuss during the interview. 

The primary contact and mentor will be in California, so the candidate is expected to be working within a time zone in the Americas.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Everything can be learned on the job, the main things we expect from a candidate coming in is the ability to write code (able to translate your thoughts into code in some language), a good understanding of data structures and algorithms, and a strong ability and desire to learn. 

 

Desired (but not required) Technical Skills/Knowledge 

Java, gRPC, Git, AWS, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, Bazel, Guice, TCP/IP, SQL, Angular, Typescript 

Knowledge of or experience working with the Ethereum blockchain. 

Cryptocurrencies in general

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Description 

  

Audioworks is a collection of audio software professionals that are building innovative music technology products. With a team of audio engineers and music producers, we are creating a variety of products that will revolutionize and educate the music creation process in the cloud and will provide artists support to exploit and promote their song compositions. 

  

Right now, we have an opportunity for a Lead Full Stack Web Developer to join our fully scaled agile team to develop cutting edge products that improve the way people experience music creation. 

  

As a hands on Full Stack web developer you will have a crucial role spearheading this transformation. Working in scrum teams with scrum masters and product managers, the successful candidate will evaluate and, as necessary, transform our organization to ensure that we have the right resources, tools, and operating models in place to add even more value for our customers.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Responsibilities will include:

 

  
	 
 Driving full cycle end to end development from design through implementation.
	 
 Serving as a driving force in our organizational evolution to deliver an exceptional customer experience through superior digital interactions.
	 
 Mentor staff to align with our fully scaled Agile methodology.
	 
 Provide technical and architectural leadership to developers through code reviews, program enhancements, unit testing, bug fixing and problems solving.
	 
 Implement new features and enhancements for the next generation of Audioworks mobile and web based products.
	 
 Preside over strategy sessions and technical reviews with key stake holders and senior management teams.
	 
 Innovate and provide critical thinking and problem solving ability to drive change and develop creative technology solutions.
	 
 This role will lead teams by contributing refreshing and innovative technological solutions to the design process and product roadmap.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Desired development skills:

 

  
	 
 Proven experiencing designing and developing applications and services which can scale using proven cloud architecture patterns..
	 
 Experience integrating/developing automated and background processes in python, go, perl, bash, etc. (unless you want any backend integration with the audio processing done in node..which is fine I guess?)
	 
 Strong experience as a software development team lead with experience developing cloud-hosted, responsive, single page web applications using JavaScript, Java, HTML5, CSS3
	 
 High proficiency with client side JavaScript frameworks (preferably React/Redux), server side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and NoSQL databases (preferably MongoDB)
	 
 Able to integrate with and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST, JSON, JWT, etc).
	 
 Familiarity with event-based System of Engagement architectures
	 
 Experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, Kanban, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Test Engineers)
	 
 Demonstrates leadership and active pursuit of optimizing CI/CD process and tools, testing frameworks and practices (preferably GitHub, Jenkins/Bamboo, Mocha/Karma, etc)
	 
 Ideally familiar with Design Thinking, Behavior and Test-Driven Development
	 
 Familiarity with test-and-learn approaches using web and customer analytics data, understanding how these drive hypotheses-based development
	 
 Strong leadership, communication and collaboration skills with track record of taking solution ownership

Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements::
This job may be part of the CPA Pre-Approved Program (PPR) route (i.e., it has been pre-approved to meet CPA practical experience requirements).  Alternatively, job content may allow students to accumulate required practical experience through the Experience Verification Route (EVR) (i.e., any position that meets the initial pre-assessment requirements). Students who gain practical experience following this route are able to submit detailed experience reports for assessment by CPA.  Students can accumulate practical experience following one or both of these routes.  For more information, please visit cpaontario.ca.  All CPA Ontario students are accountable for meeting with their mentors semi-annually and are required to complete streamlined self-assessments in the Practical Experience Reporting Tool (PERT) through their 30-month of accredited practical experience. 

 

Barrick will require full vaccination as a condition of the co-op placement, meaning two weeks following your receipt of both doses of the Pfizer, Moderna or AstraZeneca vaccines or one dose of the Johnson and Johnson vaccine.

Barrick is a sector-leading gold company which owns five of the industry's Top 10 Tier One gold assets with advanced exploration and development projects all around the world. Our vision is to be the world's best gold mining company by operating in a safe, profitable and responsible manner. The company is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. Barrick shares are listed on the Toronto and New York stock exchanges. 

  

Barrick offers a wide selection of opportunities for our Co-op students. Barrick is seeking students whom have the potential to be future leaders in the organization. Individuals whom have the potential to be high achievers that demonstrate high levels of drive, intelligence, aptitude and are passionate about delivering results as well as continuous improvement

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Ready to make an impact? Arctic Wolf is looking for a Software Developer - Full Stack Co-op to join our pack. 

 

Arctic Wolf, fresh off its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry-cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf was highly ranked in the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in both 2019 (#25) and 2020 (#104)! We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running. 

 

We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and ideas to make our teams even stronger as we grow our teams globally. In fact, we were named a 2021 Top Workplace USA (Energage) as the top technology firm to work in our size category, were recognized as one of the 2020 Best Places to Work (bizjournals.com), and most recently were certified as a 2021 Great Place to Work (Great Places to Work Institute, Canada). 

 

Arctic Wolf believes in corporate responsibility, and our worldwide offices proudly participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities. We've also earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Participate in the full software development life cycle
	 
 Build well-designed, testable, efficient, secure code
	 
 Deliver solutions at the intersection of Big Data, Cloud, and Web
	 
 Collaborate with the user experience designer, product manager and other developers to understand problems, then develop and test solutions in an iterative cycle
	 
 Work with the latest technologies and broaden your skillset
	 
 Meet regularly with the team to review progress and share technical issues
	 
 Implement bug-fixes and contribute to on-going product maintenance
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
About You 

You will have experience in the following areas:
 

  
	 
 Experienced with backend development: Python or Go
	 
 Solid knowledge of TypeScript/JavaScript, React, CSS and HTML5
	 
 Working knowledge of GitHub, Jenkins, and automated test tools
	 
 Passionate about building beautiful, simple and effective user interfaces
	 
 Intelligent, hard-working, and eager to share your code early and often
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Arctic Wolf values its co-ops just like full-time employees. Salary is based on the work term number and is roughly 20% above the Canadian work term average. There are plenty of other perks like free snacks, drinks and swag - and when our offices reopen, we're close to UW! 

 

Working at Arctic Wolf  

Arctic Wolf recognizes that success comes from delighting our customers, so we work together to ensure that happens every day. We believe in diversity and inclusion, and truly value the unique qualities and unique perspectives all employees bring to the organization. And we appreciate that-by protecting people's and organizations' sensitive data and aiming to end cyber risk- we get to work in an industry that is fundamental to the greater good.  

All wolves receive compelling compensation and benefits packages, including:  

Equity for all employees  

Paid parental leave  

Training and career development programs  

If you're excited about this role, but do not meet all of the qualifications listed above, we still encourage you to apply. We review all applications and may yet consider you the right person for the role or have another open position where you're the perfect fit.  

Arctic Wolf is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.  

Arctic Wolf is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful, and inclusive environment that ensures equal access and participation for people with disabilities. Please let us know if you require any accommodations by emailing?recruiting@arcticwolf.com.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
We are looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist Co-op who will support our sales, applications, and operations leadership teams using large data sets and models to validate effectiveness of different courses of action that supports our strategic planning process.  Using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, data tools, builds and implements models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations that provide insight and validate strategic initiatives. 

With the knowledge and ability to drive business results with their data-based insight, must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will be highly motivated and have a passion for using their technical skills in discovering solutions hidden in large data sets that make an impact ensuring our growth curve extends into 2023 and beyond
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Collaborate with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to support daily performance and strategic planning process. 

Provide strategic support to multiple functional teams through conducting both qualitative and quantitative research 

Track and monitor projects; provide insight to revenue forecast and conduct variance analysis.  Support management by formulating actions to help drive team performance and objectives.  

Acquiring data and troubleshoot reports for ongoing customer projects, conduct analysis and report on insights developed through the data review and discussions with the support team.  

Supports the development of standardized metrics and reporting for the organization that keeps us informed, and fingers on the pulse of our business 

Provide performance monitoring and insights via dashboards, scorecards and ad hoc analysis.  

Coordinates with multi-disciplinary stakeholders, and functional teams to provide valuable insights based on the data analysis. 

Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.  

Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems including evaluating changes and updates to source production systems 

Visualize and present insights and models clearly and effectively to diverse audiences
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
QUALIFICATIONS: 

  

Education: 

  

Enrolled in Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college in data analytics or data science preferably third or final year co-op students. 

  

Knowledge & Behavioural Requirements: 

Strong problem solving skills

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About the role 

We are looking for a co-op developer who loves solving challenging problems and enjoys working collaboratively as part of a remote team. You will work with the best talent in the industry and will always be treated as a full-time developer. Our goal is to have you releasing code to our production environments within your first two weeks. 

This specific role is on our sensor team.  You will be a part of the team responsible for looking after the ever-growing number of sensors we have in the field.  Notable challenges include managing and monitoring the sensor population at scale, keeping the sensors performant and optimizing software to get the most out of our hardware. 

 

About Us  

Arctic Wolf, with its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry-cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf was highly ranked in the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in both 2019 (#25) and 2020 (#104)! We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running.  

We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and ideas to make our teams even stronger as we grow our teams globally. In fact, we were named a 2021 Top Workplace USA (Energage) as the top technology firm to work in our size category, were recognized as one of the 2020 Best Places to Work?(bizjournals.com), and most recently were certified as a 2021 Great Place to Work?(Great Places to Work Institute, Canada).  

Arctic Wolf believes in corporate responsibility, and our worldwide offices proudly participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities. We've also earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation.  

  

  

Working at Arctic Wolf  

Arctic Wolf recognizes that success comes from delighting our customers, so we work together to ensure that happens every day. We believe in diversity and inclusion, and truly value the unique qualities and unique perspectives all employees bring to the organization. And we appreciate that-by protecting people's and organizations' sensitive data and aiming to end cyber risk- we get to work in an industry that is fundamental to the greater good.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Your responsibilities shall include:
 

  
	 
 Write well organized, testable, understandable and high performing code.
	 
 Identify and implement ways to optimize sensor performance and improve team productivity.
	 
 Meet regularly with the team to review progress and share technical issues.
	 
 Collaborate with other team members and external stakeholders.
	 
 Write clear and concise documentation.
	 
 Implement bug-fixes and contribute to on-going product maintenance.
	 
 Improve test infrastructure resiliency and introduce new tests where appropriate.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
About you

 

  
	 
 Solid experience with Python or Go in a production environment.
	 
 Comfortable troubleshooting with Linux tools to identify system level and networking problems.
	 
 Working knowledge of GitHub and CI/CD pipelines.
	 
 Familiar with performance testing and system profiling.
	 
 Experienced with test frameworks and test automation tools such as Jenkins.
	 
 Knowledge of AWS cloud services and container technologies are beneficial.
	 
 Have passion for learning modern innovative development technologies with a growth mindset.
	 
 Have a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
 

  

Previous security experience is preferred but not required. We provide all the cybersecurity training you need during onboarding and on-the-job training.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About ApplyBoard 

ApplyBoard is an online platform that empowers students around the world to access the best education. Founded in 2015, ApplyBoard has grown to become the world's largest online platform for international student recruitment, assisting more than 100,000 students with their educational journey.  

  

By connecting international students, recruitment partners, and educational institutions, we simplify the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process through our platform and services. To date, we have built partnerships with 1,200+ educational institutions in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom, and 4,000+ recruitment partners around the world. In 2019, ApplyBoard was named the fastest-growing technology company in Canada by Deloitte, ranking #1 on the Technology Fast 50™ list.  

In May 2020, the company announced it successfully raised C$100M Series C funding on a C$2B valuation, reaching a 'Unicorn' valuation, allowing us to invest heavily in our technology, growing our team, and serving more customers. 

  

Our Team 

Our team of over 1000+ ApplyBoardians (and growing!) is just as diverse as the customers we support. Comprising 27 nationalities, 53 languages spoken, and 50/50 gender parity, diversity is fostered and celebrated on our team. The ApplyBoard headquarters is located in Kitchener, ON Canada, with representatives in 20 countries including India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, Vietnam, the Philippines, the United Kingdom, Mexico, Brazil, and China. 

  

Life at ApplyBoard https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6PkwawTJm0&feature=emb_logo

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Commercial Management and Project Controls Internship / Co-op ( Available Spring 2022) 

  

Start Here, Go Anywhere! Are you looking for an opportunity to shape a better world? 

  

At Arup, our innovative spirit compels us to express our ingenuity in unique ways developing many of the world's most innovative and sustainable buildings, transport and civil engineering projects. Arup is a global engineering and consulting firm of 14,000 creative minds. Our integrated approach to engineering and design brings together the best professionals to meet our client's needs. 

 

Founded in 1946, we are the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects in the built environment, including the Sydney Opera House, the London Eye, and the Beijing National Stadium (aka the Bird's Nest). 

 

During your internship at Arup, you'll have the chance to work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. 

 

Notable Projects:  

 

Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects across our industry. We offer a broad range of professional services to clients around the world that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work.   

  

Calgary Cancer Center 

University of British Colombia  

National Music Centre of Canada  

Tim Horton's Field   

New Champlain Bridge 

Queen's Way West Revitalization  

Toronto Pearson International Airport

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
As a Project Controls & Commercial Management Intern, you will learn and apply the following:

 

  
	 
 Commercial management & Project Controls techniques, methodologies, procedures, and tools utilized to meet project objectives.
	 
 Monitoring, analyzing & controlling projects by integrating project finance, design management, change management, risk management, contracts management and other project management aspects.
	 
 Multidisciplinary budgeting and controls.
	 
 Cost, fee and cash flow management of projects
	 
 Establish WBS and manage schedule using Primavera 6
	 
 Resource planning & management
	 
 Earned Value Management application on projects for performance measurement & forecasting.
	 
 Change & Claims management
	 
 Contracts Management
	 
 Multi scenario analysis and reporting using Power BI dash boards.
 

You will become familiar with the:

 

  
	 
 Internal and external multidisciplinary coordination required for the successful delivery of projects
	 
 Dependencies between scope, time, and cost in managing projects
	 
 Interdependence between skills in delivering sustainable outcomes 
	 
 Many phases of the planning, design and construction process 
	 
 Meaningful analysis from project's performance trends, variance reports and forecast data.
	 
 Regulatory environment for gaining approval at different stages of project delivery 
	 
 Wide range of disciplines and skills with Arup 
	 
 Needs and concerns of various stakeholders (internal and external) 
	 
 Big-picture awareness that permeates every skill area in Arup 
	 
 Format, style, and quality of our reports.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Required: 

 

  
	 
 Working towards a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration (Finance, /Accounting), Business Economics, Business Commerce or Project Management.
	 
 3.0 GPA or higher 
	 
 Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require a visa sponsorship
	 
 Sound analytical approach. 
	 
 Good working knowledge of MS Excel.
	 
 Professional demeanor 
	 
 Good communication skills essential for team-based working 
	 
 Excellent planning and organization skills required for our fast-paced environment 
	 
 Must be highly motivated, proactive and willing to take on new challenges 
	 
 Able to work independently or as part of a large team 
	 
 Interest in cost and schedule analysis.
 

 Preferred: 

 

  
	 
 3rd or 4th year student working towards above mentioned Bachelor's Degree.
	 
 Working Knowledge of MS Project/ Primavera 6
	 
 Working knowledge of Power BI.
	 
 Advance working knowledge of MS Excel (use of macros preferable)
	 
 Basic knowledge of Business Finance
	 
 Evidence of past internship or extracurricular activity in the field 
	 
 Proven ability to perform in a deadline driven environment 
	 
 Past history of technical presentations and technical writing 
	 
 Evidence of personal investment in academic or extracurricular field

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Bridge and Civil Structures Internship/Co-op-Available Spring 2022 (May-Aug. 2022) 

 

Start Here, Go Anywhere!   

 

Want to work for a company that invests in innovation and people who catalyze impact in the built environment? Arup is proud to be recognized by Fast Company in their third annual Best Workplaces for Innovators list, which honors businesses and organizations that demonstrate a deep commitment to encouraging innovation at all levels. 

 

We find solutions for some of the world's most complex problems. From climate action to social value, we consider the broadest impacts of our work. We strive to build a more sustainable, resilient, and equitable future. This purpose shapes our culture and has made us leaders in sustainable development. You'd be joining our multi-disciplinary design teams focusing on technical excellence and innovative solutions that create a better future for people, places, and the planet. 

 

During your career at Arup, you'll have the chance to engage in a fulfilling career and work with some of the most highly respected engineers and specialists in the world. You'll also get the opportunity to work on exciting and significant projects, delivering quality work that has a positive and lasting influence on the community and the environment. The Bridges and Civil Structures team designs structures which enhance the built environment around the world.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
As a member of the engineering team at Aterlo Networks you will be part of a team that is changing how local and regional ISPs monitor and manage their networks. Our platform includes a real time, network inline component, offline metric gathering and cloud based big data architecture that processes billions of metrics per day. Few companies can expose you to both sides of that equation! 

 

You will influence, design and implement features that delight our customers but even more importantly, solve real problems and add value.   You will work in a team of networking experts to build innovative network products that enable local and regional ISPs to thrive.  Learn how the Internet works at its lowest levels, and use cutting-edge technologies to build products that measure and improve the quality of experience of Internet users. 

 

In this role you will design, implement and deliver Preseem features using Go and Python, using technologies such as Kubernetes, BigQuery, Prometheus, gRPC, GraphQL, React, CI/CD tools, Linux and eBPF. 

 

Our main office is in the Accelerator Center, just north of the UW campus.  This is a remote job, but if you're local you are welcome to work at the office.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Design, implement and deliver product features that add value and delight customers.
	 
 Learn about ISP networking technology, the Preseem product and participate in design and code reviews.
	 
 Build with focus on operations, performance and maintainability.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
We are looking for:
 

  
	 
 Passion and interest in software development. People who love what they do excel.
	 
 A focus on delivering value to our customers.
	 
 Team player with a desire to jump in and get things done.
	 
 Willingness to learn, experiment and try new things.
	 
 Strong communicator, both written and verbal.
	 
 Self-motivated and able to work independently.
	 
 Positive attitude.
 

Technical skills:

 

  
	 
 Experience with a scripting language such as Python
	 
 Experience with Go
	 
 Familiarity with Linux
 

Bonus Points

 

  
	 
 Experience with Javascript
	 
 Expertise with networking technology such as TCP/IP and socket programming
	 
 Experience with Git
	 
 Experience with Google Cloud
	 
 Experience with React
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Why Should You Consider Joining Aterlo?
 

  
	 
 We have a growing team and market presence but are still small enough for you to have a huge impact on the company and our customers.
	 
 You want to work at a company focused on solving real problems for customers. Our product helps local and regional ISPs deliver a great experience to their customers. We want to make every local & regional provider able to crush their 'giant ISP' competition.
	 
 You want to work with a no drama, respectful, high performance team.
	 
 You want to grow and learn. You will be exposed daily to ISP networking concepts and you will work on a modern, microservices-based software stack.
	 
 You are a high performer that thrives in an environment that trusts you to self prioritize and make good decisions.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Advances in cloud computing, connectivity, embedded hardware and security are culminating in the biggest disruption in transportation since the advent of the automobile. The founders of Xtreme Labs saw an opportunity in the space and started Autonomic as their next venture. 

 

We are looking for a coop student to join the team as we accelerate this transformation. At Autonomic you will have the opportunity to join a team of passionate technologists with broad experience in cloud and distributed systems, mobile, UX, and machine learning as we set out to provide current and next-gen transportation companies alike with the services they need to transform the industry. As a software engineer within our team you will be pair programming and writing production-level code within your first week. You will also take your knowledge of Engineering and Computer Science fundamentals to deploy your Spring microservices to Kubernetes on AWS. 

 

https://autonomic.ai/ 

 

In your application please specify which teams that you are interested in. 

 

Within the Toronto Office we have the following software development teams. 

 

Inventory Management Team (IMT): Focused on building services and APIs to facilitate our customers - large vehicle manufacturers - to enroll and manage their vehicles and connectivity devices on the Transportation Mobility Cloud. We strive to offer a well defined and easy to use API, and build highly available services that can support the scale of large OEMs. Our APIs are available in gRPC and REST, and our microservices are built using Java 11/Spring Boot 2, and communicate with each other by leveraging Kafka and GRPC. 

 

Command & Telemetry Team (CHAT): Focused on building APIs to facilitate customer interactions with Autonomic's platform. Some examples of functionality we expose are the ability to retrieve vehicle telemetry, to issue vehicle commands (start engine, lock, etc), and to administer groups of vehicles. We strive to offer well defined and easy to use APIs, and build highly available services that can support the scale of our customers. We currently offer APIs through REST and Websockets, and our microservices are built using Java 11/Spring Boot 2, and communicate with upstream services via REST, GRPC, and Kafka. 

 

Recent Press: 

* https://www.businessinsider.com/how-ford-benefits-from-autonomic-transportation-cloud-2018-5 

* https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2018/05/07/ford-start-teams-develop-new-business-ventures/34639707/ 

* https://media.ford.com/content/fordmedia/fna/us/en/news/2019/04/23/ford-motor-company-autonomic-amazon-web-services-collaboration.html
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
- Pair programming with our software developers on a daily basis 

- Writing Python code to build tools and services to improve the engineering process across the company 

- Writing Java Spring Boot code to build scalable client APIs or interact with hundreds of millions of messages from live vehicle data via Kafka streams per day 

- Devising algorithms on how best to aggregate non-chronological data received via Kafka Streams 

- Ownership of the quality of the code that you produce 

- Working using Extreme Programming (XP) fundamentals
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Required: 

- Experience with Java, Spring, Python or Go 

- Object-oriented programming 

- Strong communication skills within a pair programming environment Nice to haves: 

- Experience working with Kubernetes on AWS 

- Experience with developing backend micro-services 

- Kafka streams 

- Test driven development 

- Experience with XP 

- Pivotal Tracker 

- IntelliJ IDEA

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About BitGo 

 

BitGo offers insitituional digital asset custody, trading, and finance. BitGo enables our clients to navigate the complex landscape of digital assets with a connected, compliant, and secure suite of solutions. 

 

At BitGo, we believe digital assets will drive the global financial system. Our clients choose BitGo because they need services and solutions they can trust. BitGo's solution is built on top of the strongest technological foundation in the industry, allowing BitGo to provide clients with an integrated solution for digital assets that mitigates risk and optimizes capital efficiency. 

 

BitGo's products appeal to all types of clients. From high-net-worth investors to leveraged traders to institutional clients, our clients require the highest levels of security, technology, and compliance. As a regulated, qualified custodian, BitGo is able to provide the true peace of mind that fiduciaries require to work with digital assets. We deliver standards, such as CryptoCurrency Security Standard (CCSS) and SOC2, while also working with the most trusted brands in the industry and offering clients the most comprehensive insurance available in the market today. 

 

www.bitgo.com 

 

About the role 

 

As an member of our engineering team, you will play an important role in building out significant parts of BitGo's infrastructure, applications and experiences. 

 

About our stack 

 

* Frontend - Typescript, ReactJS, React Native, Apollo, Redux, D3, SCSS, Immutable.js, Webpack 

* Backend - Go, GraphQL, PostgreSQL 

* Dev Ops - Kubernetes, Docker, AWS
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Responsibilities 

 

* Lead features, even entire product lines, from inception to launch 

* Work across the entire stack using cutting edge frameworks and tools, own execution 

* Collaborate across sales, design, and engineering to rapidly iterate on product 

 

We are hiring across product engineering, blockchain engineering, and infrastructure / devops. During the interview process, we will ask you to specify one or more preferred areas.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Requirements 

 

* Pursuing a bachelor's degree in computer science or related field 

* Fluency in Javascript 

* Comfortable working full-stack 

* Solid engineering fundamentals and passion for high quality code 

* Product intuition, user empathy, ability to make sound UX decisions 

* Strong work ethic 

* Interest in crypto and blockchain

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Proactive member of the SuperTrak Finance team, contributing to all aspects of the public company corporate finance role. This position provides analytical, and financial reporting support to the APG Finance team.  The team member must be committed to exceeding management expectations while seeking continuous improvements.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Assisting the Senior Financial Analyst in monthly preparation of financial statements and reporting to segment and SuperTrak teams.
	 
 Help ensure that all financial information flows through the accounting system in a timely and accurate manner.
	 
 Perform month end close procedures including preparation of journal entries and reconciliation of general ledger accounts.
	 
 Perform and support invoice cycle (preparation of invoices, distribution to customers, AR collections and tracking of past due accounts).
	 
 Preparation of weekly cashflow analysis and reporting communicated to Corporate Treasury.  This includes cashflow projections as well as past AR analysis and follow ups.
	 
 Preparation of ad hoc and routine analysis and reporting of transactions for the SuperTrak Finance team.
	 
 Assist the Senior Finance Analyst with special projects as required.
	 
 Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
	 
 Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.
 

  

Health and Safety 

  

Non-Management:  All employees have the responsibility to work in a safe manner and report any health, safety or environmental concern to their manager or supervisor in a timely manner. 

  

Employee responsibilities for Health, Safety and Environment include:
 

  
	 
 Work in compliance with divisional health, safety and environmental procedures
	 
 Refrain from removing or altering safety devices or guarding unless hazardous energies are controlled through lockout-tag out methods
	 
 Report any unsafe conditions or unsafe acts
	 
 Report defect in any equipment or protective device
	 
 Ensure that the required protective equipment is used for the assigned tasks
	 
 Attend all required health, safety and environmental training
	 
 Report any accidents/incidents to supervisor
	 
 Assist in investigating accidents/incidents
	 
 Refrain from engaging in any prank, contest, feat of strength, unnecessary running or rough and boisterous conduct
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Education: 

  

In the process of completing a post-secondary diploma in business, accounting, finance or equivalent.  

  

EXPERIENCE & SKILLS: 

 
 

  
	 
 Attention to detail: ability to break down general ledger account balances into more detail for senior management.
	 
 Problem solving and analysis:  understand the root-cause and define the scope of the problem, identifying strengths and weaknesses of alternatives and select/recommend appropriate solutions.
	 
 Prioritizing:  demonstrated excellent organizational skills and ability to work in a fast paced environment.
	 
 Communication: prepare and clearly present/explain information so it can be understood by others, ability to transfer knowledge clearly and effectively.
	 
 Computer skills:  MS Office Suite, JD Edwards and experience with other accounting and/or ERP software programs.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
BMO Capital Markets 

BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,500 professionals in 32 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America. 

 

BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$778 billion total assets and approximately 43,500 employees as of July 31, 2021. 

 

Team Overview: 

The Business & Client Analytics team is responsible for generating client information for LOBs across BMO Capital Markets to track core clients and grow share of wallet.
 

  
	 
 Develop and integrate internal and external sources of client information
	 
 Provide insight and analysis that can be effectively and efficiently mined to support business decision-making
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Client Services and Reporting - Weighting: 50%

 

  
	 
 Develop and implement new reporting for Investment and Corporate Banking and Global Markets
	 
 Utilize technical skills to efficiently and effectively extract and manipulate data from client databases or other source systems to meet various reporting needs (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reports)
	 
 Manage client expectations, and meet agreed upon deadlines; produce work that is timely and accurate.  Strive to provide great customer service and anticipate follow-up inquiries
	 
 Question the integrity of data; delve into data issues raised and work with team members to fix at the source considering the implication on any other data that would be similarly impacted
	 
 Participate in and contribute to project and team meetings, interacting and collaborating with team members and other departments, as appropriate, in order to understand project requirements
 

Analytical Insights and Observations - Weighting: 30%

 

  
	 
 Learn and implement advanced analytics to help resolve priority business problems
	 
 Utilize knowledge of CM's businesses, products, and risk measures to provide insight and analysis in support of LOB performance and strategic objectives
	 
 Perform detailed financial and business analysis as necessary to support Capital Markets
 

Process Efficiencies - Weighting: 20%

 

  
	 
 Leverage existing reports and business metrics reported where possible to minimize unnecessary work
	 
 Assess current practice of generating reports and introduce process efficiencies / automation in database and reporting

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
BioRender is a Toronto-based high growth and profitable startup backed by Y Combinator.  

 

At BioRender, our mission is to empower the world to learn and communicate science faster through visuals. BioRender software reduces the time it takes to visually communicate research from hours to minutes, while also making that communication more effective.  

 

We aim to save scientists over 1 billion hours of wasted time per year so they can spend it performing life-changing medical research, teaching the scientists of tomorrow, and helping people understand the world around them. 

 

To support the mission, we have ~20 engineers across 4 teams tackling a variety of challenges. We're remote-first and have team members across Canada. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere.  We're hiring coops for all 4 of our teams: 
 

  
	 
 The Editor team creates web-based interactive tools for communicating science  ( think rendering, caching,  drawing and editing tools ).
	 
 The App Experiences team enables teams of scientists to organize their content, collaborate, and manage their accounts ( think tools like commenting, sharing and organizing content, identity and access management ).
	 
 The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration, and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
	 
 The Growth team aims to key drive user, product and business growth metrics through rapid experimentation and data-driven decision making. 
 

This posting is for the Editor team. We're looking for an engineer interested in web-based graphics: animation, interactive tools for manipulating shapes, and rendering! 

 

We primarily do front-end development in Typescript and React using web-based graphics (SVG and Canvas based), with occasional backend work (Node.js, MongoDB and AWS).
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Our ideal fit:

 

  
	 
 Excellent technical communication skills, the ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
	 
 Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
	 
 Creative problem solver
	 
 A passion for graphics! 
 

What you'll be doing:

 

  
	 
 Identify and build new user-facing tools and features.  Some projects on our roadmap include: animation; specialized drawing tools for scientific use cases; curve manipulation and editing;  painting tools;  text rendering; exporting graphics to different formats (SVG, PPT, TIFF etc)
	 
 You'll be responsible for the same end-to-end development expected of a full-time developer: code design, architecture (in collaboration with team members), implementation, testing, QA and deployment. 
	 
 You'll do peer code reviews, participate in (and help improve!) our scrum process, and proactively address product issues.
	 
 You'll be paired with a full-time developer for onboarding, mentorship and project coordination.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What you bring to the table:

 

  
	 
 You have some professional development experience and are interested in front-end development with React and TypeScript (bonus if you are already comfortable with these technologies!)
	 
 Nice to have: Some experience (or some challenging side projects) that involve computer graphics, web-based graphics libraries, game development, or animation.
	 
 Must be eligible to work in Canada

				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

This posting is for the Growth team.  We're looking for someone interested in developing complex and high throughput data systems, platforms and pipelines. We ingest millions of telemetry and usage events into Amazon Redshift.  From there we use SQL, Python and a variety of tools to analyze, visualize, and build models using that data.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Our ideal fit:

 

  
	 
 Excellent technical communication skills, able to explain complex solutions clearly to others
	 
 Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
	 
 Creative problem solver
	 
 Passionate about data and the insights you can extract from it!
 

What you'll be doing:

 

  
	 
 Creating efficient ETL pipelines to ingest and move data across various AWS services
	 
 Improving accessibility and visibility of user and business data by creating integrations with services used by our customer-facing teams 
	 
 Implementing observability and alerting across all of data service  
	 
 Write SQL queries and creating data tables and models to fuel our business intelligence platform 
	 
 Instrumenting code to measure product interactions and analyzing these interactions to extract actionable insight for business growth
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What you bring to the table:

 

  
	 
 You're comfortable writing Python, SQL, and JavaScript
	 
 Have experience with common data libraries like numpy, pandas, matplotlib
	 
 You have some academic or professional experience working with large amounts of data, data analysis, analytics
	 
 Nice to have: experience with MERN stack, Amazon RedShift, Metabase or similar tools

BMO Capital Markets 

BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,600 professionals in 33 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America.

Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Role Description: 

The Sales Analyst role is the sales support role within the Treasury and Payment Solutions organization, accountable to provide support to Sales Professionals in ultimate support of the end client. The role is accountable for delivering effective sales support to the sales teams by acting as the day-to-day sales contact for the client for sales related questions and by providing support for pre-sales sales activities such as presentations, bids/proposals, and requests for information. This role is accountable for providing the coordination of cash management product implementation, financial transaction set-up and providing exceptional customer service to Treasury and Payments Solutions clients.
 

  
	 
 Providing exceptional customer service to Treasury and Payments Solutions clients. Provide assistance to the Treasury and Payments Solutions team in sales prep such as: client research, account schematics, deck drafts and prospect/client files in planning client/prospect meetings
	 
 Compile pre-call and post call information packages to validate client holdings, pricing, and volumes, ensuring the Treasury and Payment Solutions team has the information necessary to be knowledgeable about the clients/prospects business and needs.
	 
 Reviews existing client base and suggests new bank solutions and enhancements as appropriate
	 
 Acts as the day-to-day sales contact for the client for sales related questions such as product information, pricing, implementation time frames and requirements.
	 
 Assist with sales and service administration and processing ensuring client experience is seamless and opportunities are identified and met.
	 
 Maintain up-to-date client information to ensure client history is accurate and complete
	 
 Responsible for tracking each implementation request to keep the process on track to the timeline committed to the client. Ensures once the implementation is completed, the client is billed accurately, including tracking internal reports.

 The App Experiences team enables teams of scientists to organize their content, collaborate, and manage their accounts ( think tools like commenting, sharing and organizing content, identity and access management ).
	 
 The DevOps/Infrastructure team builds out low-latency services for real-time collaboration and ensures our AWS infrastructure scales with our user base.
	 
 The Growth team aims to key drive user, product and business growth metrics through rapid experimentation and data-driven decision making. 
 

This posting is for our Growth team. We're looking for a full-stack engineer interested in driving user and revenue growth through rapid experimentation and data-driven decision making.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Our ideal fit:

 

  
	 
 Excellent technical communication skills
	 
 Ability to explain complex solutions clearly to others
	 
 Growth mindset, excited to learn new libraries / technologies
	 
 Creative problem solver
 

What you'll be doing:

 

  
	 
 You'll develop, run and analyze experiments to test data-driven hypotheses, working towards improving user engagement and business metrics.
	 
 You'll get to work with a wide range of tools and technologies such, product analytics tools, feature flagging services, and digital experience intelligence services to discover, learn, and influence user funnels, behaviour and patterns.
	 
 You will get to instrument code to fire analytics event for product interactions and analyze these events to inform experimentation priorities. 
	 
 You'll be responsible for the same end-to-end development expected of a full-time developer:  code design, architecture (in collaboration with team members), implementation, testing, QA and deployment.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
What you bring to the table:

 

  
	 
 You have professional experience in any part of our stack ( Node.js/express, React, or MongoDB) or extensive web development background and challenging side projects
	 
 Must be eligible to work in Canada
	 
 Bonus: you have some full-stack experience using the MERN stack!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
We are looking for talent students who have sharp analytical and programming skills to join our world class software development team. If you are interested in learning how modern large scale enterprise applications are developed using a wide variety of leading edge proprietary and open source technologies, this is the right opportunity for you. Depending on your skill and experience levels, we will find a match for you in one of the following areas: frontend, LAMP backend, Java and microservices backend, and cloud/devops automation. 

 

AlertDriving, the global leader in driver risk management, has trained millions of professional drivers around the world in over 70 countries and 120 languages. Through FleetDefense, the industry's only behaviour-based risk monitoring solution, Fortune 1000 companies as well as some of the world's largest fleet service providers have cut costs, collisions, injuries and liability exposure - by up to 90% - in more places than any other solution of its kind. And, more importantly, it saves lives and make the world a safer place for both drivers and pedestrians.  

 

Working at AlertDriving - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C3lQPjj1B8s
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Software Engineering- Job Responsibilities 

  

You will join a world class software development team to participate in the development of our next generation Fleet Defense application. You will participate in daily sprint meetings using agile development methodologies to produce quality code that will be tested and deployed in a continuous integration fashion under a DevOps framework working in conjunction with the IT Operations teams. Your job responsibilities may include any of the following: 

 

- Develop new features and maintain existing ones on PHP based Moodle LMS E-Learning platform 

- Java and Python based development for ETL and other such automation tasks. 

- Develop new single page applications and maintain existing applications involving various JavaScript toolkits and frameworks. 

- Write client-side code and come up with prototypes quickly. 

- Proactively anticipate roadblocks to accommodate product delivery schedules and collaborate with team members and managers for workarounds. 

- Contribute to best practices, coding standards and code reviews in areas relating to web accessibility standards, code reuse, security issues, browser compatibility, performance, and scalability concerns for enterprise class web applications.
 

  
	 
 WASP Secure Coding Practices
	 
 Clean Coding principles
	 
 SOLID principles of object-oriented programming
	 
 Test Driven Development (TDD). Unit testing and Integration testing.
 

- Document and present design, architecture, and technical approaches to aid in code maintenance and code reuse 

- From Requirements to Deployment
 

  
	 
 Requirements Gathering, Documentation, Analysis and Review
	 
 Implementation and DEMO to BA team
	 
 Present testing and deployment procedures to QA team
 

- Research & Development tasks where any programming language and any technology might be explored and tested.

 Familiarity in developing in both Windows and Linux environments
	 
 Experience in Java and Spring framework
	 
 Experience in Cloud Foundry
	 
 Experience in developing web applications using AJAX and various JavaScript toolkits (e.g. jQuery) or  frameworks (e.g. AngularJS)
	 
 Strong working knowledge in cross platform/browser compatibility (IE, Firefox, Safari, Chrome, etc.) for dynamic web applications
	 
 Experience in data handling using AJAX, JSON, and REST API
	 
 Deep experience and understanding of HTML5, CSS3, XML, and XSL/XSLT
	 
 Experienced with JavaScript MVC frameworks (e.g. Backbone.js, Ember.js)
	 
 Experience and understanding of user experience, W3C standards, SEO, WCAG 2.0 accessibility standards, and Windows and MacOS interface standards
	 
 Experience in developing mobile apps or mobile web-based applications for Apple iOS, Android and Blackberry platforms
	 
 Experience with code versioning and repository system (e.g. SVN, GIT)
	 
 Familiar with build tools such as Grunt or Maven
	 
 Excellent understanding of object-oriented design principles, design patterns and Service-Oriented Architecture
	 
 The ability to work with unit testing frameworks and a continuous integration environment
	 
 Experience practicing agile development methodologies
	 
 Highly effective time management, communication and organizational skills
	 
 Kendo UI an asset

Lastly, the balance between independent work versus guidance was essentially perfect.  I couldn't not have asked for a better work-term. It has honestly been the best work-term I have completed."

I was always assigned interesting and challenging projects.  I improved a lot as a developer and I learned a lot about the software development process.  I also had the opportunity to work with many passionate and friendly people. Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Adentro is turning real-world data into the marketing fuel businesses need. Now more than ever, brick-and-mortar businesses are looking for solutions that will drive their growth in a post-pandemic world. Through our North American network of over 7000 sensor locations, Adentro collects a billion points of data per-day, 24/7/365. That data is at the core of our real-time analytics and warehousing system, where we generate the information that drives online marketing programs through platforms including Facebook and Instagram. If you are interested in mobile devices and advanced Wi-Fi technologies, high performance data analytics and warehousing, dashboard presentation and reporting, or Amazon Web Services and data security, we have a spot for you on our team.Adentro is a San Francisco-based company backed by the biggest names in Silicon Valley. Our technical teams are located throughout southwestern Ontario with a home office in Waterloo. We offer a flexible work environment and a team that has years of involvement with the University of Waterloo co-op program.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
-  You'll work to secure and improve our cloud infrastructure, implementing security changes for both application level and the network infrastructure level.  This is a "full security stack" experience. 

-  You'll work to develop web applications to provide visibility into the status of our cloud offerings. 

-  You'll be directly involved with production changes in our core product offerings, helping us build out security functionality on our web applications being accessed by millions of end users.  No made-up projects here! 

-  Operate at all levels of the stack - starting from the front end code our customers see all the way down to the REST endpoints, backend business logic and infrastructure that make the magic happen, with a special focus on encryption and public key infrastructure. 

-  Navigate in a fast-paced agile environment with one week sprints. 

  

Technologies you'll use 

Join us and learn how to build web applications and web services (Python and Go), user interfaces (JavaScript/React/Redux), database interfaces (Snowflake, Postgres) and deployment technologies (AWS, Docker, Terraform).
Job Posting Information.Required Skills:: We're looking for smart people who get stuff done. It means you can work independently, but you know when to get help from your mentor. It means you aren't afraid of unsolved problems, large code bases, and a complex web of microservices, because you'll be working the same way we do everyday.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Agricorp is looking for a Co-op student to join our Program Development Division in support of our Program Analysis.This position can work remotely. 

 

Agricorp's Program Development Division interprets and synthesizes agricultural and business knowledge to ensure Agricorp delivers effective and sustainable risk management programs for Ontario producers. 

 

The Program Analysis Department is responsible for processes related to analytical reporting, premium rate-setting, forecasting program payments, and legislative reporting. The Analyst provides basic analysis for projects and processes, focusing on the needs of our internal customers.  

 

Location: Guelph 

 

Job status: 4 month co-op term
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
In this Co-op placement you will be responsible for:

 

  
	 
 Conducting analysis to support ongoing Program Analysis processes (e.g., premium rate setting, forecasting, etc.)
	 
 Providing analytical support to the ongoing projects and processes of the Program Development Division and the organization
	 
 Acting as a project team member, as required
	 
 Interpreting and synthesizing analytical results
	 
 Responding to ad hoc requests for data, reports, and information to support business efforts
	 
 Effectively communicating information to staff and stakeholders
	 
 Researching and developing discussion papers, reports, and briefing notes

 Working towards Bachelor's Degree in Agricultural Business, Economics, Commerce, Statistics, or a related field
	 
 Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook)
	 
 Analytical, financial, mathematical, and statistical skills
	 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
	 
 Basic knowledge of SAS an asset
	 
 Agricultural/agronomic background an asset
 

Demonstrated Competencies

 

  
	 
 Achieving Personal Results - Focuses efforts on managing ones self to achieve high quality results consistent with the organizations standards and measures, while managing risk
	 
 Analytical Thinking - Interprets, links, and analyzes information and situations by breaking them down into component parts, identifying patterns, connections, and underlying issues
	 
 Attention to Detail -The ability to be conscientious, consistent, accurate, and thorough
	 
 Critical Judgment, Decision Making, and Problem Solving -Uses critical judgment to make decisions and solve problems involving varied levels of complexity, ambiguity, and risk
	 
 Teamwork and Collaboration - Works co-operatively within diverse teams, work groups and across the organization to achieve group and organizational objectives
	 
 Planning & Organizing - Developing, implementing, evaluating and adjusting plans to reach goals, while ensuring the optimal use of resources

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
Background 

As an agency of the Government of Ontario, Agricorp works with partners to contribute to a vibrant and sustainable agriculture industry. With more than 400 employees serving more than 44,000 producers province-wide, Agricorp delivers programs that help producers manage risk and remain financially secure. The agency was established in 1997 by the provincial government under the authority of the AgriCorp Act, 1996. 

Agricorp delivers a variety of programs and payments on behalf of the federal and provincial governments, including AgriStability, Farm Business Registration and Production Insurance. Please go to www.agricorp.com to see the full list of programs for more information.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Civil Engineering Co-Op Student 

(Construction Inspector) 

 

Avia NG is an airport consulting firm specializing in airport planning, design, contract administration and construction supervision services for airport infrastructure projects.  We operate from four (4) Canadian-based offices located in Kitchener, Calgary, Toronto and Southampton (Ontario) and serve airports, government and private clients throughout Canada and the Caribbean.  We are currently seeking one (1) engineering co-op student who has completed two years of the civil engineering academic program. 

This position will consist of construction inspection at one or more airports in Canada. Potential project sites include Toronto, Ottawa, London, Thunder Bay, and other airports across Canada.  During construction, it is expected that the successful applicant will be required to work overtime hours upwards of 60 hours per week.  Costs associated with travel, meals and accommodations will be reimbursed.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

  
	 
 Work with Professional Engineers and Project Managers in the planning, design and project management of airfield infrastructure projects for private airport, regional and international airports by applying principles of civil engineering.  Specific tasks include design of new runways, taxiways, aprons, airside service roads, approach lighting systems, airside commercial developments including site servicing, grading, earthworks, stormwater management and deicing facilities.
	 
 Assist in the development and preparation of figures, design drawings, specifications, calculations, cost estimates, quantity take-offs, technical reports, etc.
	 
 Enhance knowledge of airport design and requirements of reviewing agencies such as NAV CANADA, Transport Canada, Airport Authorities, Municipalities, etc.
	 
 Assist with or be responsible for Construction Inspection at project sites and evaluate contractor work to determine compliance with Contract Documents.
	 
 Assist in the administration of Construction Contracts including, shop drawing reviews, progress payment certificates, site instructions, change orders, construction progress reports and ensure that the General Contractor completes specified construction surveys and materials testing during construction.
	 
 Assist in planning and conducting site visits and topographic surveys.
	 
 Other duties as assigned or required.
 

As this position requires travel within Canada all candidates are expected to have a valid driver's license with a clean driving abstract.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
 

  
	 
 Enrolled in the Engineering Program and have completed a minimum of two years of the civil engineering academic program.
	 
 Contract administration and construction inspection experience, surveying, and/or materials testing.
	 
 Knowledge of safety procedures associated with working on active construction sites.
	 
 An interest in aviation/airports.
	 
 Fluent in spoken and written English.
	 
 Strong communication and report writing skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.
	 
 Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
	 
 Demonstrated experience with the MS Office suite of programs (MS Word, Excel, Outlook). AutoCAD Civil3d experience would be considered an asset.
	 
 Familiarity with Transport Canada Standard TP312 Aerodrome Design Standards (TP 312 5th Edition) is considered an asset.
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Avia NG is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities.    

We offer a competitive compensation package that includes opportunities for professional development.  Hourly wage will be commensurate with experience but may be up to $27.00 per hour. 

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in Avia NG; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple's University Recruiting team is looking for a highly motivated, engineering students with a strong background in Back-End Engineering, Core OS, and Web Development to join its team of highly skilled software engineers. Our software engineers are the brains behind some of the industry's biggest breakthroughs! OS X, Siri, Apple Maps, and iCloud - not to mention the system-level software for iPhone and Apple TV - all started here. These teams are on the front line of our constant charge toward innovation! We are actively seeking enthusiastic interns who can work full-time for a minimum of 12-weeks.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Some responsibilities in Hardware or Silicon Engineering may include: 

 

Backend Development - Making the features that Apple users love (like Siri) work by presenting data to the user-facing applications. Backend development opportunities are available for students in the following areas: 

 

Siri, iCloud, Apple Maps, Core OS, OS X, Frameworks and Applications, Interactive Media Group, Audio/Video Software Integration and Localization, Advanced Computation, iLife, iWorks, Aperture, Pro Apps, iTunes, Security, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and Platform Infrastructure Engineering (PIE) 

 

Core OS - The Core OS team is responsible for the design and development of core technologies that are deployed across all Apple product areas including the iPhone, iPad, Watch, MacBook, iMac, Apple TV, and audio accessories. (Yes, that's pretty much everything.) 

 

Web Development - Help build web-based tools and applications to improve our products and do more for our customers. Our developers are responsible for crafting the direction of our products by considering the architecture, performance, testing, design, and implementation. And of course we look for engineers that use our products. 

 

Engineers at Apple work on both UI level and lower-level implementation details. The successful intern candidate will be amenable to working in a dynamic, collaborative environment. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, enthusiastic, self-motivated developer with strong initiative and desire to succeed in a challenging environment. You will have a real passion for extraordinary user experiences and an eye for details. Those applying for the Web Development intern position should include a link to a web portfolio.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You may meet or have interest in any one of the following qualifications: 

Strong object-oriented design skills, coupled with a deep knowledge of data structures and algorithms 

Proficiency in one or more of the following developer skills: Java, C/C++, PHP, Python, Ruby, Unix, MySQL, Clojure, Scala, Java Script, CSS, HTML5 

Experience in sophisticated methodologies such as Data Modeling, Validation, Processing, Hadoop, MapReduce, Mongo, Pig 

Experience with web frameworks such as AngularJS, NodeJS, SproutCore 

Proven experience in application development in Objective-C for OS X or iOS a plus 

Client-Server protocol & API design Skills 

Able to craft multi-functional requirements and translate them into practical engineering tasks 

A fundamental knowledge of embedded processors, with in-depth knowledge of real time operating system concepts. 

Excellent debugging and critical thinking skills 

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills 

Ability to work in a fast paced, team-based environment
