Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Apple's Silicon Engineering Group (SEG) designs and implements the chips (SoCs) that help make the Apple Watch, iPhone and iPad world class products. Working within SEG, the Silicon Validation (SiVal) team employs embedded software engineers (writing code to interact with all the blocks in the SoCs), scripting gurus (web development, automated test framework), lab test engineers (look for silicon bugs) and triage engineers (debug silicon issues). Working with iOS engineers and logic designers, we ensure that our chips are extraordinarily well implemented and fabricated, and performing as specified. We're looking for self-motivated engineers passionate about "how things work" to jump in and join us in any of our roles.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: Areas of expertise within Silicon Validation include: CPU Data Motion Engineer In this highly visible role, you will write code to push data throughout the system in an effort to stress logic responsible for handling data, and to observe the resulting behavior through instrumentation. Media IP S/W Engineer Apple's products are known for their high-performance graphics and their image processing. A collection of media blocks play a central role, and you can work with these agents to ensure that all modes of imagery and the full range of capabilities are functioning as expected. Connectivity IP S/W Engineer Apple's products have a variety of high-speed I/O interfaces for communicating with wireless, cellular, and storage devices. In this role you will be writing code to engage these communication channels and put them through their paces. Full Stack Developer Use modern full-stack web technology to implement solutions for running the lab, driving the devices under test, the software tests we run, and for representing and interpreting the data that is generated. Debug Tools Engineer Leverage a background in computer architecture and design to build silicon debug tools. This role focuses on automated extraction of design features, data collation, visualization and analysis to help in rapid debug of failures. Board FW Engineer Develop, test, release, maintain, enhance micro-controller code (running in FPGAs) and low-level software (running on Unix-compatible environments) controlling SoCs under test. Test and Triage Engineer Gain experience in post-silicon validation (bringup, testing, debug). Execute silicon test plans in the lab, triage and debug in-system failures resulting from complex interactions between system software and the chip.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Proficiency in C and/or assembly level programming. Proficiency in scripting (e.g. Tcl/Expect, ruby, Python, Perl). Experience in low-level programming (e.g. kernel, drivers, RTOS, bare-metal). Familiarity with computer lab and lab equipment. System level perspective (knowledge of memory hierarchies, bus protocols, synchronization mechanisms, IO devices are all pluses). A commitment to understand the details of the operation of a system. 

 

Education: Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Considering the current affairs, co-ops will work remotely until it is deemed safe to return to office. 

 

Are you looking to work with a Company that really values its employees? A Company where you will have the opportunity to grow your knowledge and skills?  A Company that values diversity, community and people?  A place where your employer promotes flexibility to achieve work/life balance?  If that sounds like somewhere you want to be a part of we want to hear from you.  

  

Working with our Manager, Insurance Optimization, you will have the opportunity to benefit from their real life work experience designing and implementing pricing models.  You will have the opportunity to collaborate, build your network and gain on-the job experience.    

At Allstate our employees contribute to the success of the Company.    

  

This co-op opportunity will last until end of April, but we're always looking to expand our team!  

  

Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. 

  

About Allstate Insurance Company of Canada 

Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Allstate Insurance Company of Canada is a leading home and auto insurer focused on providing its customers prevention and protection products and services for every stage of life. The company is proud to have been named a Best Employer in Canada for nine consecutive years and prioritizes supporting employees and fostering an inclusive, welcoming corporate culture. Allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates through partnerships with charitable organizations, employee giving and volunteerism. Serving Canadians since 1953, Allstate strives to provide reassurance with its "You're in Good Hands®" promise.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Amity Health is a multi-disciplinary clinic located in Scarborough, ON. We are a team of health care professionals that works closely together to build on a trusting doctor-patient relationship. At Amity Health, we ensure that every patient receive a unique and comprehensive experience the moment they step foot into our clinic. We are looking to hire a clinic office administrator to help facilitate daily clinic operations, including interactions with patients and doctors, assisting practitioners as needed and maintenance of the clinic.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Serves patients by greeting and helping them with health intakes, scheduling appointments and maintaining records and financial account
	 
 Include welcoming patients and visitors in person or on the phone, and answering or referring inquiries.
	 
 Optimize patients' satisfaction and treatment room utilization by appropriately scheduling appointments
	 
 Obtains revenue by recording and updating financial information, recording and collecting patient payments, filing and expediting third-party claims (i.e. health insurance)
	 
 Maintains business office inventory and equipment by checking stock to determine inventory level, anticipating needed supplies, placing orders of supplies and scheduling equipment service and repairs.
	 
 Protects patients' rights by maintaining confidentiality of medical, personal and financial information
	 
 Maintains operations by following policies and procedures
	 
 Ensure a safe environment for practitioners and patients, include maintaining a tidy facility, upkeep of PPE and sanitization protocols
	 
 Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Multi-tasking to ensure tasks are performed efficiently and effectively
	 
 Customer service as part of patient care and rapport
	 
 Time management and organization skills to help manage daily operations of clinic
	 
 Flexibility to clinic hours and schedule
	 
 Professionalism towards patients and healthcare practitioners
	 
 Quality focus
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Hourly pay: $15.00/hour 

Free parking on-site
 

  
	 
 Learn valuable skills in patient care and customer service
	 
 Personally learn from clinic owner who started her own business in the time of Covid 
	 
 Opportunity to learn from different health care practitioners

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
In addition to applying online through your university's system, you must also complete the following online questionnaire:
https://www.feedback.amd.com/se/5A1E27D20A0157C3 

 
What you do at AMD changes everything 

AMD is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its ground-breaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) which power a wide range of computing devices. AMD's server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD's superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers. 

 

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies, the building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. 

 

Our Toronto office is conveniently located in the heart of 'Silicon Valley North' in Markham near Hwy 7 and Hwy 404. The Markham campus has over 2100+ employees. AMD has a strong student population, hiring over 205+ Co-op's each year. 

 

Now is the time to unleash your knowledge and show the world what you can really do. Make your education count by coming to work at AMD. As a Co-op student, you can make an immediate contribution to AMD's next generation of technology innovations. We have a dynamic, high-energy work environment, filled with expert employees, and unique opportunities for developing your career. With the AMD, you can get hands-on experience that will give you a competitive edge in the workforce. You can put classroom theory into practice and get an inside look at AMD's technical teams, work style, and culture. 

 

UX/UI Designer Co-op 

 

The Role We're looking for a budding and enthusiastic UX/UI designer with a passion PC and console gaming to help shape and contribute to the future of AMD's software products. 

 

This is an exciting opportunity for you to expand your knowledge of user interface and experience design, learn design principles, develop your design tool skills, and work alongside an experienced senior designer. 

 

About the department 

Our team develops software that integrates with AMD's Radeon Graphics cards. Our goal is to bring value to our customers by improving their user experience with our software. While this can be challenging, we find it to be incredibly meaningful, especially when we succeed. We work collectively to design, build and market our software within a product release cycle. As part of this cycle, each year we plan, prioritize, test and release new features with our software. 

 

Our team is made up of diverse individuals who are passionate about what they do. We give people the autonomy to make their own decisions and mistakes so that they can learn and grow. We encourage everyone to take part in discussions, ask questions and provide their input. We are gamers, enthusiasts, and hobbyists who like to take it easy, but work hard when the time calls for it. We have a motto: Love what you do and have fun doing it. 

 

Job purpose 

Your goal will be to integrate as part of the team and our product release cycle, by communicating and working with team members to create user interface designs and solutions for new and existing software products.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
What you'll learn

 

  
	 
 All about our products and their features
	 
 How to work within a product release cycle
	 
 How to work and communicate with other team members
	 
 How to think critically about user experiences and interactions
	 
 How to empathize with users and consumers
	 
 How to design for various platforms and devices
	 
 How to review designs, receive criticism and incorporate feedback
	 
 How to use design tools at an advanced level
 

 

What you'll be doing

 

  
	 
 Problem solving and experimenting
	 
 Designing user interfaces and user flows
	 
 Building click-through prototypes
	 
 Communicating and working with team members
	 
 Reviewing your designs and work with the team
	 
 Creating production ready mockups and assets
 

 

Responsibilities

 

  
	 
 Work with product managers and developers to understand and help define new and update existing features in our products
	 
 Define the user interaction and flow of features for new and existing products
	 
 Review, present and communicate your designs with product managers, developers and senior team members
	 
 Thoughtfully incorporate gathered feedback into your designs and keep the team up to date with changes
	 
 Provide team members with updates and rough estimates for when you expect to complete your day to day tasks
	 
 Be proactive in communicating with and helping the team by understanding their expectations and your responsibilities
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Requirements

 

  
	 
 A portfolio of work that demonstrates understanding in creating usable interfaces and interactions. Show us your process and thinking.
	 
 Knowledge with mobile, desktop and responsive design is a plus
	 
 Experience with using and working in Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma or other equivalents
	 
 Ability to work both independently and in a team setting
	 
 Enrollment in a university/college program for design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or related/equivalent field.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
MAJOR DUTIES: 

As a member of a team of professionals you will develop industrial control systems for automated assembly systems. You will be required to produce hardware and software designs to meet customer control specifications. You will test these designs during system integration to ensure that all design requirements have been met. The challenge is to develop world-class control systems that meet or exceed our customer's requirements.  As a member of our control systems team, you will gain experience using the latest Industrial control products including PLC's, SCADA Systems, Human Machine Interfaces, Servo Controllers, Robots and Data Acquisition equipment.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Under the supervision of an experienced Control Systems Software Designer, you will:
 

  
	 
 Develop real-time control system software for automated assembly systems. This includes the programming of PLC's, Servo Controllers, Robots and Vision Systems.
	 
 Develop human machine interfaces. These interfaces can be commercially available industrial products, SCADA nodes or custom GUI's written in Visual Basic or Visual C++.
	 
 Work with mechanical and electrical designers to ensure that the control system will meet performance, reliability and functionality requirements.
	 
 Perform system integration.This includes the testing of all system hardware and software, the configuration and calibration of intelligent devices and the verification of the assembly process.The goal is to meet all customer quality, functionality and safety requirements.
	 
 Perform on-site commissioning and startup.This involves demonstrating system's capability once the equipment has been shipped to the customer's site.
	 
 Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
	 
 Adhere to all health and safety rules and procedures.
 

PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE) REQUIREMENTS

 

  
	 
 Due to arc flash and shock hazards, voltage-rated gloves and 100% cotton, long-sleeve shirts must be worn at all times when working on live panels.
	 
 Employees must comply at all times with the specific PPE requirements identified on the ARC Flash and Shock Hazard Warning Labels (see below for your information.) These will be posted at Switchgear locations, breaker panels, bus ducts and equipment related power drops.
	 
 Please refer to the Workplace Electrical Safety Program for specific details.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
QUALIFICATIONS: 

 

Education:

 

  
	 
 Electrical, Computer or Systems Design Engineering student with an interest in industrial control systems.
 

Experience:           

 

  
	 
 Real-time controls, PLC programming, motion controls, vision programming.
	 
 GUI development (Visual C++, Visual Basic).
	 
 SCADA system development (Wonderware, Intellution).
	 
 A self-starter with the ability to work as part of a team with minimal supervision.
Job Posting Information.Targeted Degrees and Disciplines::
Targeted Clusters
			
		
		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Ready to make an impact? Arctic Wolf is looking for a Software Developer - Full Stack Co-op to join our pack. 

 

Arctic Wolf, fresh off its unicorn valuation, is the leader in security operations in an exciting and fast-growing industry-cybersecurity. How fast are we growing? Well, Arctic Wolf was highly ranked in the Deloitte Fast Technology 500 for North America in both 2019 (#25) and 2020 (#104)! We have doubled headcount, customers, and revenue for five years running. 

 

We are also cultivating a collaborative and productive work environment that welcomes a diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and ideas to make our teams even stronger as we grow our teams globally. In fact, we were named a 2021 Top Workplace USA (Energage) as the top technology firm to work in our size category, were recognized as one of the 2020 Best Places to Work (bizjournals.com), and most recently were certified as a 2021 Great Place to Work (Great Places to Work Institute, Canada). 

 

Arctic Wolf believes in corporate responsibility, and our worldwide offices proudly participate in volunteer programs throughout their communities. We've also earned distinction from TravelWise for our efforts in promoting sustainable transportation.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Participate in the full software development life cycle
	 
 Build well-designed, testable, efficient, secure code
	 
 Deliver solutions at the intersection of Big Data, Cloud, and Web
	 
 Collaborate with the user experience designer, product manager and other developers to understand problems, then develop and test solutions in an iterative cycle
	 
 Work with the latest technologies and broaden your skillset
	 
 Meet regularly with the team to review progress and share technical issues
	 
 Implement bug-fixes and contribute to on-going product maintenance
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
About You 

You will have experience in the following areas:
 

  
	 
 Experienced with backend development: Python or Go
	 
 Solid knowledge of TypeScript/JavaScript, React, CSS and HTML5
	 
 Working knowledge of GitHub, Jenkins, and automated test tools
	 
 Passionate about building beautiful, simple and effective user interfaces
	 
 Intelligent, hard-working, and eager to share your code early and often
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Arctic Wolf values its co-ops just like full-time employees. Salary is based on the work term number and is roughly 20% above the Canadian work term average. There are plenty of other perks like free snacks, drinks and swag - and when our offices reopen, we're close to UW! 

 

Working at Arctic Wolf  

Arctic Wolf recognizes that success comes from delighting our customers, so we work together to ensure that happens every day. We believe in diversity and inclusion, and truly value the unique qualities and unique perspectives all employees bring to the organization. And we appreciate that-by protecting people's and organizations' sensitive data and aiming to end cyber risk- we get to work in an industry that is fundamental to the greater good.  

All wolves receive compelling compensation and benefits packages, including:  

Equity for all employees  

Paid parental leave  

Training and career development programs  

If you're excited about this role, but do not meet all of the qualifications listed above, we still encourage you to apply. We review all applications and may yet consider you the right person for the role or have another open position where you're the perfect fit.  

Arctic Wolf is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetics, or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.  

Arctic Wolf is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful, and inclusive environment that ensures equal access and participation for people with disabilities. Please let us know if you require any accommodations by emailing?recruiting@arcticwolf.com.

Integrate software components into a fully functional software system.  

Document and maintain software functionality.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
INTRO 

A little about WorkMarket: WorkMarket, an ADP company, provides a Freelance Management System (FMS) that is used by today's biggest companies to organize, manage, and pay their freelancers and independent contractors. WorkMarket was acquired by the most trusted name in human capital management -- ADP. We're looking for brilliant product managers to join us on the mission of a lifetime: to power the future of work. 

 

We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. ADP has a deep commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as a global Best Places to Work, DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. Learn more about ADP's commitment on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos 

 

Work Market is looking for students that will work out of our Toronto office. Our corporate headquarters is in New York City which  This is a great opportunity to work for one of the fastest growing startups in the United States! 

 

If selected, you will be part of our Enterprise Ready or Core Platform teams working towards efficiency and innovation within our platform.  They are  small teams that enable students to have a high degree of impact.  This position is for people who see themselves as self starters, and leaders that can drive results with limited supervision. 

 

Our Culture 

Work Market believes a little humanity goes a long way, we always put our employees and customers first. Coop students at Work Market get the same opportunities as any full time employees. Mentorship will provide the support coop students need to achieve their goals during their time with us.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The student works with our scrum teams on a broad range of development projects. The Engineer is expected to develop a deep understanding of their team's area of focus to help facilitate the following activities: 
 

  
	 
  Working with our product team to design and develop features for our platform
	 
  Involvement in lifecycle of code, from creation to deployment into production
	 
  Working with microservices, SPAs and our main application

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Civil Engineering Co-Op Student 

(Construction Inspector) 

 

Avia NG is an airport consulting firm specializing in airport planning, design, contract administration and construction supervision services for airport infrastructure projects.  We operate from four (4) Canadian-based offices located in Kitchener, Calgary, Toronto and Southampton (Ontario) and serve airports, government and private clients throughout Canada and the Caribbean.  We are currently seeking one (1) engineering co-op student who has completed two years of the civil engineering academic program. 

This position will consist of construction inspection at one or more airports in Canada. Potential project sites include Toronto, Ottawa, London, Thunder Bay, and other airports across Canada.  During construction, it is expected that the successful applicant will be required to work overtime hours upwards of 60 hours per week.  Costs associated with travel, meals and accommodations will be reimbursed.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

  
	 
 Work with Professional Engineers and Project Managers in the planning, design and project management of airfield infrastructure projects for private airport, regional and international airports by applying principles of civil engineering.  Specific tasks include design of new runways, taxiways, aprons, airside service roads, approach lighting systems, airside commercial developments including site servicing, grading, earthworks, stormwater management and deicing facilities.
	 
 Assist in the development and preparation of figures, design drawings, specifications, calculations, cost estimates, quantity take-offs, technical reports, etc.
	 
 Enhance knowledge of airport design and requirements of reviewing agencies such as NAV CANADA, Transport Canada, Airport Authorities, Municipalities, etc.
	 
 Assist with or be responsible for Construction Inspection at project sites and evaluate contractor work to determine compliance with Contract Documents.
	 
 Assist in the administration of Construction Contracts including, shop drawing reviews, progress payment certificates, site instructions, change orders, construction progress reports and ensure that the General Contractor completes specified construction surveys and materials testing during construction.
	 
 Assist in planning and conducting site visits and topographic surveys.
	 
 Other duties as assigned or required.
 

As this position requires travel within Canada all candidates are expected to have a valid driver's license with a clean driving abstract.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
 

  
	 
 Enrolled in the Engineering Program and have completed a minimum of two years of the civil engineering academic program.
	 
 Contract administration and construction inspection experience, surveying, and/or materials testing.
	 
 Knowledge of safety procedures associated with working on active construction sites.
	 
 An interest in aviation/airports.
	 
 Fluent in spoken and written English.
	 
 Strong communication and report writing skills and ability to prioritize/manage multiple project timelines.
	 
 Mature, self-motivated individual possessing effective communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
	 
 Demonstrated experience with the MS Office suite of programs (MS Word, Excel, Outlook). AutoCAD Civil3d experience would be considered an asset.
	 
 Familiarity with Transport Canada Standard TP312 Aerodrome Design Standards (TP 312 5th Edition) is considered an asset.
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Avia NG is committed to providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities.   

 

We offer a competitive compensation package that includes opportunities for professional development.  Hourly wage will be commensurate with experience but may be up to $27.00 per hour. 

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in Avia NG; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About the Roles  

ArtsPond is seeking Junior, Front-end, and Back-end Software Developers to design, develop, and test software applications for Hatch Open, an open source Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solution for managing the artistic, creative, and cultural industries.   

The positions will assist with all functions of software coding and design in close collaboration with the Technical Lead (Chief Technology Officer) and Lead Product Designer.   

 

About Hatch Open  

Hatch Open is an open source Enterprise Resource Planning solution supporting the full spectrum of business management needs of small creators and producers in the artistic, creative, and cultural industries. Major features currently under development include financial management (budgeting, invoicing, payment processing), impact investing (non-charitable donations, crowdfunding), and ecosystem mapping (geographic and semantic visualization of ecosystem connections and resources, including individuals, organizations, projects, artworks, knowledge resources, stories, and perspectives).    

 

About ArtsPond  

Join our team and play a role in advancing equity and justice in Canada. ArtsPond is a caregiver and changemaker of a different sort. Our mandate is to nurture healthy ecosystems that bolster social, spatial, economic, ecological, digital, and accessibility justice in human, virtual, and natural life. We do so by fostering cooperative actions fusing the wisdom and values of social innovation and the arts. We offer competitive compensation packages. For more information about ArtsPond, please visit our website at ArtsPond.com.    

 

ArtsPond is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, creed (religion), colour, disability, ethnic origin, family status, gender identity or expression, place of origin, or race, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws. We particularly encourage equity-seeking groups including women, Black, Indigenous, New Canadians, visible minorities, persons with disabilities, 2LGBTQ+ and other diverse identities, cultures, and origins to apply.

3) Back-end Software Developer

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
AdHawk Microsystems develops eye-tracking technology that helps unlock the connection between the eyes, the brain and the world around us. We produce custom silicon microsystems at the wafer-scale to enable the proliferation of eye tracking in consumer electronics products. Our team has re-imagined the architecture of conventional eye-tracking systems to achieve the performance that is required for mobile, medical, and AR/VR applications. With order-of-magnitude improvements in sampling rate, latency, and power consumption, we can capture subtle changes in eye movement dynamics, enabling effortless control of wearable devices, while revealing the interests, emotional state, and health of a person. 

 

We are a fully funded startup with an experienced management team that believes in the ability of candidates to make a significant contribution to the future of human-computer interaction (HCI). 

 

We believe in a flexible work environment with an emphasis on results and outcomes--not hours. Our team consists of researchers and engineers of the highest caliber with a deep sense of curiosity and a passion for the technology we develop. We publish award-winning research papers, fabricate custom silicon chips at leading foundries, and push the boundaries of physics and manufacturing to develop products that create compelling value for our customers.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
AdHawk is looking for software developers to help turn our MEMS scanner modules into an awesome product. 

 

We use python for our desktop-based service that communicates with the embedded platform. We have a number of desktop applications written in PyQt for configuring our embedded platform and visualizing our data streams. We also use python for the research and development of new eye-tracking algorithms. 

 

We use a cloud-based data platform to organize, analyze, and visualize the large amount of eye-tracking data generated by our platform.  We are looking for individuals to help us build a robust and scalable data platform that will be used to collect, analyze and showcase the data gathered from AdHawk's eye-tracking hardware. 

 

As a small team, there is the flexibility to gain experience and contribute to all levels of our stack. You will be able to take full ownership of projects which interest you within our development pipeline, with help and guidance readily available when it's needed. 

 

Skills you will gain during your term include: NodeJS, MongoDB, InfluxDB, REST, GraphQL, Angular, RabbitMQ, Docker, Python
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Required: 

- Strong software development fundamentals 

- Experience with frontend frameworks like Angular or React 

- Experience with Web APIs: REST, GraphQL 

- Experience with NoSQL databases: MongoDB, InfluxDB 

- Familiarity with tools like Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Jira 

 

Nice to have: 

- Experience with building and running containers 

- Experience with Python, PyQt, numpy, scipy, matplotlib, pandas
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Compensation: (average for work term and faculty) * 1.25 

We offer a hybrid work model and flexible hours 

Office perks: Lunch, snacks, ping pong table and a climbing wall! 

 

We are covid-19 conscious and continue to follow public health recommended protocols in office

Our team has re-imagined the architecture of conventional eye-tracking systems to achieve the performance that is required for mobile, medical, and AR/VR applications. With order-of-magnitude improvements in sampling rate, latency, and power consumption, we can capture subtle changes in eye movement dynamics, enabling effortless control of wearable devices, while revealing the interests, emotional state, and health of a person. We are a fully funded startup with an experienced management team that believes in the ability of candidates to make a significant contribution to the future of human-computer interaction (HCI). We believe in a flexible work environment with an emphasis on results and outcomes--not hours. Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
We are looking for a motivated software developer to join our team to help evaluate the capabilities of our eye tracking sensors on desktop and mobile platforms. 

 

Our test infrastructure is developed in Python and automated through Jenkins. It is capable of remotely connecting to our in-house robot eyes, and automatically test various eye movements and various eye positions in real world settings. 

 

You will be working with other software developers to design and create new tests (Ad-Hoc, exploratory, regression, and performance testing) targeting multiple clients (C or Python) on multiple platforms (Linux, Windows, and Mac). 

 

You will be able to take full ownership of one or two significant projects throughout the term with support and guidance readily available.

 Proficient in Python for test development and automation (pytest, numpy)
	 
 Familiarity with tools like Git, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Jira

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
AdHawk Microsystems is changing the way that humans interact with computers by introducing microsystems that can detect eye movements with unprecedented resolution, speed, and power efficiency. Our eye tracking sensors will transform the way people use Virtual and Augmented Reality (VR/AR) technology through foveated rendering, intuitive and seamless UI design, and enhanced immersion.  

 

We are a fully funded startup with an experienced management team that believes in the ability of co-op candidates to make a significant contribution - in fact, AdHawk's founding team members have all been UW engineering coop students in the past. We believe in a flexible work environment with an emphasis on results and outcomes--not hours.  Our team consists of researchers, Ph. D.'s, and engineers of the highest caliber with a deep sense of curiosity and a passion for the technology we develop. We publish award-winning research papers, fabricate custom silicon chips at leading foundries and push the boundaries of physics and manufacturing to develop products that create compelling value for our customers. 

 

The successful candidate would gain hands-on experience working on yet-to-be-released VR/AR products. Work topics include but are not limited to: circuit design and layout, mechanical design and 3D printing, identifying and integrating new components, and optical system testing and debugging. New ideas and exploratory work are encouraged. Learning is part of AdHawk's culture and our cross-disciplinary team is always happy to share knowledge with interested students. 

 

Perks of working at AdHawk include: free lunches, drinks, and snacks every day, table tennis, rock climbing, and VR gaming! We are located near campus and close to an LRT stop. We look forward to working with creative, enthusiastic students in an exciting startup environment!
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
- Contribute innovative and original ideas to the technology, algorithms, and products from ideation to implementation 

- Work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements and use cases, then translate into hardware to advance performance metrics: power, speed, accuracy, reliability, yield, and cost 

- Integrate tracker hardware in various form factors into customer prototypes 

- Develop system tests and build circuit boards and test jigs for new hardware 

-Contribute to a variety of projects in the areas of electrical and mechanical design as well as firmware and optics.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
- Circuit design experience or strong foundation in a mixed-signal environment at the board, chip or system level 

- Experience with SPICE circuit simulation 

- PCB schematic entry and layout 

- Rapid prototyping: soldering, breadboarding, debugging hardware, and component selection 

 

Good skills to have: 

- We primarily use Solidworks and Altium Designer. Experience with similar tools is also considered an asset 

- Flexible circuit board experience 

- MEMS device knowledge, thermo-mechanical modeling 

- Experience with optical systems, Zemax 

- 3D printing experience 

- Hackathon experience

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Are you interested in joining a group of highly talented engineers working on an open source project that is solving challenging problems across big data analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence? As customers continuously push the envelope for ways to extract value from data, Alluxio is driving innovation in data access and management for large scale distributed systems. Alluxio, a project from AMPLab like Apache Spark and Mesos, is the first data orchestration platform for the cloud, to enable analytical and AI workloads.The Alluxio team includes leaders, innovators, explorers, and risk-takers with extensive industry experience from top tech companies including Google, Palantir, Couchbase and VMWare and alumni from top computer science programs including CMU, Stanford and UC Berkeley. The company is backed by Andreessen-Horowitz and has been named as top 10 hot startups for 2018,  top 10 big data startups of 2019,  top 10 coolest enterprise cloud services of 2019, and featured in Forbes as a leading company in data orchestration technology!
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: As an engineering intern at Alluxio, you will be responsible for implementing infrastructure for our state-of-the-art product. This role will provide you with a unique opportunity to impact the success of the company and to grow your career at a fast pace while working directly with Sr. engineers and learning from them.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Minimum Qualifications 

1. Currently pursing Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience. 

2. Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, or Go. 

3. Interest and ability to learn other programming languages as needed. 

4. Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English. 

5. Experience working in any of the following areas: web application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, and/or developing large software systems. 

 

Preferred Qualifications: 

1. Exposure to AWS, Dockers, Jenkins 

2. Contributed or contributing to Alluxio's open source project 

 

For top performers, Alluxio will provide fulltime employment opportunity after they graduate. Please note that the full time employment at Alluxio requires legal work authorization status in the US. Students who wish to obtain such opportunity should be legally entitled to work in the US upon graduation.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
We're looking for people who want to show up to the future and we're building a founding team for the future of health devtools. We have an open core "Plaid for health" product that you will help us build.
 

  
	 
 Company formed at start of 2021 by ex-YC founder group of 3, raised $2M at the start of 2021 - cumulatively, we've raised nearly $20M in our careers so far
	 
 During your co-op, you will be part of the founding team and help us launch "Plaid for health"
	 
 You will alter the trajectory of our R&D work with rapid prototype development
 

We want to work with people who are:

 

  
	 
 Authentic and opinionated - with a story to tell
	 
 Thinking about the future a lot these days
	 
 An ex-founder or a future founder
	 
 Deeply technical
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
You will contribute platform code, technical writing, and product roadmapping. You will advance in your understanding of typed languages like TypeScript, modern ECMAScript standards, database schema development, exchange formats like GraphQL, and standards like FHIR which are going to power the future of health data.
 

  
	 
 Work primarily in TypeScript alongside tools like Postgresql
	 
 Read complicated protocol definitions and schematic documentation for implementers of health data system
	 
 Ship UIs in React and sometimes with Next.js
	 
 Autonomously contribute to our growing body of open source work and important health data projects
	 
 Provide clear, frequent communication in variable formats (reading, writing, speaking)
	 
 Bring a generalist perspective, we are a super early stage startup so you will work on a diversity of challenges
	 
 Employ natural curiosity and willingness to learn things you don't have experience with
	 
 Uphold best practices for development, security, and patient rights to privacy

 Independence and self-starting attitude, taking ownership and solving hard problems

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About Us 

ArenaX Labs is the parent company for AI Arena, an Ethereum native game (dApp) where players all over the world can purchase, train and battle NFT characters powered by real artificial intelligence. The game is a 1v1 style fighting game, like Super Smash Bros and Street Fighter. However, there is one important distinction - you (the human) do not control your fighter in battle. Each fighter is powered and controlled by AI. The goal is to improve your AI over time through training and prepare them for battle in the Arena vs. other AIs. ArenaX Labs is backed by two leading crypto VC firms based out of SF. 

 

Our Mission 

We are believers in the "ownership economy" thesis, whereby economic benefit should accrue more directly to the individuals who create value. AI Arena provides ML/AI researchers a way to properly monetize IP, whilst creating an opportunity for everyone to own AI through NFTs. In the process, we hope to educate the world about AI through a fun and easy-to-use dApp game. 

 

Position Details 

We are looking for a talented game developer to help with the development of AI Arena. We have many exciting things to work on, from game development to machine learning to blockchain! If you have a passion for any (or all) of the above and want to work on a fast-growing project in the crypto space, we want to speak to you.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Job Description: 

 

  
	 
 You will assist in the design of core game mechanics, tools, and infrastructure, and providing valuable insight into all aspects of the game production process.
	 
 We are building something complex, so large feats of engineering should excite you! We want to meet you if you're driven, passionate and embody the hustler attitude to make it in a dynamic and hyper competitive field.
 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  
	 
 Implement core game logic for the platform fighter
	 
 Collaborate with our art department and engineering team to bring the team's vision to reality
	 
 Work on server-side code for running autonomous battles, and client-side rendering in ThreeJS
	 
 Optimize performance issues and be proactive to avoid potential obstacles
	 
 Bug fixing, maintenance and optimization
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Must haves:

 

  
	 
 Fluency in HTML/CSS/JS (with experience in ReactJS)
	 
 Proficiency with OOP in Python
	 
 Experience building games (platform fighters are a bonus)
	 
 Experience working with 3D environments in ThreeJS
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
$30-$40/hr. 

Compensation is flexible, depending on candidate.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
As a former EE grad from Waterloo that was interested in how businesses were built and operated from my earliest terms...I found it challenging to find co-op's that got me closer to the business and provided an opportunity to have a meaningful impact on the customer experience. 

 

Atolio is a seed stage software company, founded in 2019 by former engineers and early employees from Splunk ($30B company) and PagerDuty (uWaterloo alum) - having been part of the earliest team (under $1M in revenue) until IPO. 

 

Our first product is a platform for corporate information - integrated into your on-prem and cloud ecosystems (Microsoft, Google, Box, Atlassian, Slack, etc.) to help employees search, discover and organize information. We are solving the enterprise search problem, but the broader solution looks more like Splunk with more valuable data.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
As a backend systems engineer, you will be assisting at the earliest stages of building a new cloud-based enterprise product, investigating and proposing algorithmic improvements, building out integration pipelines, testing search relevance with our internal dataset and working with the team to establish cloud infrastructure. 

 

We are using industry leading tools and languages such as Go, Java, graph databases, full text search systems, machine learning, AWS, IaaC, CI/CD, etc. 

 

As the product is at an early stage, there's a good amount of flexibility around the work to be done and can be shaped by your own expertise and interest. 

 

If you want to be part of an early team building a product that has real impact for big enterprises and an opportunity to learn more about how a business is run (not just how products are built), apply.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
ALT TEX is a seed stage biomaterials startup, on a mission to create the world's most sustainable fabrics through our ALTernative TEXtile innovation. Through our proprietary biotechnology, we're taking one of the world's largest landfill contributors - food waste - and re-engineering it into biodegradable and carbon neutral fabrics with polyester-like performance. 

 

The Bioprocess Purification Researcher Co-op will play an active R&D role in the ongoing development and optimization of the ALT TEX food-to-fibre technology, specifically along the intermediate purification steps. The role will report to the Research Lead and will work closely with the research team to conduct literary and lab-based R&D.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Conduct literary research on various fermentation purification methods to support ongoing lab studies
	 
 Observe and conduct lab research to iterate purification process and develop/interpret associated technical reports and standard operating procedures based on findings
	 
 Perform gravity chromatography and liquid extraction experiments under the supervision of the lead bioprocess researcher
	 
 Contribute to the design of experiments and troubleshooting
	 
 Complete product quality, and production yield evaluations and implement continuous improvement practices
	 
 Support day-to-day research operations including material tracking/ordering and organizing lab activity and workplans
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You're an impact and sustainability focused innovator who wants to use their talent for massively scalable change. You're a risk taker ready to immerse yourself in an incredibly fast-paced and dynamic team, in a position that offers rapid job growth opportunity. You're an innovative thinker and want to bring bold ideas to the table where you can supercharge them to fruition. 

 
 

  
	 
 
   
		 
  
    
			 
   Your background
			& experience:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Bachelor's degree (WIP) or higher in areas of Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Bioprocess Engineering or related field
				 
     Hands-on experience with chromatography and/or liquid extraction
				 
     Preferred if experience with: ionic exchange chromatography, liquid-liquid extraction (reactive and non-reactive/reactive), reactive distillation, etc.
				 
     Experience with filtration techniques such centrifugation, ultra filtration systems, etc
				 
     Characterization and analysis experience (HPLC, LC/MS, MS, GC, or NMR) preferred
				 
     experience conducting independent research in a lab setting
			 
    
			
		 
  
		 
  
    
			 
   Your
			skills & attributes:
			 
   
			 
    
      
				 
     Entrepreneurial: you're highly independent with the ability to self-drive fast-paced projects with extreme resourcefulness and speed
				 
     Innovative and analytical: you're a big picture, out of the box thinker who is always questioning the norm and approaches problem solving with disruptive thinking
				 
     Impact oriented: you're out to change the world and your work means more to you than a 9-5
				 
     Action oriented: you're a leader and self-starter who makes things happen without the need for significant structure or delegation
Job Posting Information.Compensation and Benefits Information::
Compensation: $17 per hour (or commensurate with experience)
	 
 Flexible work hours and location
	 
 Casual work environment 
	 
 Lots of team socials!

Job Posting Information.Job Summary:: Prices insurance products with up-to-date pricing assumptions, performing cash flow testing for assigned insurance products and using the required actuarial technology. Monitors lapse, mortality/morbidity experience on an on-going basis and provides reporting on the profitability of new products and/or product enhancements. Provides actuarial services expertise and advisory support for all insurance products of BMO Life Assurance - from direct marketing, Life insurance through agency operations, structured settlements and group annuity contracts (known as terminal funding), SPIAs, segregated funds and other retirement and investment products.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Analyzes, evaluates and compares competitor insurance products for the high net worth market and other markets.
	 
 Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
	 
 Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
	 
 Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
	 
 Analyzes company data to provide management reporting on insurance industry and internal business trends.
	 
 Creates and validates Excel spreadsheets to accurately reflect product values, marketing concepts and company profitability on a monthly basis, including analysis and commentary.
	 
 Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
	 
 Provides input for continuous improvement of processes and procedures to support more effective operations.
	 
 Provides input into the planning and implementation of operational programs.
	 
 Provides sales support and business expertise in the production of insurance quotes for high net worth clients and other clients upon request.
	 
 Performs required illustrations based on defined parameters using business judgment and makes appropriate referrals for illustrations of higher complexity and large policy over product's maximum issue limit.
	 
 Provides business and technical expertise when required for management reporting, special projects and technology issues.
	 
 Provides input into product design using actuarial experience and competitive & industry knowledge, including presenting counter proposals as required for new and existing products.
	 
 Provides an ongoing competitive analysis of BMO insurance products and identifies opportunities for business growth.
	 
 Coordinates provision of management information, according to established needs and timelines, for use in internal and external audits and for general management information.
	 
 Reviews progress to plans, and participates in the implementation of actions necessary to correct internal and external issues.
	 
 Focus may be on a business/group.
	 
 Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions.
	 
 Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
	 
 Works mostly independently.
	 
 Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Currently enrolled in an actuarial science or mathematics degree program.
	 
 Successful completion of at least 1 SOA exam and actively pursuing an FSA/FCIA designation.
	 
 Combination of excellent analytical and mathematical skills with strong work ethic.
	 
 Strong software skills in MS Excel and MS Access database.
	 
 Knowledge of life insurance products is an asset.
	 
 Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.
	 
 Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
	 
 Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
	 
 Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
	 
 Influence skills - In-depth.

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 3414 Other Assisting Occupations in Support of Health Services (including Clinical Kinesiologist, Occupational Therapist)
Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements::
This position is funded by the Government of Canada's Student Work Placement Program (SWPP).  The program provides funding to hire students for the purposes of experiential learning and is administered by Employment and Social Development Canada through a partner organization, BioTalent. 

 

General eligibility requirements: Students from all co-op programs (undergraduate and graduate) are eligible. Students must be Canadian citizens, permanent residents or a person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of employment to qualify for funding from SWPP.
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Foot and lower limb health & wellness is crucial to overall health and longevity.
			 
			At BioPed, we hire and train Kinesiology students to become Canadian Certified Pedorthists. BioPed's Canadian Certified Pedorthists (C.Ped (C)'s)  are biomechanical experts, specializing in orthotics, footwear and other supportive devices to address lower limb conditions. They work in concert with family physicians and other health care providers to improve the quality of life of their patients.  As a C. Ped. (C), you would perform in-depth evaluations through observation of surface anatomy, palpation of the lower limb, gait analysis, orthopaedic testing and footwear analysis, and devise a treatment plan for your patients, which may include a device, a specialty shoe, exercise/stretching, or otherwise.
			 
			Those who become Pedorthists have the opportunity to work as a Clinician, Clinic Manager and/or own their own BioPed clinic.
			 
			To learn more about BioPed, please visit www.bioped.com
			 
			To learn more about what a Pedorthist is, please visit http://www.pedorthic.ca/
			
			Work location: Ontario, British Columbia, Nova Scotia (refer to the job posting for the specific city)
			
			Accommodations and Travel: Please be advised that you are required to arrange for your own travel to and from the clinic during your co-op semester, as well as for living accommodations.
			Recent Student Testimonials:
			"My experiences at BioPed enriched my exposure and curiosity within the field of footcare and orthotics. My peers at BioPed established a welcoming and supportive environment. From shadowing the Pedorthic team, I observed clinical procedures and made connections that enhanced the concepts taught from my undergraduate studies. My involvement within the orthotics assembly process, as well as patient assessments, facilitated my growth as a Co-op student. BioPed provided an excellent opportunity to develop the fundamental experiences of a health care provider."
			 
			-Shawn Budiatmanto, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Fall 2020
			 
			"My experience at BioPed was absolutely amazing. I was given the opportunity to learn about Pedorthics and Chiropody, two career paths I was unaware of prior to working there. I was a little nervous when starting as it was my first work term, however the staff at BioPed were very friendly and welcomed me in with open arms. I learned so much about lower limb injuries and treatments, bracing options, and even how to work with vendors and insurance companies throughout the work term. I would highly recommend working at BioPed if given the chance!"
			 
			- Makayla Fraser, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Winter 2021
			 
			"Prior to this work term, I had never been exposed to the field of Pedorthics and Chiropody and was quite unfamiliar with what these professions have to offer. Working at Bioped has now opened an entirely new perspective of healthcare which I did not consider before. Throughout my time here, I have been able to see and experience first-hand all the hard work that is put in to provide patients with nothing but the most effective solutions to address their problems and concerns. Whether it was through fabrication of orthotics, sitting in on assessments or dealing with customer retail, each day brought a new experience to learn from, which piqued my interest and kept me engaged. Overall, this work term has been a memorable experience working with such a dynamic and innovative team, who all have positively influenced my growth as a kinesiology student."
			 
			-Imaan Ahmed, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Spring 2021
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The work term may include: 

·        Learning the operations of the front retail area 

·       Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients 

·       Understanding how to clinically fit footwear 

·       Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products 

·       Booking appointments 

·       Taking payments 

·       Communicating with insurance providers 

·       Working with a Pedorthist/Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients 

·       Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment 

·       Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient 

·       Sitting in on patient biomechanical assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist 

·       Performing gait assessments 

·       Learning how to cast/measure for orthoses/braces 

·       Learning how to design a foot orthoses
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
·       Kinesiology Students (preferable) or Sciences Students 

Assets: 

Having a car is an asset, but not necessary depending on how closely you're situated to a clinic. Location details can be found on our website www.bioped.com/locations

			- Makayla Fraser, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Winter 2021
			 
			"Prior to this work term, I had never been exposed to the field of Pedorthics and Chiropody and was quite unfamiliar with what these professions have to offer. Working at Bioped has now opened an entirely new perspective of healthcare which I did not consider before. Throughout my time here, I have been able to see and experience first-hand all the hard work that is put in to provide patients with nothing but the most effective solutions to address their problems and concerns. Whether it was through fabrication of orthotics, sitting in on assessments or dealing with customer retail, each day brought a new experience to learn from, which piqued my interest and kept me engaged. Overall, this work term has been a memorable experience working with such a dynamic and innovative team, who all have positively influenced my growth as a kinesiology student."
			 
			-Imaan Ahmed, University of Waterloo Kinesiology Co-op Student, Spring 2021
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
The work term may include: 

·        Learning the operations of the front retail area 

·       Gaining knowledge related to the BioPed Way and how to professionally interact with patients 

·       Understanding how to clinically fit footwear 

·       Learning about various products related to treating patients such as knee braces, compression socks, over the counter products 

·       Booking appointments 

·       Taking payments 

·       Communicating with insurance providers 

·       Working with a Pedorthist/Technician to craft a custom pair of orthotics for yourself and then for patients 

·       Learning how to work with manufacturing equipment 

·       Understanding how to select the most appropriate materials for each condition and patient 

·       Sitting in on patient biomechanical assessments with a Pedorthist and/or Chiropodist 

·       Performing gait assessments 

·       Learning how to cast/measure for orthoses/braces 

·       Learning how to design a foot orthoses

·       Kinesiology Students (preferable) or Sciences Students

Having a car is an asset, but not necessary depending on how closely you're situated to a clinic. Location details can be found on our website www.bioped.com/locations

Game Development Co-op Programmer (Remote) 

 

Blackbird is an independent studio in Vancouver, working with two of the largest publishers on the planet for our upcoming games. On top of our partnerships, we're also developing a completely original game that's going to knock your proverbial socks off. All that said, we can't actually talk about these sweet projects yet. But take our word for it, we're committed to making AAA game experiences and being one of the best game studios to work for. If you're interested in joining a passionate, growing and awesome programming team, apply now!

You will be responsible for the full life cycle of development, from requirements analysis with the design and art team through technical design, implementation, testing and bug fixing. You are guaranteed to learn a lot about software development.

Personal or professional game development experience; profiling and optimization; experience working in teams; experience working with Unity, Unreal, or other professional game engines; participation in game jams; embedded systems experience.

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
At Blackbird, we're all about being true to our roots. We started small in our CEO's garage, and even though we're expanding, our desire is to stick to that foundation of creativity, community, and collaboration. Our team has proved that great ideas can come from any position in any discipline, so it's important to us to make sure every voice is heard. 

 

Work/life balance is extremely important to us, and we've demonstrated that over the years by severely limiting over-time requirements. We want people to be happy about coming to work every day, and to that end we offer lots of opportunities for growth and development-whether it's lunch and learns, team events and flexible schedules. We also try to provide every opportunity possible for our employees to spearhead R&D initiatives through our Black Ops program. In short, don't expect to feel like a cog in a machine working for BBI.

Job Posting Information.Job Category (NOC):: 1122 Professional Occupations in Business Services to Management
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About ApplyBoard 

ApplyBoard is an online platform that empowers students around the world to access the best education. Founded in 2015, ApplyBoard has grown to become the world's largest online platform for international student recruitment, assisting more than 100,000 students with their educational journey.  

  

By connecting international students, recruitment partners, and educational institutions, we simplify the study abroad search, application, and acceptance process through our platform and services. To date, we have built partnerships with 1,200+ educational institutions in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom, and 4,000+ recruitment partners around the world. In 2019, ApplyBoard was named the fastest-growing technology company in Canada by Deloitte, ranking #1 on the Technology Fast 50™ list.  

In May 2020, the company announced it successfully raised C$100M Series C funding on a C$2B valuation, reaching a 'Unicorn' valuation, allowing us to invest heavily in our technology, growing our team, and serving more customers. 

  

Our Team 

Our team of over 1000+ ApplyBoardians (and growing!) is just as diverse as the customers we support. Comprising 27 nationalities, 53 languages spoken, and 50/50 gender parity, diversity is fostered and celebrated on our team. The ApplyBoard headquarters is located in Kitchener, ON Canada, with representatives in 20 countries including India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, Vietnam, the Philippines, the United Kingdom, Mexico, Brazil, and China. 

  

The Role 

The ideal candidate for this role operates optimally in a cross-functional environment, collaborating with a variety of teams to ensure an optimal work environment.  

The role of the Facilities Administrator at ApplyBoard is to provide administration support to the facilities management team. The Administrator ensures that everything behind the scenes is running smoothly and can multi-task with ease.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Key Responsibilities:

 

  
	 
 Maintain the financial administration of the office including: creating PO, reconciling invoices, monitoring expenditures, liaise with the finance team upholding accurate financial record keeping.
	 
 Creating inventory lists and monitoring stock to ensure proper levels of stock are kept and replenished as required.
	 
 Liaising with vendors and suppliers on behalf of the Facilities Manager.
	 
 Creating documentation for policies and procedures relating to the proper operation of the office.
	 
 Monitoring maintenance budget spending
	 
 Preparing for emergencies by creating building evacuation and other action plans
	 
 Logging work tickets for building operators to rectify onsite issues.
	 
 Manage the day-to-day operations of all corporate assets and supply needs including furniture, telecommunications, kitchen appliances, office equipment and supplies, and climate control
	 
 Type minutes with accuracy and circulate in a timely manner. If requested, attend the meeting and minute take.
	 
 Identify and action opportunities for process and office management improvements.
	 
 Maintain knowledge of current and emerging trends in regulations, technologies, techniques and approaches in space planning and allocation.
	 
 Maintain both soft and hard filing systems, ensuring consistency and support management team where required.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Preferred Qualifications:

 

  
	 
 Completion of 1A and 1B terms by start date
	 
 Intermediate proficiency in the use of G Suite and Microsoft Office Suite
	 
 Exceptional organizational skills, strong analytical abilities, detail-oriented and high level of accuracy, and comfort with ambiguity
	 
 Ability to develop and maintain rapport with all organizational levels both internally and with external parties.
	 
 Exceptional problem-solving skills under ambiguous circumstances
	 
 High level of professionalism, diplomacy, and integrity with the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately.
	 
 An independent self-starter who thrives in a collaborative, teamwork environment.
	 
 Flexibility in a fast-paced environment and able to meet multiple deadlines and adapt to new policies and procedures.
	 
 Excellent written communication with the ability to prepare and proofread documents.
	 
 Previous experience of working in a busy demanding environment.
	 
 Previous experience of helpdesk operations or similar support role is desirable.

Job Posting Information.Job Title:: Full Stack Web Developer (Embedded Machine Vision)
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Reports To: Director of Engineering 

  

Organizational Profile:  Arcturus Networks Inc. is a privately held Canadian company that develops embedded hardware and software solutions for the industrial and commercial marketplace, utilizing open source and proprietary software.  The company develops in-house designed hardware platforms targeted as embedded, industrial-grade server or end-point modules, for use in audio communications, analytics and control, video surveillance and IOT applications in various industry verticals. Our customers are typically industrial application developers, manufacturers and OEM's who integrate our modules or platforms into their specific applications.  

  

Role Profile:  We are looking for highly skilled and motivated students to participate in the development of a new state-of-the-art Embedded Machine Vision System. We have developed two new hardware platforms targeted for small form factor, highly integrated, ruggedized and efficient industrial IoT and surveillance end-point devices. The smart embedded systems will incorporate IO and network peripheral integration, video surveillance, video analytics and machine vision algorithms for the purpose of public safety and threat detection use cases.  The candidate will have the opportunity to be a major contributor to this project and will obtain tremendous experience in the areas of Machine Vision, Machine Learning and embedded system-level development.  

 

Please visit our website www.arcturusnetworks.com to learn more about our company.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities:: Design and develop highly interactive embedded web frontend and backend interfaces for realtime video streaming, machine vision event detection and data analytics presentation
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Required Experience

 

  
	 
 Proficient experience is required in the general areas of full-stack software development:

	 
  
    
		 
   Full stack experience (frontend, backend, database, automated testing, deployment)
		 
   Experience building real-time web applications (nodejs, socket.io)
		 
   Experience with frontend frameworks, preferably React and Redux
		 
   Experience creating well documented and tested APIs
		 
   Good understanding of SQL (Postgres), NoSQL (MongoDB), and time series (InfluxDB) databases
		 
   Experience deploying stacks using containerization technologies (docker-compose, k8s)
		 
   Linux Development experience
		 
   Extensive use of source control tools (such as Mercurial, Git, Subversion) 
		 
   Multi-threaded and distributed software applications (advanced design experience)
		 
   Inter-process communications 
		 
   Familiarity with TCP/UDP protocols, as well as TLS and IP security
	 
  
	
	 
 Interest and passion in the following areas is required:
	 
  
    
		 
   Image processing and machine vision
		 
   Full stack software development
		 
   Integration into embedded systems
	 
  
	
 

The candidate should have completed a minimum of two years towards a B Sc. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Software Engineering  

  

Overall Required Skills

 

  
	 
 Strong development experience under Linux and embedded environments
	 
 Intimate knowledge of how to build inter-process communication and multithreaded applications
	 
 Strong experience developing backend applications 
	 
 Strong development experience with web frameworks
	 
 Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
	 
 Ability to work within teams as well as independently
	 
 Self-starter, highly motivated engineer
	 
 Ability to interact effectively with engineers of various disciplines as well as with customers, partners, marketing, sales and management
	 
 Demonstrate initiative, responsibility and care to improve quality and processes
	 
 Quality conscious, constantly looking for improvements in self, product and process

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Are you the kind of engineer who loves to read about new technology and finds themselves immediately going from, "how do they do that?" to "I could do that better."? Do you want to be more than a cog in the machine, and instead take ownership over projects that will create a real impact on a growing business? If so, then this is the perfect opportunity for you to combine your engineering theories, creativity, and design ability on your path to becoming the engineer you want to be! 

 

AOMS is a fast growing, scaling start-up and we are looking for a creative and entrepreneurial R&D Engineer to join our Toronto office. You will work directly within the Engineering R&D team as well as collaborate with suppliers and subcontractors to help develop the next generation of fiber optic systems for extreme environments. 

 

Your opportunity at a glance:

 

  
	 
 Be a part of IoT revolution using cutting edge sensor technologies
	 
 A fun, collaborative, and creative environment
	 
 An opportunity to learn and grow with the team
	 
 A startup backed by major industry players
 

 

About AOMS Technologies: 

Our vision is to revolutionize the Industrial IoT world with advanced sensing technologies. 

 

We believe in a world of highly connected network of devices providing insightful analytics for stakeholders, customers, and users alike. We are backed by leading industrial investors and are looking for talented individuals like you to be part of our exciting growth phase.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
About you:
			
			
			You are relentlessly curious. You want to design and evaluate cutting-edge technology, applying concepts in engineering and physics to design better products. You want ownership over your work and to make meaningful contributions in a high-tech startup environment. You are always working to improve and grow, and you have a proven track record of execution.
			
			Responsibilities:

			 
    
      
				 
     Design the next generation of optical data acquisition (ODAQ) systems
				 
     Design ruggedized sensors for testing in extreme environments
				 
     Research, evaluate, and recommend novel sensing technologies for integration with the ODAQ platform
				 
     Build prototype using desktop CNC machine (we have a Shapeoko XL), 3D printer (we have a FormLabs Form 2), and various machine tools
				 
     Develop the validation test requirements for new and existing products and oversee the execution of test plans
				 
     Execute detailed mechanical design, CAD modelling, prototyping, validation, design improvement and documentation etc., to deliver reliable products for the most unreliable of conditions
				 
     Lead tasks relating to drafting specifications, RFQ, and supply chain coordination
				 
     Coordinate with suppliers to develop work plans and prepare bill of materials
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Our ideal candidate:

			 
    
      
				 
     Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree in Mechatronics, Systems, Mechanical, or Nanotechnology Engineering
				 
     Experienced with CAD modelling - SolidWorks, SolidWorks PDM
				 
     Proficient with prototyping - machining, 3D printing, etc
				 
     Hands-on: able to use solder electrical components, assemble component into an enclosure, hacking hardware systems using hand tools
				 
     Experienced with Python or C++
				 
     Experienced with Linux operating system
				 
     Knowledge in version control software - Git
				 
     Can-do attitude, self-driven and proactive, with an entrepreneurial spirit
				 
     Ability to prioritize workload and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
				 
     Strong verbal/written communications skills with demonstrated ability to clearly document experimental procedures and results
				 
     Strong analytical skills, attention to detail
				 
     Strong aptitude in mechanical and electrical system
				 
     Familiarity or working knowledge of electromagnetics and optics
