Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Service Delivery & Operations Specialist Intern (remote) 

 

AppDirect enables today's digital leaders with unlimited options to quickly innovate how digital services are bought and sold in ways they simply can't do themselves. We do this by being a value-driven company with one goal ? to be the leading commerce company for technology merchants. Join us today. Be seen. Be yourself. Do your best work 

 

As a Service Delivery & Operations Specialist intern you will be part of our AppHelp Support Services Team, where you will support and contribute to the day-to-day operations for key strategic programs.  If you're not sure what Service Delivery is, here's a quick breakdown: we provide technical support and cloud services to a range of service providers (think Telus or Comcast, O365 or Google Apps for example) using software that we develop in-house.  Put simply, service delivery is the step in between the provider and the agent you would speak to when you need tech support. End of your work term probably you can also call yourself a Business Process Outsourcing Expert!
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Here is what your day might look like: 

*  Interact with our Customer support team by evaluating interactions, providing feedback and initiating process improvements based on your findings. 

*  Work closely with our outsourced partners and internal Service delivery Performance Specialist to achieve would class operational standard 

*  Use our in-house technology to design tools aimed at maximizing efficiency. 

*  Monitor productivity by analyzing data, creating reports and presenting information to stakeholders ? having in-depth knowledge of Excel will be a massive asset here. 

*  Support exciting program launches, from project initiation (concept) to operational optimization (reality). 

*  Contribute to strategic planning sessions with a view to increasing revenue and reducing costs 

*  Look into current forecasting and labor requirement processes and provide recommendation for cost effective resource management in line with budget 

*  Analyze operational KPIs and provide deep analysis when necessary to test hypotheses that affect our understanding of programs and their delivery 

*  Analyze telephone/chat platform reports to have better understanding of current state and provide recommendation to achieve better occupancy/efficiency 

*  Work closely with the AppDirect Senior Performance Specialist to drive work class technical customer support services. 

*  Ensure ontime credential management for frontline tech support teams by owning the AppHelp Service Desk
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
You are: 

A student in Business Management, Business Analytics, Operations Management or related discipline, with one or more internships (or relevant work experience) already under your belt.
 

  
	 
 Resourceful - you will work on the same projects as the rest of your team members, and will have to use the tools at your disposal to deliver on your tasks.
	 
 Quick-to-learn - you may be unfamiliar with some of the technologies we use, and that's okay. What matters is that you get up to speed fast.
	 
 Collaborative - you are keen to learn from those around you, but you're not afraid to offer up your own opinion too.
	 
 Proactive - not only do you complete projects as required, you go further to explore the possibilities of the given technology/programming language in order to enhance or improve the end product.
	 
 Innovative - you like to approach things from a different perspective and are good at problem-solving.
	 
 Data Driven - you like to dig deep. You love analyzing large sets of data and you are proud of your Ms Excel, Ms powerpoint etc skill.

Hourly pay is between 17- 22 CAD/hr based on your skills and academic seniority, 40 hours/week confirmed.
	 
  
    
		 
   We prefer 8 months work term avilibility.

Application Information.Additional Application Information::
Here is what your day might look like:

 

  
	 
 Interact with our Customer support team by evaluating interactions, providing feedback and initiating process improvements based on your findings.
	 
 Be the link between the service provider and the end user.
	 
 Use our in-house technology to design tools aimed at maximizing efficiency.
	 
 Monitor productivity by analyzing data, creating reports and presenting information to stakeholders - having in-depth knowledge of Excel will be a massive asset here.
	 
 Support exciting program launches, from project initiation (concept) to operational optimization (reality).
	 
 Contribute to strategic planning sessions with a view to increasing revenue and reducing costs
	 
 Look into current forecasting and labour requirement processes and provide recommendation for cost effective resource management in line with budget
	 
 Analyze operational KPIs and provide deep analysis when necessary to test hypotheses that affect our understanding of programs and their delivery
	 
 Analyze telephone/chat platform reports to have better understanding of current state and provide recommendation to achieve better occupancy/efficiency
	 
 Monitor and analyze customer interactions to drive world class technical customer support service. 
 

The experience you'll get: 

At AppHelp, we understand the importance of internships. We get that each internship is intended to give you practical, real world experience that sets you up for your career. That's exactly what our service delivery specialist internship offers. You won't learn by watching; you'll learn by getting involved in real projects, experimenting, putting new, innovative ideas on the table and bringing them to life. Unlike other intern positions you might have done in the past, you will not be "THE INTERN" but rather, a valued team member in the service delivery department whose thoughts, insights and contributions will be valued in the same way as other full-time staff. And you'll do all this getting plenty of exposure and support from seasoned mentors. 

 

Need a little more convincing? 

You are going to get great experience: Hackathons, ownership of projects, seasoned mentors, new technologies? 

 

If you want a glimpse into what it's like to work here, some of our previous interns had this to say: http://bit.ly/1VzYh2Z. Feel free to check us out on the AppHelp Careers Facebook page, on Twitter, Instagram and on our blog, https://www.apphelp.com/blog.

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
Amphenol Canada Corp. is a subsidiary of Amphenol Corporation of Wallingford, Connecticut and is exclusively dedicated to the development, manufacturing and marketing of connector systems for both the aerospace and commercial market segments. The successful candidates for this position will be involved with high speed, filtered, harsh environment or power connectors for major electronics companies such as Cisco, HP, Ericsson, Dell and others. 

  

General Description 

The ideal candidate will be detailed oriented and mechanically inclined. Experience in Solidworks modelling would also be helpful for portions of the work. The primary work objective in this term will be assisting with the testing and validation of connector samples which will undergo environmental, electrical and mechanical conditions during the course of a testing protocol. Students need to be detail oriented, self-motivated and thorough in their work. There will be some opportunity to assist with some 3D modeling as well as 2D drawing preparation. 

  

There is some autonomy within the boundaries of the tasks assigned. Performance will be measured by the quality of work in collecting data in an organized manner, computer entry of measurement data and the timely and accurate completion of tasks. Opportunity for future growth and advancement could be a permanent position at Amphenol as a design or quality engineer.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Job Duties:

 

  
	 
 Assist in preparation of test samples.
	 
 Assist QA lab staff in qualification testing which includes sample preparation, measurement and report compilation.
	 
 Prepare 3D sales models & drawings for existing or proposed connectors and/or fixtures
	 
 Other related duties as required.
 

Experience Gained:

 

  
	 
 Excellent technical test lab exposure.
	 
 Some experience with 3D modeling and drawing preparations.
	 
 Exposure to the development cycle of new product designs for customer applications.
	 
 Guidance and consultation from experienced supervisors.
	 
 Working in a detail oriented environment.
	 
 Skill in managing shifting of priorities.
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Requirements 

  

Must Have:

 

  
	 
 Detail oriented and organized
	 
 Solidworks (or similar 3D modelling software) experience
	 
 Some 2D drawing skills
	 
 Software skills (Word, Excel, Outlook)
	 
 Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities.
	 
 Excellent communication skills 
 

  

Desired:

 

  
	 
 Knowledge of electronics industry
	 
 Exposure to manufacturing processes and environment
	 
 Knowledge of connectors and small components
	 
 ISO 9001, RoHS, Priority Management, WHMIS experience or training
 

 

General:

 

  
	 
 Must abide by all Health and Safety Rules and demonstrate a commitment to good housekeeping and organizational practises.
	 
 Responsible for adhering to company standards.
	 
 Maintain a good working relationship with others.
	 
 Strive for continuous improvement in all aspects of the work environment including participation in teamwork, interdepartmental co-operation and training required.

Job Posting Information.Special Job Requirements::
BlackBerry recruitment timelines do not correspond to the University of Waterloo's. The employer has requested that available positions be advertised outside our established recruitment timelines. Deadline to apply: 25th January 2022, 9am.  

 

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).
Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
POSITION SUMMARY 

 

The BlackBerry IoT Business Unit combines BlackBerry's core IoT assets across the company, including the BTS (QNX, Jarvis, Certicom, Radar) and BlackBerry IVY, which is an edge-first secure and intelligent in-vehicle data platform that provides automakers with cloud-controlled access to vehicle data in order to produce and share insights consistently with a global digital ecosystem of developers to deliver actionable value on vehicle data at scale. The BlackBerry IVY Product Management and Ecosystem organization is focused on developing and delivering on this vision of BlackBerry IVY through delivery of software and services that will be used by vehicle OEMs and also the broader development community worldwide.   

We are looking for candidates in a variety of roles including software developers & testers, researchers, product managers & project managers, quality control & technical content specialists, and more. Successful candidates will work towards the common goal of delivering innovative new technologies to ensure BlackBerry IVY delivers on its vision. This role is an opportunity to work as an integral part of the IVY Product Management and Ecosystem team. In addition to contributing to the overall strategy within BlackBerry IVY, the Product Management team is responsible for building and driving a roadmap, and working with our development team to move technology deliverables through our development process to full lifecycle management. 

The candidate will help define the vision and execution of the BlackBerry IVY product roadmap. Key activities will include supporting team members throughout the processes of requirements management, competitive research, entry, and assisting in product definition with the responsible Product Manager's guidance. The successful candidate will be a key contributor to feature definition, development and delivery of new features and concepts in future technologies, and will have the ability to shadow an established Product Manager on the team to learn the "Product Management Trade" and get valuable experience working with different teams globally. 

 

Location: Waterloo, ON 

Length of Term: 4 or 8 months
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
RESPONSIBILITIES 

 

Competitive market analysis of relevant application, technology and feature offerings 

Researching and writing product requirements for current and future BlackBerry software technologies 

Managing the development of technology within the BlackBerry IVY development process - from idea to proof-of-concept stage, including feature definition, implementation, and go-to-market strategy development as required 

Prioritizing work efforts with development, design and test engineering teams to ensure the right experiences and features are delivered on time and to specification, including direct engagement in our Agile development process as a Product Owner if feasible 

Opportunity identification for new BlackBerry software features, applications, and services 

Deep analysis of what features or portions of a feature bring true user benefit and analyze potential trade-offs/risks to implementing new features
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS 

 

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or MBA degree with deep technology focus preferred 

Passionate about customer experience and understanding user needs 

Strong organizational, data gathering and analytical skills 

Excellent written and oral communication skills 

 

ADDITIONAL ASSETS 

 

Deep interest in creating and analyzing products 

Strong problem-solving skills 

Ability to prioritize and meet deadlines 

Experience in AI (artificial intelligence) and machine learning, cyber security solutions, or with connected vehicles are considered assets

Job Posting Information.Job Summary::
About Dolphyn 

Dolphyn is an all-in-one workspace to analyze data and build machine learning models. We give our users lego blocks that make it dramatically easier to do anything from simple data explorations, to building and deploying full out ML models. From there they can share & collaborate with others and even deploy as APIs. We've been moving quickly since we closed our seed late last year from tier A investors in the valley, including early investors/board members at Figma, and angels/execs from Opendoor, Carta, Github etc.  

 

As a front-end engineering co-op, you will be working on our customer facing web app, building features that delight and dramatically improve data analysis workflows.
Job Posting Information.Job Responsibilities::
Befriend our customers and deeply understand how they navigate and use the Dolphyn workspace
	 
 Use the data you've collected and pour it into a product to build a delightful user experience that's intuitive and fun to use
	 
 Create new UI components that data analysts and scientists would love to have in their arsenal (statistical tests, data quality, powerful charting/viz, etc)
	 
 Build out new components and UX into the product
	 
 Update existing components visual styling and add new properties
	 
 Build out live collaboration to allow engineers and business partners to work together
Job Posting Information.Required Skills::
Able to discuss and debate strategic engineering/product/design decisions live
	 
 Have some experience in professional front-end development working with Javascript/Typescript, Vue/React, Styled Components, CSS3, HTML5, modern JS tooling (Webpack/Babel/etc.) and testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress), Docker, Nginx, Github/Github Actions
	 
 You've built scalable, flexible & reusable libraries and components
	 
 A strong product thinker with an eye for delightful UI/UX

Company will provide a macbook
	 
 Downtown Toronto office location
	 
 Regular team events
